Don't bother to enjoy Online gameplay in public lobbies. Modders will do every annoying thing to mess with random people. They will change your car modifications, apartment and any other property interior and other details that you've spend in-game money and essentially time on. Rockstars tolerance towards cheating is unmatched. So, there are 3 options: be a cheater yourself, only play with a friend group in invite-only sessions or download a FiveM. In my experience, worst than Battlefield V cheating-wise.

Grand Theft Auto V isn't just a game, it's a cultural phenomenon, a testament to the boundless creativity of the human spirit. So grab your controller or keyboard, buckle up, and prepare for the ride of a lifetime, because GTA 5 is an experience that'll stay with you long after the credits roll.

Alright, listen up gamers because Grand Theft Auto V is not just a game, it's a whole freaking experience! Picture this: a sprawling, open-world city just waiting for you to explore, cause chaos, and live out your wildest criminal fantasies. From heart-pounding heists to epic car chases and everything in between, GTA V throws you into a world where the possibilities are endless. And let's not forget the characters - they're like something out of a blockbuster movie, each with their own story and personality. Oh, and did I mention the online mode? It's like stepping into a virtual playground with your friends, causing mayhem together or competing in wild challenges. Seriously, if you haven't played GTA V yet, what are you waiting for? Get ready to unleash chaos and have the time of your life!

a time capsule to ~2011, the younger Millennial/elder Zoomer's holy grail containing precious sips of a demented but still nostalgia worthy past some distance from release a lot of the social commentary is needlessly acerbic (thanks brits; let's see Paul Allen's vitriol about contemporary UK "culture") and hasn't held up well but it's lush and as coated in it as the billboard laden west coast highways from which the game's well-researched setting and landscape spring from Online? Online Gaming? Gaming Online? GTAO is still a hollow mess but the sheer joy of mucking around in the game engine with the boys carries it through. support your local hacker alhamdulillah

Title: "GTA 5: The Great Account Heist - An Epic Fail-o-rama!"  Review:  ⭐️☆☆☆☆  "Welcome to the thrilling world of GTA 5, where the only heist happening is Rockstar stealing access to the game you paid for! Strap in, folks, because this is a rollercoaster ride of frustration and disbelief.  So, there I was, ready to dive into the criminal underworld with my trusty mouse and keyboard, only to discover that my access pass was kidnapped by the nefarious Rockstar account. It's like buying a ticket to the movies, but the usher locks the theater door, and the popcorn machine is guarded by a grumpy troll demanding a secret handshake that I've long forgotten.  Attempting to rescue my game from the clutches of the elusive Rockstar account was like trying to outsmart a criminal mastermind, only this time the criminal mastermind is a forgotten email address. I sent messages to customer support, and their response time made the speed of a snail on a leisurely Sunday stroll seem like a bullet train.  GTA 5 now sits in my Steam library like an untouchable gangster surrounded by a digital forcefield. I can almost hear it taunting me, "You can look, but you can't touch, sucker!"  Rockstar, you've turned my virtual crime spree into a tragic comedy of errors. It's not Grand Theft Auto; it's Grand Theft My Sanity. I half expect to see my character in-game, standing on a virtual street corner with a sign that reads, 'Will work for access to my own game.'  In conclusion, fellow gamers, if you enjoy a good caper, make sure it's within the game itself and not a digital battle to reclaim access to what you've rightfully purchased. As for Rockstar, I hope they find their moral compass – it's probably hidden in a forgotten password vault guarded by virtual dragons."  Message @Mutis ﻿      to select

To show how much I love this game - I played for around 350~ hours before I even bothered to play through the story. It is such an incredibly fun game, and I didn't expect how captivating the story would be. I just finished the entire story for the first time and am immediately restarting the game to play through it again.  I cannot recommend this game enough. Online mode is a little wacky, but still fun. And singleplayer was absolutely incredible. I don't remember a time when a game made me feel just this hard for its characters.  Absolutely one of my favourite games of all time. I thought people were overhyping it, but it's honestly not hyped up enough.

It is unfortunate that an advanced cheat provider who purchased the complete source code of Grand Theft Auto V from a leaker would develop cheats that far exceed the anti-cheats of the GTAV developers. They can crash on the computers of players they don't like, they can corrupt data, and they can even corrupt cloud-saved data if they can hack into the cloud. The only version of this game that has been popular and successful is the console version. In the PC version, there is always at least one modder in every session. GTAV has events, and depending on the cheats used by the modder, they can irreversibly corrupt an entire session and potentially have a negative impact on performance. A good friend of ours has unraveled why only PCs experience casino robberies and other heists and unusual events within a session. The modder is unknowingly inhibiting script events and network events necessary for activity in the session with the functionality of the protection section in the mod menu he is using. Did you see empty roads with NPC cars completely gone in your session? Did you enter a robbery or mission and get stuck in an endless loading loop and eventually get kicked out of the mission with a network error? Crashes despite being on a very high end computer? Did you become unable to walk, lose your weapon, or switch weapons when in the same session with a particular player? No, all of these are not coincidental. Behind those major errors and supposed bugs, ignorant modders are interfering with the scripting and networking events necessary to keep the session active and maintained. The session is not well controlled and can be destroyed. Rockstar Games removed 95% of its anti-cheat content around late 2023 because the source code for the Rockstar anti-cheat was leaked. The remaining 5% of the anti-cheat is probably the part that Rockstar really cares about, protecting Rockstar's profits and game logic, which validates the amount of money given in money drops and missions. I for one am not holding my breath for GTA6.  Because Rockstar Games was looking for technicians who are familiar with networking related issues when they were looking for technicians. I am sure GTA VI will also use P2P connections. Rockstar Games is a garbage company that only cares about money, not players' opinions! Get the hell out of business??

This easy chocolate snack cake recipe by Brenda Venable is perfect when you're craving a quick chocolate treat. It's a simple and versatile recipe that can be shared or enjoyed solo. The prep time is 10 minutes, cooking time is 30 minutes, and cooling time is 15 minutes, with a total time of 55 minutes. The recipe yields 24 servings.  **Ingredients:** - 2 cups all-purpose flour - 2 cups white sugar - 1/2 cup cocoa - 2 teaspoons baking powder - 1 teaspoon baking soda - 1 teaspoon salt - 2 cups boiling water - 1/2 cup softened butter - 2 large eggs, lightly beaten - 2 teaspoons vanilla extract - 1 cup chopped nuts (optional) - 1/4 cup powdered sugar (optional)  **Directions:** 1. Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C) and grease a 9x13-inch baking dish. 2. In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Mix thoroughly. 3. Mix boiling water and butter until melted; cool for 5 minutes. Slowly add eggs while stirring briskly, then stir in vanilla. 4. Add the wet mixture to the dry mixture and beat for about 2 minutes. Stir in nuts, if using. 5. Pour batter into the prepared pan and bake in the center of the oven for 30-35 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted comes out clean. 6. Cool completely on a wire rack for 15 minutes. Dust the cake with powdered sugar using a mesh sieve or sifter, if desired. Cut into squares and serve.

The single player for this is about what you'd expect for GTA. The mechanics are pretty tight.  The online part of the game is where they put the burnt of their effort for the past ten years, and that's really good.  However, Rockstar really do things by half measures. As it stands, the PS5/Xbox One X version of the game has loads of content they just never ported to PC, the online content never made it to the single player, making it a vastly inferior experience, and even small quality of life things, like setting defaults for the weapon wheel, have never been implemented in the online mode.  You'd think that with the crunch culture and worker exploitation they practice, they'd have the time :|  As it stands, I'd say, if you want to play the Online mode, play on PS5.

Arguably upsetting... Grand Theft Auto V, was amazing in 2013. But that's just it... 2013.  It's 2024, still has a lot of playability, but GTA: Online [b][i]ruined[/i][/b] Grand Theft Auto V. And it's all thanks to the general public. We could have had a few singeplayer DLCs, but instead we got Shark Cards. The people spoke with their wallet and Take-Two listened. Unfortunate, especially considering now GTA: Online is virtually unplayable thanks to negligence. I would've recommended it a long time ago, but if you're not interested in singleplayer, don't touch this game.  Edit:\\ Play it on console if you want to play online.

A Timeless Classic: Grand Theft Auto V  My journey with the Grand Theft Auto franchise began in 2016 when I was first introduced to GTA 5 at my friend's house. Watching him skillfully evade the police, diving into storm drains, ignited my fascination with the game. Back then, I owned an Xbox 360 E, a Christmas gift from 2014. Surprisingly, GTA 5 wasn't my first encounter with the series; that honor belonged to GTA San Andreas on the PS2, emulated through PCSX2. I vividly recall cruising around, soaking in the open-world experience. Later, I delved into GTA 4, experimenting with mods and further immersing myself in the franchise. Despite not fully engaging with the story mode, I was undeniably hooked. After watching all the cutscenes of GTA 5, I knew I had to play it. On December 21st, 2016, at the age of 13, I finally acquired a copy for my Xbox 360, albeit under the alias Franklin Clinton, as my mum wasn't keen on me playing a PEGI 18 game. Unfortunately, a damaged disc led me to purchase the digital version, marking the start of my story mode journey, which took me nine months to complete. In 2018, I received an Xbox One for Christmas, reigniting my passion for GTA 5. Transitioning to the newer console was bittersweet, especially with the closure of Xbox 360 servers, where I had amassed considerable wealth. However, the lure of enhanced graphics and gameplay on the Xbox One was undeniable. The year 2020 brought an unexpected gift when GTA 5 became available for free on the Epic Games Store. With my recent GPU upgrade to an Nvidia GTX 1650 Super, I seized the opportunity, knowing the game would run smoothly on my system. Fast forward to the present, and I've conquered the story mode on Xbox 360, Xbox One, and PC. Now, with the game on Series S, the thrill continues. Watching YouTuber VideoKames navigate through her first playthrough of the game was a delight, especially knowing that even Ned Luke, the voice actor for Michael, was tuning in. Grand Theft Auto V holds a special place in my heart, its missions never failing to evoke a smile or laughter. As I eagerly await Rockstar Games' next masterpiece, GTA 6, I know my love for this game will endure. Framing my GTA V map and hanging it on my wall will serve as a testament to the countless memories and joy it has brought me.   P.S. The PC version lacks the love and support seen in the current generation consoles. Despite having the ability for mods, I'm not a fan of how GTA Roleplay has overtaken what made this game special. Nevertheless, Grand Theft Auto V is a masterpiece, and Rockstar Games should be proud of their accomplishment.

Rub salt all over the chicken. Let it stay for 15 minutes. Heat the oil in a cooking pot. Prepare the batter. Start by pressing a fork on the chicken cube until it is completely squashed. Combine it with warm milk. Stir until well blended. Set aside. Combine flour, baking powder, garlic powder, salt, and ground black pepper. Mix well using a fork or a wire whisk. Set aside. Beat the eggs in a large mixing bowl. Add the milk mixture. Continue to beat until all the ingredients are all incorporated. Add half of flour mixture. Whisk. Add the remaining half and whisk until the texture of the batter becomes smooth. Dredge the chicken in flour and then dip in batter. Roll it again in flour until completely covered. Fry in medium heat for 7 minutes per side. Remove from the pot and put in a plate lined with paper towel. This will absorb the oil. Serve with ketchup or gravy. Share and enjoy!

Immersive and Vast Open World: GTA 5 offers an extraordinary scope with its vast open world, allowing players to explore the fictional city of Los Santos and its surroundings. The game provides a highly detailed and realistic environment, filled with various activities, missions, and hidden secrets .  Engaging Gameplay: The gameplay of GTA 5 is highly engaging and offers a wide range of activities for players to enjoy. From thrilling missions to engaging in various criminal activities, players have the freedom to choose their own path and play the game at their own pace .  Memorable Moments: GTA 5 is known for creating memorable moments that stick with players long after they have finished playing. Whether it's hijacking a plane mid-air, engaging in intense car chases, or stumbling upon unexpected encounters while exploring the vast world, the game offers countless exciting and unforgettable experiences. Detailed Graphics: The game's graphics are highly detailed, creating a visually stunning and immersive experience. From the realistic depiction of the city to the intricate character models, GTA 5's graphics contribute to the overall enjoyment of the game  .Extensive Multiplayer Mode: GTA Online, the multiplayer mode of GTA 5, provides endless opportunities for players to indulge in their criminal fantasies while also competing against other players. The mode offers various activities, missions, and customization options, making it a highly engaging and dynamic experience . Overall, GTA 5 has been praised for its immersive open world, engaging gameplay, memorable moments, detailed graphics, and extensive multiplayer mode. It continues to captivate players and remains one of the most popular and successful games of all time

Even though I don't play it as often these days, this game holds such a special place in my heart. It's not just about the missions or the cars; it's about the moments spent with friends, hustling together to afford those dream rides. There's something about cruising in first-person mode, especially when it's raining outside or as the sun sets, with the radio playing in the background—it feels like I'm right there in the moment.  I've never really explored private servers; I've heard they can be iffy, and using accelerators for foreign ones isn't my thing either. So, I stick to the official servers. I got into this game back in high school, and now, here I am in my sophomore year of college. While I used to get tired of it quickly, as life has gotten busier, this game has become my sanctuary, a place to escape to when things get overwhelming.  It's more than just a game to me; it's a timeless escape. I'm eagerly awaiting GTA 6, and I have faith that Rockstar will keep pushing the boundaries and giving us even more ways to immerse ourselves in their worlds. That's the beauty of gaming—creating these unforgettable adventures.

look... the game is fun. Incredibly fun! The story is great, and if you don't know how the game ends by now, either you play with cheats only, or you've been living under a rock. or both. The only complaint i have is for online and the people who play it. Some people are there to have a good time, they'll race around the city, talk, and generally they're good fun. That's the kind of person you friend on social club and do jobs with. Then there's the other crowd. Modders, griefers, and trolls. These people intend to make life hell for any online player regardless of who it is. There are some cases where you meet modders who will give you money and RP to allow you to have more fun in GTA's online without wasting your own money, but these people are few and far between. If you run into any of the group (save for a good modder) your best bet is to block the player on social club and find a new lobby. If you do meet a modder who will give you money, you would be advised to friend them to hopefully gain as much money as possible.

My go-to game when I've had enough of the real world and want to escape reality for some time. Expands well upon that one mechanic every other GTA title missed - immersion. Drive around the posh Vinewood streets looking for exotic sports cars or explore the Grand Senora Desert and expect random encounters with muggers or hitchhikers, or take a U-turn and climb Mt. Chiliad, to feel on top of the world. The game comes with endless hours of game play even after completing all the missions, and the first-person mode coupled with your own tracks makes even aimless driving feel fun. The only downside is the wanted level system, which activates even when you stealthily kill a random NPC in the middle of the desert in the dead of the night. Nevertheless, the game is efficiently optimized on all its ports, which allows it to run even on low-end machines. The game play physics is spectacular, but in no way you must expect it to be near real-life since GTA V's not supposed to be a simulation game. In the end, this game will make you forget all your real-life problems for a while, as you step into the shoes of either Franklin, Michael or Trevor and feel the Los Santos sensation.

I played the crap out of this on Xbox and was excited for the steam experience when I built my PC but man, little did I know of the pain & misery that was waiting when I got into an online open lobby.   I've only ever modded Minecraft & Terraria and that has been a limited experience as I don't get the same value or fulfillment as others do, after so many hours I become bored, it's not the real experience & it's just not my thing to hack or mod.   Every regular lobby will have one or more people running hacks or some mod so they can't die or blow up. I just got on after months because of the same situation. I try to mess around in a normal lobby only to run into someone that is invincible. It never fails!!! Then of course I go to another lobby only for the same thing to happen again leading to me eventually getting off the game after just being on for under 1 HOUR!!!   The main hours I've put in on steam are for doing heists or something that doesn't involve others, which has completely taken away from making friends. joining crews & just in general trying to play the game normal like how I did on console, I'm at the point where I am truly questioning why I even try to play this on PC.  Rockstar really failed with the Steam version of this Online game-play. I truly hope GTA VI will be an improvement but I highly doubt it, so I'm not holding my breath and plan to return to Xbox for the next game so I can avoid the pathetic trolls & no lives of the "PC World"

Primary reasons you'd play: [h3]Story and Characters, Gameplay and Mechanics, Community and Multiplayer[/h3]  My rating scale: top score is the best (ex. 5/5), bottom score is the worst (ex. 0/5).  [h3]Graphics and Visuals[/h3] ☐ I'm not in Kansas anymore, Toto! ☑ PC Master Race ☐ Good (for the era) ☐ Like staring at toast ☐ MS-DOS  [h3]Sound and Music[/h3] ☐ Close your eyes and you're there ☑ Tunes you'll hum in the shower ☐ Not Grammy-worthy ☐ Bleeps and bloops ☐ Mute button fodder  [h3]Gameplay and Mechanics[/h3] ☐ Just one more level...for the 20th time ☑ Engaging ☐ Fun ☐ Press button to win ☐ Would rather organize my sock drawer  [h3]Story and Characters[/h3] ☑ HBO ☐ You'll forget snacks exist ☐ Netflix ☐ Some lore ☐ Amazon Prime  [h3]Performance and Optimization[/h3] ☐ Computer may catch fire ☐ The sweet spot ☑ Decent ☐ An easy 60fps ☐ Requires potato  [h3]Bugs and Glitches[/h3] ☐ Experienced no issues ☑ Minor bugs, completely playable ☐ A bit annoying ☐ Is this still early access? ☐ Basically an ant farm  [h3]Difficulty and Balance[/h3] ☐ Grandpa's level 80 ☑ Easy ☐ Requires a bit of brain/skill ☐ Battlefield against hackers ☐ Dark Souls II  [h3]Grind and Progression[/h3] ☐ No grinding ☑ Isn't necessary ☐ Impacts unlocks, rank, or leader-boards ☐ Average grind, but enjoyable ☐ Quit your job and buy an auto-clicker ☐ Dodge 200 lightning strikes for 20 hours  [h3]Community and Multiplayer[/h3] ☐ Friendly neighbourhood ☑ Acceptable if you ignore chat (with some hackers in online play) ☐ Salt and cringe ☐ Hackers and screechers ☐ Not online  [h3]Replayability[/h3] ☑ Cry and clap until they come back on stage ☐ You'll forget other games exist ☐ Thank-you, come again ☐ Once is enough; twice is a nightmare ☐ Wouldn't finish it the first time  [h3]Game Time and Content[/h3] ☐ Please don't check my play time ☑ Delete your other games, you'll be busy ☐ Average ☐ At least longer than a movie ☐ Would disappoint your mom  [h3]Overall Enjoyment[/h3] ☐ 5/5 My retirement home better have wifi ☑ 4/5 Haven't put it down yet ☐ 3/5 Might play again ☐ 2/5 Should have bought pizza instead ☐ 1/5 Asked for a refund ☐ 0/5 Asked to be paid for my time   [h3]For context, my favourite games of all time include[/h3] Counter-Strike, Rocket League, modded Minecraft, GTA, modded Cities Skylines, old Final Fantasy, Asheron's Call, WoW Classic, and Battlefield. This game is wonderful, and tons of fun with friends. The quintessential crime simulator, and it's just as good as anyone else will say it is. I will definitely continue playing it with friends for quite a long time and encourage you to also give it a try. That being said, I've encountered a few big issues which I think really hurt it.  1. It's intended for multiplayer. Not necessarily a bad thing until you see that for some missions or businesses, you have to use multiple separate vehicles. It turns what could just be a simple longer mission into an enormous headache over traveling, backtracking, and doing the same trip 3 times.   2. The controls are inconsistent and were imagined by a thrice-lobotomized maniac. Sometimes, it's E. Other times, it's enter. Sometimes they make you use backspace, but then the escape key is needed. I was forced to agonize over delivering one package until I learned that that key they were prompting me was not enter nor backspace, but suddenly the RIGHT ARROW KEY.  3. SecuroServ bodyguards pay 100% OF MONEY THEY WOULD HAVE EARNED TO THEIR VIP (Non-mission/business one-off income was observed, but I haven't tested further). There is no toggle. This is not disclosed. I am now indebted to my friend because we wanted to to jobs in a group together.

Grand Theft Auto V (GTA 5) stands as a true testament to the brilliance of Rockstar Games, setting a new standard for open-world gaming that few titles can match. Released in 2013, the game continues to captivate players with its unparalleled combination of gripping storytelling, immersive gameplay, and a meticulously crafted virtual world that oozes with detail.  The narrative unfolds through the eyes of three distinct protagonists – Michael, Franklin, and Trevor – each with their own unique personalities, backgrounds, and motivations. This innovative storytelling approach allows players to experience the narrative from multiple perspectives, creating a rich and dynamic storyline that keeps you engaged from start to finish. The character development is outstanding, making you emotionally invested in the fate of these antiheroes.  The game's open-world environment, the sprawling city of Los Santos, is nothing short of breathtaking. The level of detail is staggering, from the bustling urban streets to the serene beauty of the surrounding countryside. Whether you're exploring the city skyline, cruising through the Vinewood Hills, or engaging in high-speed chases across the desert, the world feels alive and dynamic, with every corner offering a new surprise.  GTA 5 boasts a diverse range of activities to keep players entertained for hours on end. From adrenaline-pumping heists to intense shootouts, leisurely rounds of golf to off-road races, the variety of missions and side activities is astonishing. The attention to detail extends to the radio stations, showcasing a wide array of genres and entertaining talk shows that enhance the immersive experience.  The multiplayer component, Grand Theft Auto Online, takes the experience to a whole new level. Joining forces with friends to complete heists, engaging in thrilling PvP battles, or simply cruising around the city in a customized vehicle adds an extra layer of excitement and longevity to the game. The constant updates and expansions introduced by Rockstar ensure that the online world stays fresh and engaging.  Visually, GTA 5 is a technical marvel. The graphics are stunning, showcasing the power of modern gaming hardware. The character models, vehicles, and environments are rendered with meticulous attention to detail, creating a visual spectacle that enhances the overall gaming experience.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V is a masterpiece that has rightfully earned its place in the annals of gaming history. Rockstar Games has created a living, breathing world that transcends the boundaries of conventional gaming. With its compelling narrative, expansive open-world, and a plethora of activities, GTA 5 continues to stand as a shining example of what the gaming industry is capable of achieving. Whether you're a seasoned gamer or a casual player, Grand Theft Auto V is a must-play title that delivers an unforgettable and unparalleled gaming experience.

An Epic Adventure in the Heart of Los Santos!   Rating: ★★★★ (4/5)   Grand Theft Auto V (GTA 5) is a game that deserves all the praise it has received. Rockstar Games has once again outdone itself with this masterpiece, delivering an unforgettable gaming experience that's nothing short of a cinematic thrill ride. From the moment you step into the sprawling, meticulously detailed world of Los Santos, you're transported to a place where freedom knows no bounds. The open-world design is an absolute triumph, offering players an immense playground to explore and dominate. Whether you're cruising down the iconic Vinewood Boulevard, scaling the heights of Mount Chiliad, or diving into the depths of the Pacific Ocean, there's always something exciting to ****.  Characters in GTA 5 are some of the most memorable in gaming history. Michael, Franklin, and Trevor each bring unique personalities and stories, genuinely investing you in their journeys. The superb voice acting and top-notch writing elevates the narrative to a level of storytelling excellence that few games can **** of the standout features of GTA 5 is its heist missions. These intricate, multi-layered jobs require careful planning and precise execution and can be tackled from multiple angles. The sheer satisfaction of pulling off a heist flawlessly, whether through cunning strategy or brute force, is an adrenaline rush like no ****   Online, the game's multiplayer mode is a world unto itself. With an ever-expanding array of activities, jobs, and businesses to run, you can easily spend countless hours immersing yourself in the bustling online community. Joining forces with friends or competing against players worldwide in races, deathmatches, and elaborate heists adds a dynamic layer of excitement to the ****   Oh, the visuals in GTA 5 are breathtaking, even years after its initial release. The attention to detail in the city, the realistic character animations, and the jaw-dropping vistas are a testament to Rockstar's commitment to excellence. The game runs smoothly, even on older hardware, ensuring everyone can enjoy Los Santos's splendor.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V triumphs in game design, storytelling, and open-world exploration. It's a game that continually surprises and delights players, offering unparalleled immersion and excitement. Whether you're a long-time series fan or a newcomer, GTA 5 is a must-play title that sets a new standard for open-world gaming. Get ready to lose yourself in the chaos and beauty of Los Santos - it's an adventure you will remember!

An entertaining game that's doesn't take itself too seriously while still being mostly grounded in a reality where crime runs rampant. The places the game really shines are in it's heists the characters plan. Namely casing a score, then acquiring the things required for the job, and then finally executing the heist itself. The game even gives you a couple options for each heist. The other big entertainment factor with the game is in the parodies of various things in the world, like the talk show and news radio commentary on things that are happening in the game. It makes the game world feel a bit more lived in and I can definitely see why GTA Online has cultivated a strong RP community from these things.

Rockstar is notoriously shit at security. If you haven't played GTA in a while, your account has almost 100% been compromised by hackers. So what do you do? The only thing you can do is message Rockstar support. That shouldn't be an issue, but every time you reply to a ticket, you're talking to someone new. That means repeating yourself a dozen times, sending the same screenshots a dozen times. I have been talking to them for 5 days. I have sent them proof of purchase, proof I own the email account the Rockstar account was linked to, proof I've purchased Shark Cards. I've sent them screenshots of my Steam profile, screenshots of my Rockstar profile, screenshots of my friend requests... but the next day it's some new person talking to me, and they request the same exact information. It's crazy to me how they so easily allow someone into your account, but getting back into your own account is impossible. In my eyes, the issue is that they require you to use their bullshit, buttcheeks launcher, which has no benefit and only creates gaps in security. They said "how about, instead of using Steams relatively safe and protected services, we make them sign up for our own shitty hacker-friendly launcher and then when their account inevitably gets hacked, maybe they'll just buy the game again."  Buying a Rockstar game is just begging to have your information stolen by some man in China. Their support is so bad, I can't help but feel like its on purpose just to get you to make another account and re-buy the game.

Achievements: GTA V offers a diverse range of achievements that cater to both casual players and completionists. Some are straightforward and easy to unlock, while others require skill, strategy, and persistence. Whether you’re stealing your first car or completing a complex heist, the achievement system keeps you engaged and motivated. It’s satisfying to see that 100% completion mark next to your profile, and the variety of challenges ensures that there’s something for everyone.  Story Mode: The heart of GTA V lies in its captivating story mode. Rockstar Games has crafted an intricate narrative with memorable characters, unexpected twists, and a sprawling open-world environment. As you switch between the three protagonists—Michael, Franklin, and Trevor—you’ll experience a rollercoaster of emotions, from high-stakes heists to personal struggles. The attention to detail, voice acting, and cinematic cutscenes make this one of the most immersive single-player experiences in gaming history.  Online Mode: GTA Online takes the game beyond the story mode, allowing you to explore Los Santos with friends or other players worldwide. Whether you’re racing, participating in elaborate heists, or simply causing chaos, the online world is a dynamic playground. Customizing your character, buying properties, and competing in various activities add depth and longevity to the game. Plus, the regular updates and events keep the community engaged, ensuring that there’s always something new to discover.  Overall Recommendation: In summary, GTA V is a masterpiece that seamlessly blends an engaging story mode with a thriving online community. Whether you’re a fan of intense action, exploration, or simply want to cruise around the city, this game delivers. The attention to detail, stunning visuals, and sheer freedom make it a must-play title. So buckle up, grab your virtual weapons, and dive into the chaotic world of GTA V—it’s an adventure you won’t regret!

I have had lots of fun hours playing this game online but unfortunately I am unable to recommend due to one big flaw on PC.  This game is plagued my modders online. These are the groups that modify the game play using software to cheat and ruin others play time. Public lobbies on GTA Online can't be played effectively on PC. This is a known problem and a controversial issue as many like to mod and do so without interfering with others. Unfortunately my experience has been often toxic individuals who are bored and have fun ruining others game play by cheating. There is a big difference between getting upset that people are killing you on an online game that is PvP against modders that use god mode and remotely blow you up so you have no chance.   So why so many fun hours playing? Simple, me and my friends go into a crew restricted online lobby. This is the only effective way to play this game. Unfortunately by doing this you can't meet people in the online public lobbies to join your crew or expand your friends.   I do have concerns for GTA 6 as if it has the same problems I am likely not to bother. It's a shame as the game has so much good potential and can be really fun but I would probably say get it on console where the modifications are restricted.

The single player experience is top-notch, like knockin' back a cold one with your best bud. The story? Unbelievable. Every mission's got you grinnin' like mad.  Now, here's the genius move – they toss in an in-game stock market. It ain't the second coming of sliced bread, but it's pretty damn cool. You can play the market, make some dough, maybe even swim in millions or billions. But here's the thing, you end up drowning in cash like a lottery winner with nowhere to blow it. Singleplayer mode, though fantastic, feels a bit deserted after the story wraps up. Rockstar's updates forget about it like it's yesterday's news. Now, let's talk about the multiplayer, or as I like to call it, the school of life for young bloods. It's like a lesson in manners, respect, and sharing, but in a chaotic, online playground. If you want to enjoy it with mates, lock it down to a private session, unless you fancy a level +1000 twerp going all mafia boss on you.  And get this – you can buy a yacht in the game. Real boss move, huh? The top-tier one sets you back a cool $10,000,000. But here's the twist again – the most in-game money you can buy is $8,000,000, and that's gonna cost you a hundred real bucks. Talk about highway robbery in a game that's already bleeding your wallet dry.  I could go on and on about a game and a company that seem to have a PhD in squeezing every penny out of the fans, shutting down companies they once praised. But let's get straight to it. Singleplayer? Absolutely top-notch. Multiplayer? Stay away like it's the plague. GTA Online is like a case study proving that achieving world peace is easier than navigating that online circus. Cheers to the campaign, but keep your distance from the multiplayer madness.

The community is full of players looking to start fights for no reason, griefing is promoted, and excessive mods on PC break all game barriers. Vehicles are too expensive and money-making methods are mostly ineffective, except for the Cayo Perico heist. I play GTA Online alone more than with anyone else.  I suggest singleplayer over multiplayer, unless if you have a group of loyal friends to play with.

TL;DR: This is the most buggy game I've played in years, possibly ever.  It seems like every other mission requires alt+f4 and a reload to work. The very first mission bugged back to back and I almost didn't bother racing Lamar and requested a refund. I've had the game crash 3 times, so like 1 crash per hour, basically. I picked the "Cool Cat" clothes and the cat graphic on the shirt constantly disappears, etc.   For system specs, I have a AMD Ryzen 7 5800X, 3080 TI, Samsung Evo, etc, so it shouldn't be related to hardware as I don't even run the game with maxed out settings.   Biotching aside, I haven't played a GTA since GTA3 on PS2(?) and despite all the BS buggy issues, I found it fun enough to keep booting the game back up. I have a thumbs down because with the game's popularity, time since release, and resources available at Rockstar, I don't think the stability issues are acceptable.  Honestly, I haven't experienced a game this buggy in recent memory, not Cyberpunk at launch, not New World at launch, not <INSERT BAD LAUNCH>, not any EA indie game, nothing; it's actually pretty absurd.

I mainly purchased this game for the Online mode, however a month ago I have decided to relieve the memories of 10 year old me who played the story mode on the good ol' PlayStation 3 back in 2013.  Running triathlons, participating in different kind of races, calling friends for hangouts, participating in different random events, discovering some weird, but hilarious strangers and freaks (props to Nigel and Mrs. Thornill, funniest characters in GTA 5 I've ever witnessed), exploding myself while trying to do the knife flights challenges, checking LifeInvader of each playable character to really get into the story, hunting for deers, laughing my ass off while I brought all 3 playable characters together, made them play golf and watched as AI was absolutely awful at this game.  Story mode in GTA 5 is such a GOAT and I really wish that those DLCs that were planned wayyy back could see the light.   If you are purchasing the game for story mode, absolutely, go for it. If you are purchasing it for online only, eh. There are more fun online games with way better servers, which don't make you spend half of the time in loading screens, out there, buddy.

This game has been the source of many of my most fond gaming memories. The base game comes with a rich story line based in a Los Angeles look-a-like city called Los Santos. In single player mode, you get three very interesting playable protagonists, each complementing the others in their own way. You have Michael, a "retired" father figure who is upset at the universe for his own doings. Franklin, the young gangster who is ready to chase some paper, but still has some lessons to learn about the world of organised crime. Lastly, there is Trevor. Trevor is a maniacal, meth-addled criminal who lives in bum-f*ck nowhere north of Los Santos. The three characters all have their own side missions and personal quests that will grow their strengths and sometimes even show their weaknesses. 10/10 Single player. After finishing the single player I jumped into GTA: Online. Since they do regular updates and content additions for free, the GTA Online community is still strong with a large player base. Mod menus do seem to be a dime a dozen, so you do need to be ready at any time to spontaneously combust. If they are too annoying, you can play single player or do a Crew session to keep them out. If you enjoy grinding missions to buy a fancy car or apartment, building an underground criminal empire, or shooting pedestrians, I would give this game a shot.

Caros desenvolvedores do GTA V, Gostaria de expressar minha profunda gratidão pelo impacto positivo que o jogo teve em minha vida. Como pai solteiro de uma criança especial, enfrento diariamente desafios únicos. Foi surpreendente perceber como GTA V se tornou uma ferramenta valiosa para fortalecer nosso vínculo. A imersão no mundo do jogo nos proporcionou momentos de descontração e lazer, algo que muitas vezes é difícil de encontrar em nossa rotina. A variedade de atividades no jogo permitiu que eu e meu filho explorássemos juntos, criando memórias preciosas e fortalecendo nossa conexão. Além disso, a narrativa envolvente e os desafios estratégicos do jogo estimularam habilidades cognitivas e de resolução de problemas em meu filho, proporcionando uma experiência educativa de forma divertida. GTA V, para nós, transcendeu o rótulo de apenas um jogo. Tornou-se um meio para enfrentarmos desafios juntos, crescermos como família e encontrarmos alegria em momentos compartilhados. Agradeço sinceramente por criar algo que vai além do entretenimento e se transforma em uma ponte para conexões mais profundas e significativas.

I am a 55 year old biker and trucker father, and probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 15 now. My son got this game for from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 12 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he let me borrow his controller. Me and my son then played in turns and I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my son many happy memories.

Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) is a groundbreaking open-world action-adventure game that continues to captivate players worldwide. Released in 2013, it remains a benchmark in the gaming industry for its expansive and detailed virtual recreation of Los Santos, a fictionalized version of Los Angeles.  One of the standout features of GTA V is its compelling narrative, told through the perspectives of three diverse protagonists: Michael, a retired criminal; Franklin, a street-smart hustler; and Trevor, a volatile and unpredictable character. The intertwining stories create a rich and immersive experience, complemented by exceptional voice acting and character development.  The game's vast open-world environment is a playground for mayhem and exploration. The attention to detail in the cityscape, from towering skyscrapers to gritty alleyways, is truly remarkable. The sheer variety of activities, missions, and side quests ensures that players always have something engaging to do, whether it's high-stakes heists, adrenaline-pumping car chases, or more leisurely pursuits like golf and tennis.  GTA V excels in its ability to seamlessly blend action, humor, and social commentary. The satirical take on modern society, celebrity culture, and the pursuit of the American Dream adds depth to the narrative. The radio stations and in-game media provide a humorous and insightful look at the world, making the game not just entertaining but also thought-provoking.  The game's multiplayer component, Grand Theft Auto Online, extends the experience beyond the single-player campaign. With its constantly evolving content, including heists, races, and a variety of customizable options, GTA Online has maintained a dedicated player base, fostering a dynamic online community.  However, it's worth noting that the game has faced criticism for its mature content, including violence and explicit language. This may not be suitable for all audiences, and potential players should be aware of the game's content before diving in.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V remains a monumental achievement in the gaming industry. Its combination of a compelling story, stunning open-world design, and diverse gameplay options make it a must-play for fans of the genre. While the mature content may not be suitable for everyone, those who appreciate a gripping narrative and a vast, immersive virtual world will find GTA V to be an unforgettable gaming experience.

Grand Theft Auto V by Rockstar Games presents a captivating exploration of cultural narratives set within the diverse and intricate backdrop of the fictional city of Los Santos. The game's trio of protagonists - Michael, Franklin, and Trevor - offer a multifaceted perspective on life in a Western urban setting, resonating with the experiences of adapting to new cultural environments. The immersive open-world design, combined with stunning graphics, transcends geographical boundaries, providing players from various backgrounds an opportunity to engage with and understand a world both familiar and foreign. Moreover, GTA Online extends this experience, facilitating multicultural interactions akin to those encountered in diverse societies. This game is more than just entertainment; it's a bridge between cultures, a tool for understanding, and a canvas for exploring the complexities of different societies. Grand Theft Auto V is an essential experience for anyone intrigued by the rich tapestry of cultural landscapes and the dynamics of urban life.

GTA 5 Online is probably the most scummiest fucking thing ever, ignore my high playtime because that was before i realized that this game was made to take your money and nothing else. Almost every single person i came across had a mod menu and Rockstar isn't doing anything about it. Normally video games are meant to be a way to have fun and chill out, except this game is nothing but a chore. Grinding is so fucking boring and i know that it's supposed to be like that since you're doing the same missions over and over again but my god are some of the missions just fucking bullshit, like why can't i carry 3 crates at once? Why do the enemies have perfect aim? Why do some enemies not die from a headshot but some of them do? Why did some missions get nerfed? And why the FUCK is there a cooldown after every single fucking thing i do? Whether it be missions,phone or the interaction menu there is always a cooldown. The answers to these questions is one thing and one thing only, money (Shark Cards) Rockstar is doing everything in their power to make you spend money on this game and not giving a shit about any other game (RDR 2 because they haven't made a game since 2018 and no the shitty mobile port doesn't count) Rockstar is probably one of if not the most scummiest video game company i have ever seen.

fictional state of San Andreas. The city of Los Santos, the surrounding countryside, and the sprawling ocean provide players with a diverse and immersive setting to explore. The attention to detail in the design of the world, including realistic weather patterns, day-night cycles, and a variety of landscapes, contributes to a truly immersive gaming experience. Compelling Narrative: The game features a compelling and multifaceted narrative that follows three protagonists: Michael, a retired bank robber; Franklin, a street-smart hustler; and Trevor, a volatile and unpredictable criminal. The intertwining stories of these characters offer a unique perspective on the criminal underworld, filled with twists, turns, and unexpected events. The quality of the writing and voice acting enhances the storytelling experience, making players emotionally invested in the characters and their fates. Diverse Characters: The protagonists are not the only memorable characters in GTA 5. The game is populated with a wide array of interesting and eccentric personalities, each contributing to the rich tapestry of the narrative. From corrupt government officials to ambitious entrepreneurs, the diverse cast adds depth and complexity to the game world. Innovative Gameplay Mechanics: GTA 5 introduces several gameplay innovations, such as the ability to switch between the three protagonists seamlessly. This feature not only provides a fresh perspective on the unfolding events but also allows for dynamic and strategic gameplay.  Endless Activities: Beyond the main story, GTA 5 offers a plethora of side activities and mini-games. Players can engage in sports, participate in races, go hunting, invest in the stock market, and much more. The variety of activities ensures that players always have something to do, adding to the longevity and replayability of the game.  In conclusion, GTA 5 is considered a great game due to its expansive open world, compelling narrative, diverse characters, innovative gameplay mechanics, attention to detail, and the abundance of engaging activities. Its lasting popularity since its release in 2013 is a testament to the game's enduring appeal and the impact it has had on the gaming industry.       fictional state of San Andreas. Played only on single player. This game hits the spot if you want to race around a city and be an outlaw. The story is not that interesting to me and the characters are underwhelming, although you may find them crudely entertaining at times. You will unfortunately be stuck very often listening to unlikable characters go on and on when you just want to try to outrun cops, jump motorcycles off of cliffs, fly planes or fight gangsters. The gameplay in the missions is very fun, though. You may want to get a controller that has little joysticks on it, like a generic xbox-style controller because you'll want to precisely control your speed and angle of movement, but you can get by with using a keyboard and mouse. You will have to deal with the Rockstar launcher but it is doable.  Overall it's a fun game and I recommend it.

Rockstar, you've turned my living room into a digital crime playground, and I'm loving every pixelated moment of it!

This was a great game for its time. The physics, vehicles, story, and gameplay make for a very fun game, but my god does this game have some serious issues with its online mode. Majority of heists and gameplay used towards getting money are convoluted and boring. The pricing for vehicles are stupidly inconsistent, and imo some should just not be in the game to begin with. Every lobby is ridden with modders or hackers either blowing you to smithereens every time you respawn or exceedingly raising your rank and giving random amounts of money.    My hope for GTA 6's online is that it centers more into the roleplaying aspect of the game. Make the world feel grounded, have different kinds of roles and ways of making decent money. Have illegal roles like hitman, gangster,drug dealer, bankrobber. mobster, but also have like more honest money making roles like hunting, businessman, or mechanic, etc, to make the world feel more opportunistic. But above all, FIX YOUR ISSUE WITH HACKERS.

The best way that I can describe the GTA 5 experience is simply freedom. The game simply has no boundaries. You want 1v1 people go for it, car meets, heist, drug operations, flying, stealth, story mode, chaos; it does not matter. This game has dominated for over a decade now and there is a reason for that. The story is excellent, the online while it can be annoying at times is very well done. There are games that I would consider masterpieces; like God of War and Elden Ring, while GTA 5 may not be a masterpiece in the same sense as those two mentioned it is simply timeless. 10/10 would recommend.

Main-Story was great and definitely fun to play through, the gameplay mechanics of GTA haven't aged at all and are still refreshing if you boot it up after a couple of months/years, they'll probably still be fun in the next ages, just the multiple 'main' characters were something I had to get used to at first but didn't mind after the first couple of hours of gameplay. (9.2/10)  The multiplayer has a bunch of flaws though, which just have gotten worse over time. I haven't played in years but I remember loading into an online lobby usually took, when you were lucky 10-15 minutes without any errors but the constant money farming and the unbalanced vehicles is basically what killed the fun for me, it's like either pay for microtransactions or farm for multiple tens or hundreds of hours some GTA dollars to buy some (mostly) useless addon to your base, vehicle etc, for the majority just to have it easier to kill other online players, which is for the most part completly irrelevant. The heists were great fun, aswell as the custom gamemodes and races, with friends there was endless amounts of content and hours you could put into it, but for the heists you also had to do a bunch of farming before being able to do all of them. (8/10)

Let me preface this that my review is mostly towards GTA online. GTA V single player is a well made game and probably worth the price despite it being 10 years old and having received zero updates or improvements.   GTA Online is still a buggy mess after a decade. I think the coding that made this game in 2013 was a shaky foundation at best, and complete spaghetti code so convoluted nothing fundamental can be improved or fixed at worst. It has been 10 years and I still get loading screens as if I'm on Xbox 360 with a HDD. It's 2024 and more times than I can count I enter a building and am greeted with loading screens for 3+ minutes before I give up and alt F4. The inventory/interaction menu is unbelievably unintuitive and frustrating to use. You have to go through 10 different options fumbling around to heal yourself. The phone call system is still obnoxious as ever. Constantly berated with calls, emails, texts, and notifications from characters begging me to do or buy something. WHERE IS THE DO NOT DISTURB FUNCTION. My mechanic takes about 30 seconds to pickup his phone and half the time can't get my car to me. This was an issue in 2013... Matchmaking is a joke. If you load into a job you will rarely get to play a full match. You have to start the match in a public lobby to actually be able to invite anyone. The awful pay for the jobs contributes to the problem as why would anyone want to play this race for $5k when there are better ways to make money. The money you earned is directly tied to how long you played so it’s better to just afk the mission than play. Original heists still require 4 people and force end the mission if someone leaves. I cannot tell you how many times I've had an error loading into GTA Online and get sent back to Storymode. WHY CAN’T YOU REQUEUE ME?   Rockstar loathes its player base. Zero communication ever. Programming cars to swerve into while driving. Nerf payouts of everything. Force players to glitch desired outfits like police uniforms and then blacklist and remove them. We can buy police cars now, but not uniforms?? I cannot believe it took a fucking decade to add police cars you can keep. Players have been asking for cops and crooks dlc for years and get only some half baked police cars. They even made the police suv a console exclusive. Arbitrary limits to the number of CEOs in an online session (you need to be one to do any mission). Add blatantly overpowered vehicles for players to grief you. Encourages players to grief you by making you a target on the map when selling stuff (you can do sell missions in solo lobbies now, only took 5 years to add but still). You have to install Rockstar launcher to play. Horribly unoptimized for online. Tanks your FPS going online from singleplayer. Poor vehicle diversity, max like 5 different car spawns. Sell missions forcing you to use 4 of the slowest vehicles in existence and drive across the map back. Die on a mission and need to retry? Any snacks and armor you used will not be reset so back out and restock or good luck. Playing with some people and you exit the lobby? Good luck finding them you are put into a different lobby. Not fun, just bad game design.   The economy is still inflated beyond belief. $5 million dollars for a police car??? $2 million for a mustang? $400k for a rifle? They have made strides in improving money making capabilities with solo heists and improved business payouts, but you have to be experienced and willing to grind. You need millions of dollars in properties to be able to make any significant money, which is why they have a starter pack. You practically need this to play if you are new. Shark cards give you a pitiful amount of money for how much you spend. (please don't give rockstar money, buy a $100 billion dollar account from modders for like 5 dollars). This game has somehow been kept alive and milked for a decade from casual players and whales giving in to micro transactions.   You think CSGO or Rust has a cheater problem? You wouldn't fucking believe the number of cheaters on PC. It's basically in the TOS that Rockstar doesn't care if you use a mod menu. They even reward them because they don't ever ban them, but will ban you if you do a money glitch. God mode glitches never get patched or banned.  There is zero punishment for cheating. Every other person is cheating. Maybe not overtly spawning spaceships and putting you in a death loop, but casually playing in God mode grinding. Abysmal security for online where modders can get everyone's IP. You played a heist and the money was never paid? Support will tell you to go fuck yourself. There isn't even an option for missing money on support, they couldn't care less.  They treat PC like last gen consoles by locking PC out of content on new gen consoles. They REMOVED 200 VEHICLES for purchase and made them available on a subscription service gta+. Animals have been added into online... for consoles only. PC has the best hardware and doesn't get the animals? Something that should've been in the game to begin with.   They just keep adding DLC with more bloat. They add so many vehicles that nobody ever uses and just keep adding more and more. The missions and heists they do add are pretty good. Although a lot of them require multiple people to play.    If Rockstar had any competition we would have had GTA VI years ago and a much better game. Instead, we get this shit show. Cautiously optimistic for GTA VI. Rockstar is a shell of its former self. The heads of the studio that made Rockstar great have left the company.

Third party launcher, AND required account (which the game is forever bound too). Regret actually buying it on Steam, because WTF was the point?  My fault I guess, but I do not know whatever email I used to to activate this in their shitty launcher (a SECOND time, since I ALREADY PAID FOR IT THROUGH STEAM). Their support is... not support, just a website, and the number they have just says to go to the website.  I am sure it is a great game (I had fun when I played it ON MY STEAM AAAAND ROCKSTAR ACCOUNT), but be sure you remember you credentials... unlike stupid me... which actually is completely ridiculous.

Let me start by saying that I have never cared for the GTA style games (GTA, RDR, Saints Row etc.) but a friend gifted me this because i needed a change of pace to play with friends. I don't love the game by any means, and while I'm still not a fan (these just aren't my preferred games), I can see all the hype. The game is very well made and even after being more than 10 years old, still gets regular updates. I still havent been made a fan, but i do rather enjoy playing and just messing around with friends. 10/10 DO NOT RECOMMEND ONLINE PUBS THOUGH. It's private friend sessions and story mode for me. If you play online (outside a modded or 5M server) prepare to hate every moment of it.

Delightfully addictive and hard to put down. Grand Theft Auto V offers a fantastic sandbox world to play in, with a well flowing story and expansive online mode. In regards to solo play, GTAV gives a classic story of criminal success and lets you feel like a truly powerful while letting you tap into your inner sociopath. The three main characters are by no means good people, trying to live their lives while trying to separate themselves from their pasts. Despite this, their actions would soon come back to haunt them, no matter who you play. It's by no means a masterclass in story writing, but its hashed together well enough and more than enough moments of fulfilling a power fantasy that you won't pay it much mind. Furthermore the world of Los Santos itself does what GTA as a series has always done well: Creating a snapshot parody of American culture at the time. While always crude and satirical, coming from 2013 it does have some dated aspects compared to the current year, but the game is rated M for a reason.  As for the online mode, it further enhances the power fantasy by letting you create your own self insert, meeting all the notable characters of the main story, and letting you carve your own path to criminal underworld infamy while amounting tremendous amounts of cash along the way. I will admit, I most often play in private lobbies as an introverted person, and having tried online more seriously in the past few months, it's really difficult to get a start in the world without doing a notable amount of research into what's worth prioritizing (start with the drug wars series in Sandy Shores, by the way). Additionally, and while I later learned the reason for it, it's obnoxious that after every mission I do with friends we're always sorted back into individual private lobbies or worse put into public ones. These issues aside, I delighted in roleplaying with friends online and forming our own criminal empires while snatching up businesses and running missions.  All in all, GTA V is still worth your time over a decade after its original inception.

After years of hearing the hype, I finally caved and jumped into the chaotic world of GTA 5 on PC, and let me tell you, it was about time! This game isn't just a game; it's a wild, uncontrollable rollercoaster of absurdity, especially thanks to one Mr. Trevor Philips.  Trevor, the human embodiment of a "no filter" policy, is like that one friend who always gets you into trouble, but you can't help but hang around because they're just so entertaining. His unpredictable antics had me in stitches, whether he was rampaging through the streets in his underwear or waxing poetic about life's injustices while piloting a stolen helicopter.  The graphics still hold and are crisp and detailed, making misadventures through Los Santos a visually stunning experience. And on PC, the modding community turns this already insane game into a surreal playground where anything can happen. Want to see Trevor riding a flying bike dressed as a pikachu? There's probably a mod for that.  The storyline is gripping, but let's be real – it's Trevor's show. The missions involving him often left me in a moral grey area, but always with a smirk on my face. His dark humor, combined with the game's satirical take on modern society, makes for an unforgettable experience.  GTA 5 on PC is a masterpiece of madness, and Trevor is the cherry on top of this chaotic sundae. If you, like me, are late to the party, don't worry – the party doesn't start until Trevor shows up anyway. 10/10!

Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) on PC is the definition of "An Epic Open World Crime Masterpiece".  Rating: ★★★★★  Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) for PC is the definitive edition of Rockstar Games' crime saga, delivering an unparalleled open-world experience that continues to captivate players worldwide. Originally released on consoles, the PC version elevates the game to new heights, offering stunning visuals, enhanced performance, and a host of additional features that make it a must-play for both newcomers and returning fans.  Graphics and Performance (5/5): GTA V on PC showcases the full potential of modern gaming hardware. The visual fidelity is breathtaking, with highly detailed character models, realistic lighting, and a sprawling open world that comes alive in 4K resolution. The attention to detail is impressive, from the bustling streets of Los Santos to the picturesque landscapes of Blaine County. The game runs smoothly on a wide range of PC configurations, and the level of optimization ensures a seamless experience, making the most of high-end hardware while remaining accessible to a broader audience.  Story and Characters (5/5): The narrative in GTA V is a true triumph, weaving together the lives of three diverse protagonists - Michael, Franklin, and Trevor - in a gripping tale of crime, betrayal, and redemption. The character development is outstanding, each with their own motivations and flaws that add depth to the overall story. The engaging plot is complemented by exceptional voice acting and a soundtrack that perfectly complements the on-screen action. The ability to switch between characters seamlessly adds a unique dynamic to both the storytelling and gameplay.  Gameplay and Open World (5/5): GTA V's open-world design is nothing short of phenomenal. The fictional recreation of Los Angeles, Los Santos, is a sprawling playground filled with diverse activities, ranging from high-stakes heists to leisurely pursuits like golf and tennis. The attention to detail is staggering, and the world feels alive with its dynamic weather, day-night cycle, and a population that reacts realistically to the player's actions. The heist missions, a highlight of the game, provide a level of strategic depth and excitement rarely seen in the gaming industry.  Additional Features (5/5): The PC version of GTA V comes with a plethora of exclusive features, including an expanded video editor, robust modding support, and enhanced multiplayer experiences through Grand Theft Auto Online. The modding community has flourished, adding an endless array of content that keeps the game fresh and exciting long after the initial playthrough. Rockstar's commitment to providing ongoing support and updates for GTA Online ensures that players can continue to enjoy new content and challenges.  Conclusion: Grand Theft Auto V on PC is a masterpiece that transcends the boundaries of the gaming medium. With its stunning visuals, compelling narrative, and expansive open world, it sets a benchmark for what an open-world game can achieve. Whether you're a fan of action, storytelling, or simply want to explore a virtual world like no other, GTA V on PC is an essential addition to any gamer's library. Rockstar Games has created an enduring classic that stands the test of time and remains a testament to the limitless potential of interactive entertainment.

I'm very late to the party. The game is old and everybody has played it or at least I'd assume they did. I picked the game up for $10 on a sale and decided to play it through since I never got around to it. Before I began the hype around GTA 6 was a-blaze on the internet and I didn't understand all these people saying that they want to play it right now. It's a game, you can wait, it's going to be just fine and nothing that will change your life.  But about GTA 5, when I started I quickly settled into it. I didn't care about online or most of the side-side-content. I did do some side-quests because they were all interesting enough and distinct enough that going through them was enjoyable. And the story even for side-quests was interesting. I have not skipped a single cut scene because I was in awe of the motion capture. It's not that it looks real life or anything, but the model for it is so well done you feel these people moving, talking and thinking. You easily bond with basically anybody because their face expressions are believable. And besides, most of the best parts of this game happen in cars where you're just driving down some highway listening to your station and people are talking. Sometimes I'd slow down just to make sure that I got to listen to everything that they had to say because the dialog is quick, snappy, people don't wait for others to finish this monologue - mostly - to start talking. And the stuff they talk about is always something you can somewhat connect to. Well not always about being a murderer, but for example you can somewhat feel how Micheal is feeling even though he is a murderer that faced no consequences and is living in a mansion doing nothing. Each of the characters are distinct and interesting, and everyone is placed in a spot where you see that they don't want to go back doing what they were doing but at the same time you see that continuing doing what they currently pursue is destroying their relationship with others. Not Trevor really, but that's beside the point.  The place where the game has it's thing down is driving, each car is different and you quickly learn which ones to pick on the street. Because of the fact that driving is so interesting and feels so complex it feels okay to be placed in those situations where you have to drive from point A to point B. At first. In the last quarter of this game driving becomes really tedious. But it does not affect the game too much to become a big problem, and the radio stations are great so you can just enjoy the music. But to be honest it sometimes also depends. When you have the vibe, enabling the first person perspective and obeying all the traffic laws while driving is really relaxing. But doing it for too long can expose the limitation in the AI of the characters that are just running/driving around the city.  The story is flesh out really well. Everybody gets their introduction and ending - maybe expect Stretch, this character is a part in the ending but you only play one mission with him. Everything comes around in a nice circle where every character is introduced, they play their part and most likely they're dead at the end. Killing off people is paced well and people that you are rooting for to be killed are written in a way to make you hate them. That way once you finally get them it feels right but at the same time it feels like these people are over the top but maybe not really once you start to unpeel the layers that make up these characters - Devin and Steve Haines. But not to make it out to be something better than it really is, the story is just good. It is strong and the characters are likeable but not something where you are DEEPLY invested in them. It is just there to serve it's purpose and to cover the fact that the game is mostly about shooting other people.  The game is long, interesting, simple and fun. Now I know why people want to play GTA 6 already. Because it's most likely going to be really fun.

Grand Theft Auto V is that sandbox open world experience that keeps you busy for 200+ hours in single player or 500 hours or more in multiplayer.    In single player mode you'll find a long and beautiful campaign with over 70 main missions and 3 endings,that alone is going to take over 30 hours if you rush it but i advise to enjoy and explore everything because it's worth.  The strangers and freaks,the side missions and side activities represent a huge chunk of the game ,it's amazing how much details and work they put into these.  There is also the multiplayer,which received along the years manny content updates. I dare say there's more content in GTA Online and if you're afraid of cheaters you can create a session only for you and play it alone without some features but enough to finish almost everything by yourself.  Pros:  -Amazing story with great voice acting,huge amount of content -Multiplayer receive content updates even after 9 years  Cons:  -sometimes in multiplayer it's best to create a only friend invite session to avoid cheaters   My review score:  Story   - 10  Gameplay- 9 Graphics- 8 Music   -  9   Overall - 9

Since there are already about a million different reviews of GTA V, with the consensus being that it's great, I've decided to forgo adding another generic review in praise of it. Instead, I'll review GTA Online as it stands in January 2024.[b] I'm marking this review as "Recommended", but that is entirely based on GTA V; my opinions on GTA V and GTA Online are completely different [/b][i](a big shocker, I know)[/i].    Since its launch in 2013, GTA Online has undergone several changes aimed at nudging players toward purchasing in-game currency with real money. The ever-increasing prices of items, vehicles, and properties with each game update are a push to boost the parent company's quarterly earnings rather than the parody of real-world inflation one might expect from Rockstar Games.   Online play does have its bright spots with some interesting new missions. Unfortunately, many of them are locked behind expensive properties purchased with in-game currency and offer little to no replayability. Lack of replayability may seem ironic in a game that can be categorized as grind-centric, but one gets the impression that this is intentional, or perhaps I'm wrong and it's just plain laziness on the part of the developers.   There is one significant negative that I haven't touched on yet, and that is the community, more specifically the 'modders'. I completely avoided joining public lobbies in my playing experience because the game is so infested with these individuals that it's almost impossible not to encounter some. I understand that not all of these people have malicious intentions, but enough do that it's worth avoiding the risk (and when I say risk, I mean it—the capabilities of some of these mod clients are [b]insane[/b]).   Overall, GTA Online has its moments, but the experience is diminished by things such as paywalls (specifically property missions) and modders, and I wouldn't recommend wasting your time on it.  [b]TL;DR: GTA V = Good, GTA Online = Bad.[/b]

Good evening fellow Steam players. I am Dong Dong, a professional athlete and gamer for the Chinese people's republic and I am writing this review about the game Grand Theft Auto V on platforms such as Steam, PlayStation 5 and Xbox One.  This game resonates with me deeply. I have the freedom to do whatever I want in this beautiful masterpiece of a game, crafted by Rockstar Games. I've been playing this game a bit recently, it has helped me to cope with the loss of my family's Tibetan hound, Zonqinp. Zon was a positive influence in our household and it is sad to see him go, but thankfully I can pretend like he and his fellow deceased hounds, Qongchang and Seebodi, are with me in this digital experience.  All-in-all, this game is all I have ever wanted in a gaming experience. I recommend you to buy this masterpiece. Waiting for GTA 6 as well. Dong Dong signing off.

Here is a Ukrainian Garlic Bread recipe.  For the dough:  1 cup milk (250 ml) 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast (1 packet) 2 Tablespoons sugar 2 Tablespoons oil (sunflower, avocado, or olive) 3 cups all-purpose flour (380 g) 2 teaspoons salt 1 egg beaten For the garlic oil: 3 Tablespoons oil (sunflower, avocado, or olive) 3-4 garlic cloves 1 Tablespoon chopped fresh dill 1 Tablespoon chopped fresh Italian parsley flake salt (optional)  INSTRUCTIONS   For the dough, warm the milk until it is between 80-100 degrees F. — just warm to the touch. Add the milk to the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a dough hook attachment or to a large bowl if kneading by hand. Add the sugar to the milk, then sprinkle the yeast on top. Whisk the mixture and allow it to activate and become foamy for about 5-10 minutes. Once the yeast is activated, add the oil to the milk mixture, then add the flour and salt. If using a stand mixer, start mixing the dough on the lowest setting. Once the dough starts to form a ball, increase the speed to medium and knead for 6-8 minutes. Alternatively, knead for 10-12 minutes by hand. The dough is done when it is elastic, glossy, soft, and easily comes away from the sides of the bowl/surface. Add the dough to a lightly oiled bowl and cover with a clean, damp kitchen towel. Let the dough rise for 1-1 1/2 hours, or until doubled in size. Once the dough has risen and doubled in size, punch it down to remove the air, and transfer it to a clean surface. Form the dough into a rectangle, and then divide it into 8 equal-sized pieces; weigh each one to be exact. Form each piece into a ball by pinching the edges inward, and then on a flat surface, roll the dough into a ball shape. Preheat the oven to 350 F. Lightly grease a 9-inch round or square baking dish, preferably metal as opposed to glass or ceramic. Beat the egg for the egg wash. Place each ball of dough in the baking dish, with an equal distance between each ball. Allow the dough to rise a second time for 30 minutes, or until the rolls have puffed up and filled the pan. Brush the tops of the dough with the egg wash and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until deep golden brown. While the rolls bake, make the garlic oil mixture. Finely mince the garlic, then combine it with the oil, chopped dill and chopped parsley. Brush the garlic-herb mixture over the rolls immediately after they come out of the oven. Allow the rolls to cool for 15 minutes before serving. Pampushky can also be served at room temperature or reheated.

Grand Theft Auto V, the epitome of subtlety and refined storytelling, takes you on a journey through the thriving metropolis of Los Santos. The game, with its profound depth and nuanced characters, challenges your intellect at every turn. The storyline is a masterclass in profound narrative, weaving together the tales of three utterly relatable and not-at-all clichéd protagonists. The satire is so subtle; you might miss it if you blink. The missions? Pure genius. Driving across the vast, meticulously crafted world is an absolute joy, especially when you encounter the awe-inspiring traffic AI. In summary, GTA V is a subtle, refined masterpiece, oozing with originality.
