Incredibly, astoundingly, amazing, remarkably HORRIBLE online play experience because the utterly rampant cheating.  The single-player (for some reason called "Story Mode") is actually pretty fun. But when that's over, since there isn't really a difficulty rating you can adjust, the only thing left is the online multiplayer mode.  Presumably if you have a good group of friends who will NOT be cheating, then this is probably also pretty fun.  Unfortunately, the public online experience is really just a gigantic, systemically empowered griefer utopia.  So yeah, parts of this are very fun, it's certainly visually gorgeous. But replayability and longevity are extremely limited.  Don't fool yourself into "It can't be that bad!" because it's utterly, insanely filthy with cheats that have bizarre superpowers and will make you regret wasting the time trying.

This game has story mode (offline, by yourself)  and online mode (you, and your friends, enemies, strangers, griefers, everyone else)  This review is mostly for the online portion of the game. First, it's a great game.  They do weekly updates, so every week new stuff is on sale, different cars, different businesses (usually), and they'll change some of the payouts on different tasks, heists and businesses.  There's daily tasks you can do that respawn every day in different places as well.  It can be a car game, a fighting game, a shooting game, a heist game  The empire building part is what I like,  start a business, and set it up, most of them can make passive money whenever you're online.   Arcade, Agency, Night Club, Drug labs, Bunker, Aircraft Hangar, tons of heists, arena racing, auto shop, bike shop, warehouses, private military stuff, whatever you want. And you can run everything all at once.  Or you can just run around killing strangers for no reason. (you will get killed right back though).  Game has lots of flaws, character mechanics are weird, but it's a 10 year old game. It's alos really frustrating sometimes, either because of some other weird game mechanic, or because some rando on the internet decides to give you grief for no reason ("it's part of the game").  You can set up private, friend only, or crew only lobbies now, and still do all the missions so I run my nightclub like that, do the daily stuff, and buy the things I want when they go on sale.  I bought this game lots of times on lots of different systems (PS3, PS4, PS5 and lots of PC guys),  PC is the best because you don't need to subscribe to PS-Plus, or X-box Live to play online,  but there are advantages to playing on a "current gen" Xbox/PS console (more content). I mostly stick to PC now, though I do play on PS sometimes.  It goes on sale for around $15 all the time, buy it.

Rockstar should just separate the Single Player and Multiplayer as their own download. Positive Comment:  Grand Theft Auto V on PC is an absolute masterpiece when it comes to gaming. The graphics are nothing short of breathtaking; the level of detail in Los Santos and Blaine County is simply mind-blowing. From the bustling city streets to the serene countryside, every inch of this virtual world is a visual treat.  The gameplay is equally exceptional, offering a seamless blend of action, driving, and exploration. The controls are smooth and responsive, ensuring an immersive experience whether you're cruising in a luxury car or engaging in high-octane shootouts.  But what truly sets GTA V apart is its gripping story mode. The characters are well-developed, and the narrative is both thrilling and thought-provoking. The game's multiple protagonists add depth and variety to the storytelling, making it an unforgettable journey through the criminal underbelly of Los Santos.  Moreover, the online mode provides endless hours of fun. The variety of activities, from heists to races to free-roam shenanigans, keeps players engaged for years. The regular updates and new content additions by Rockstar Games ensure that the online world of GTA V remains fresh and exciting.  Negative Comment:  However, there's one glaring issue that continues to plague GTA V on PC, and that's the rampant presence of modders in the online community. While modding can enhance the single-player experience and lead to some creative and fun gameplay additions, it's become a double-edged sword in the online realm.  The presence of malicious modders who disrupt the game, spawn impossible-to-defeat enemies, or harass honest players is a significant drawback. It creates a hostile environment that can make online play frustrating and unpleasant for many players. The lack of effective anti-cheat measures has allowed this problem to persist, and it's disheartening to see that Rockstar hasn't addressed it adequately.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V on PC is an incredible game that excels in graphics, gameplay, and story mode. However, the persistent issue with modders in the online community casts a shadow over an otherwise fantastic gaming experience, making it challenging for honest players to enjoy the game to its fullest. Rockstar Games should take stronger measures to curb this problem and ensure a more enjoyable online experience for all players.

Rating: ★★★★★ (5/5)  Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) is a true masterpiece of gaming, an extraordinary experience that sets the bar high for open-world action-adventure games. Developed by Rockstar North and published by Rockstar Games, this title has earned its place in the annals of gaming history for its remarkable storytelling, vast and immersive world, and an unparalleled level of detail.  A Thrilling Tale of Crime and Intrigue: At the heart of GTA V is its engrossing narrative. The game effortlessly weaves together the stories of three complex protagonists: Michael, a retired bank robber trying to escape his past; Franklin, a street-smart hustler looking for a way out of the gang life; and Trevor, a volatile and unhinged ex-military pilot. Their paths intersect in a gripping tale of crime, ambition, and betrayal that keeps players hooked from start to finish.  A Living, Breathing World: Los Santos, the fictional recreation of Los Angeles in GTA V, is a marvel in itself. It's a sprawling, dynamic city filled with bustling streets, diverse neighborhoods, and an array of activities. The attention to detail is astonishing, from the realistic traffic patterns to the vibrant ecosystems found in the countryside. The world feels alive, with pedestrians going about their business, radio stations playing music and talk shows, and a day-night cycle that adds to the immersion.  Endless Activities and Diversions: GTA V offers an abundance of activities beyond the main storyline. Whether you want to explore the underwater depths, embark on a hunting expedition in the wilderness, or engage in a thrilling race, there's always something to do. The variety of side missions, challenges, and hobbies ensure that boredom is a concept that doesn't exist in this open-world gem.  Unparalleled Attention to Detail: Rockstar's dedication to detail is evident in every nook and cranny of the game. The characters' facial expressions, the meticulously designed vehicles, the witty in-game radio commentary, and the intricate interiors of buildings all contribute to an unparalleled level of immersion. It's a testament to the developer's commitment to creating a world that feels authentic and lived-in.  Online Multiplayer: Grand Theft Auto Online adds a whole new dimension to the GTA V experience. It allows players to explore Los Santos with friends, engage in heists, participate in races, and create their own criminal empires. The constantly evolving online world ensures that there's always something fresh to experience, fostering a sense of community and camaraderie among players.  Continued Support and Updates: Rockstar's commitment to GTA V doesn't end with its initial release. The game has received numerous updates, expansions, and content drops, ensuring that it remains relevant and exciting years after its launch. This ongoing support speaks to the developer's dedication to the GTA V community.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V is a tour de force in the world of gaming, a title that effortlessly combines a gripping narrative, a living, breathing open world, and an abundance of activities to create an experience like no other. Its attention to detail, commitment to storytelling, and ongoing support make it an enduring classic that will continue to captivate players for years to come. Whether you're a longtime fan of the series or a newcomer, GTA V is an absolute must-play, a game that sets the standard for what open-world gaming can achieve.  also  Rating: ★★★★★ (5/5)  FiveM stands as a true testament to the limitless potential of modding in the gaming world. Created by the CitizenFX Collective, this modification platform has taken the already incredible Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) and transformed it into a dynamic playground of boundless creativity, earning its rightful place as a game-changer in the realm of online multiplayer.  Endless Creative Freedom: FiveM catapults GTA V into a realm of infinite possibilities. It offers a platform where players and server owners can craft their own multiplayer experiences. Whether you're interested in intense role-playing, action-packed races, immersive storytelling, or crafting entirely new game modes, FiveM provides the canvas and the paintbrush, allowing you to create your unique masterpiece within the GTA V universe.  A Vibrant and Collaborative Community: At the heart of FiveM is its passionate and thriving community of developers, modders, and players. This collective spirit fuels the platform's constant evolution, ensuring that it remains at the forefront of creativity and innovation. Whether you're a server owner looking to create a unique experience or a player seeking adventures, FiveM's community-driven development guarantees that there's always something fresh and exciting on the horizon.  Stability and Performance Excellence: FiveM places a premium on stability and performance. Unlike some other mods, FiveM servers are exceptionally reliable and optimized, accommodating large player counts without sacrificing performance. This commitment to quality ensures that every session is smooth and enjoyable, eliminating the frustration of crashes and lag.  Immersive Role-Playing Experiences: The role-playing (RP) community within FiveM is a shining example of the platform's potential. RP servers offer players the opportunity to immerse themselves in intricate and immersive storylines, assuming diverse roles within the GTA V world. The depth of character development, detailed scenarios, and player interactions within these servers is unparalleled, creating an authentic and engrossing experience that captivates and resonates with players.  Diverse Array of Servers: FiveM boasts a diverse selection of servers, each offering a unique atmosphere and gameplay experiences. Whether you're seeking realism, fantasy, or something entirely unconventional, you'll find a server tailored to your preferences. This diversity guarantees that every player can discover their ideal FiveM home.  Security and Fair Play Emphasis: FiveM places great importance on maintaining a fair and secure gaming environment. By implementing anti-cheat measures and ensuring strict adherence to fair play principles, FiveM ensures that all players enjoy a level playing field and a secure space for their adventures in Los Santos.  In summary, FiveM is nothing short of a revolutionary force in the world of gaming. It transcends the boundaries of GTA V, opening up a world of limitless creativity, collaboration, and unparalleled experiences. Whether you're interested in role-playing, game development, or simply exploring the incredible breadth of player-generated content, FiveM is the ultimate gateway to a universe of boundless adventures within Los Santos. It's a shining example of the transformative power of modding and community collaboration, and it's an absolute must-try for anyone seeking to redefine their GTA V experience.

"Gourmet Grand Theft Auto 5: A Recipe for Mayhem"  Introduction: Turn the virtual world of "Grand Theft Auto 5" into a culinary adventure with this tongue-in-cheek recipe. While you can't actually cook in the game, let's concoct a metaphorical dish that embodies the essence of GTA 5's chaos and action. Warning: No actual cooking required!  Ingredients:  A Sprinkle of Recklessness  Start by adding a dash of recklessness to the mix. This represents the daring stunts and wild driving that GTA 5 is known for. A Pinch of Crime Drama  Stir in a pinch of crime drama, reflecting the game's intricate storyline filled with heists and criminal activities. A Dollop of Chaos  Add a dollop of chaos to the mix. This symbolizes the mayhem and destruction that players can unleash upon the virtual world. A Splash of Wit and Satire  Incorporate a splash of wit and satire, as GTA 5 is known for its humorous take on social and political issues. A Garnish of Immersive Open World  Sprinkle the dish with a garnish of an immersive open world, highlighting the vast and detailed landscape of Los Santos. Instructions:  In a metaphorical gaming pot, combine the recklessness, crime drama, chaos, and satire.  Stir vigorously, simulating the action-packed gameplay of GTA 5.  Let the mixture simmer while exploring the expansive open world, savoring the sights and sounds.  Continue to stir occasionally, keeping the chaos and unpredictability at the forefront.  Serve hot, in the form of an unforgettable gaming experience, and enjoy the metaphorical flavor of "Gourmet Grand Theft Auto 5."  Note: Eat responsibly.

I got this game when I was 13 and completely no-lifed it through my teenage years.  I think it's a great game with an under-appreciated story, a great soundtrack, and a shit-ton of replayabillity. It plays smooth as silk.  GTA Online is great, but not without huge flaws. A majority of my time played was in GTA online. It's a great sandbox with a lot of worth-while content to play, especially with friends. But holy hell, it lost its soul over the years. There's a lot of tedium, a lot of paywalls, and little to no balancing in the PvP or in-game economy, not to mention the modding problem on PC. There's still a lot to enjoy, but your experience may vary depending on what you value, and your patience.

Buy it for the Single Player.  Do not touch the Multiplayer.  I would give it a thumbs up BUT modders can kill you even if you mind your own business in Single Player.  I HATE Rockstar for how easily they let modding scum run rampant. GTA 6 wont be different form this.

If you're getting GTA 5 for the love of god, get it for the story mode, enjoy that and then ignore online unless you're playing via something like FiveM. Base GTA Online is one of the worst experiences that forces you to either pay or grind for hours to get one car that looks kinda cool. Developers upping the Cayo Perico heist cooldown when done solo really did online in for me, personally. Raising cooldowns on solo, efficient grinding methods while showing ads for the micro transactions in the hour long loading screen is a complete joke. I have more fun in Red Dead Online and Rockstar does not care about RDO at all.   GTA Online is infected with so many levels of irony poisoning that Rockstar isn't even sure if they're parodying themselves or not anymore.  Besides that, fantastic story mode with admittedly repetitive gameplay in most missions. Heists, Three's Company and the missions like those are a nice break from the formula of "Drive here, kill a bunch of guys, drive again, kill again, done." that the series has faced criticism for. The real focal point is the story but I'm sure you knew that already.  Story mode 9/10  GTA Online 2/10

Even 8 years later, this game is easily one of the best that you can buy.  Whilst GTA Online has gone in a direction I don't like - and wouldn't really recommend in engaging very much with to complete newcomers by this stage - I can't ignore that it still has thousands of hours to offer players across a variety of different activities - there's something for everyone in GTA Online and it will also make them money whilst they're at it.  Single Player is also undeniably a brilliant experience. Even though it will take you a while to get through to the end of the story, there's really no excuse for not playing it through at least once.  A lot of us have got a bit tired of this game in the many years since it's original release, but from an objective point of view, even if this game released for the very first time this year, it would still be one of the best video games ever made and blow us all away.  The driving is much easier than GTA 4, literally anyone can be a decent driver in GTA 5 unless you have brain damage, but I guess it makes it more accessible, lol. Shooting is also much improved and is high quality, and those two elements combined with many others, including but not limited to the excellent map, make this game a perfect sandbox

First off the game is great, in fact it's amazing. Everyone knows that.    I can't recommend this game though because of the awful Social Club and equally awful Rockstar Games Services DRM B.S. you have to deal with.    Played this game fine a few years ago.  I go back to play it and it turns out the email I used to set up Social Club is one I no longer have access to.  Therefore I can't login and can't play the game. Period.   I've been in contact with Rockstar support for a week and still haven't resolved the issue.  I've gone back and forth with them five or six times and every time they want some other proof I bought the damn game. I've sent them four or five screenshots of receipts, Steam ID bla bla bla and it's never enough.  It's ridiculous.  Now even though I have a current Social Club account with an email I can actually access they need a THIRD email to use to "update my account"?  WTF?  Forget it I'm sick of it.  I even bought a physical copy off of Ebay to try and get around this issue.  No go, Physical copy makes no difference.  Unless I continue to jump through their hoops I will never be able to play GTAV again on PC.  Seriously you guys made tons of money off this game what's the deal with the draconian DRM?  I'm old enough to remember when you bought a game on PC it came in a nice box with a nice manual and maybe even some bonus items with an actual CD or (GASP) floppy disk that contained the entire game and it was yours to keep and play forever.  Now for your money you get a digital copy that's DRM protected to a ridiculous degree that you can't play if you want to try and change something as simple as your email.  Crap like this is why gaming just isn't as fun as it used to be.  Those days are gone, greed has completely taken over the industry when it comes to AAA games such as this.  Loved the GTA series up until this point but this is so stupid guys, I'm out on GTA6 not that it makes any damn difference.

I've been playing GTA V since it's initial release on the Xbox 360 back in 2013. Obviously it wasn't a consistent play time, it was off and on. Today, I received an email stating my account has been suspended for 30 days an my character reset. I figured it was a bad attempt at a phishing email, so I brushed it off. As the day progressed, I thought about that email more and more, and gave in. I loaded up GTA and got into story without any issues(as it should), then proceeded to try to join online. Right then, it hit me. Suspended for 30 days and character reset.  Since cheating had come to online play, I have exclusively played in invite only sessions to avoid the chance of running into someone who would throw money at me. Did this make the game slightly more difficult? Yes, but was worth not having to worry about cheaters.  I went to open a ticket to just try to find out what would justify the suspension/reset, but I am unable to even do that since you can't dispute the issue. GTA, you were once a game that I loved and enjoyed playing, but this is the end for me. I'll patiently wait for GTA VI to release. It was a good run.

Welcome to Los Santos, the city where every traffic jam is an opportunity and every pedestrian is a potential punchline. "Grand Theft Auto V" is not just a game; it's a chaotic carnival of crime where the rules are made to be broken, and the laughs come faster than you can steal a sports car.  Let's talk about the main characters: Michael, Trevor, and Franklin. These guys are like the Three Stooges of the criminal underworld, with a little less slapstick and a lot more firepower. Michael's midlife crisis is a comedy goldmine, Trevor is a walking, talking wrecking ball of insanity, and Franklin is the guy trying to keep it all together while wondering how he ended up in this circus.  Now, the city itself is your playground, and the possibilities are endless. You can rob a bank, fly a plane, drive a tank, or just play a round of golf with the same enthusiasm and incompetence as a toddler in a candy store. And if you're feeling particularly artistic, you can create your own chaos masterpiece, starring you as the criminal Picasso of Los Santos.  The radio stations are pure gold, with DJs and talk show hosts that are funnier than most stand-up comedians. You'll find yourself driving aimlessly, just to hear the next ridiculous radio skit or catchy tune. And don't even get me started on the in-game internet. It's like a parody of the real thing, complete with hilarious ads and social media that makes you question the sanity of the virtual world.  But it's not all fun and games in Los Santos. The police are like an overzealous neighborhood watch on steroids. One minor fender bender, and suddenly you've got a 5-star wanted level, and half the city's police force chasing you down. It's like the world's worst game of tag, and you're "it" for life.  And let's not forget the pedestrians. They're like a walking, talking sitcom cast. They'll insult you, make inappropriate comments, and sometimes even try to fight you. It's like being in a never-ending episode of a reality TV show where everyone's competing for the title of "Most Outrageous Citizen of Los Santos."  In conclusion, "GTA 5" is a wild, open-world sandbox where crime and comedy collide in a spectacularly entertaining fashion. It's a game that lets you live out your wildest criminal fantasies while laughing at the sheer absurdity of it all. So, grab your controller, steal a car, and get ready for a rollercoaster ride through the hilarious and chaotic world of "Grand Theft Auto V"!

Продолжим нашу экзикуцию Я ставлю игре средний бал еслиб стим позволял поставил бы и визуально Начнем с минусов, в сравнении с прошлой игрой серии гта 4 многое поменялось, поехали. Зачем нам рпг за пазухой в которой соседствует ещё 3 волыны карабины и 3 пулемета и попутно 9 пистолетов? хрен его знает. Физика машин, о да в гта 4 было приятно мять машины но машины просто могли взорватся и все, в гта 5 немного порадовало что можно пробить бензобак или начнет капать масло и движок заглохнет, но как можно было так ухудшить управление машин и повреждения?! Карта игры, в гта 4 явно видны черты треугольника из гта 3 к примеру аэропорт хоть и переехал немного но все же +- города похожи с той разницей что в игре прошло 7 лет от гта 3 до гта 4 но тоже странно но ладно. Гта са события идут в 1992 году в гта 5 2013, 21 год разницы событий у игры как за 21 год у Лос Сантоса появилось +- 10 высоток в центре города, город стал как лабиринт выросла огромная хер знает откуда загорадная местность которая даже в Гта Сан не было и самое главное куда пропали соседние города Сан-Фиерро и Лас-Вентурас?! It's unfortunate there is yet to be another game as ambitious as this one. A game that could rival the decade old GTA V in scope, a game that could be owned and operated by a competent company that actually cares about the state of their project and the satisfaction of the community.   It's a travesty that GTA V is the only game in its class, because Rockstar sucks. I'll never understand how I've amassed over a thousand hours on this shit-show of a game that progressively gets worse in an infinite loop of one step forward, two steps back. It's clear that Rockstar wants to push the game in a FOMO direction, and they're not subtle about it in any way. They removed the ability to purchase hundreds of vehicles that had been added over time, and they now drip-feed a handful of them every week. The "GTA+" battlepass shlock they're pushing on consoles is only further indicative of this direction. They want to incentivize players to pay exuberant prices for in-game content instead of providing more viable means of earning currency in-game. As I write this, Rockstar is allegedly planning to nerf the BEST way to make money in the game, on the basis of wanting to, "provide players with greater incentives to experience the full range of content available." Why not just make EVERYTHING to be a viable source of income? Why not increase the payouts of adversary modes and content missions, why not make outdated businesses with poor payouts like Import/Export actually viable? Because at the end of the day, Rockstar's main goal is to make money. They don't care about encouraging variety in their gameplay: They want players to give up the grind and give in to micro-transactions. It's too bad that the GTA community doesn't have the same solidarity and willpower as other communities—I'm looking at you, War Thunder. Perhaps if the community created enough of an uproar, things would change for the better.   But even if we ignore the blatant greed of Rockstar and the way they have gradually fucked over the economy of the game, the state of GTA Online on PC is sad. Rockstar has almost entirely neglected the game. Everyone knows about the modders. They're not that big a deal, apart from the ones who have the ability to crash the game for YOU specifically (among other malicious exploits I've yet to encounter), but they are still a nuisance.   On top of the godmode abusers present in every lobby, there's a whole set of content that PC players have been refused access to—content entirely exclusive to current gen consoles. Why? No one fucking knows! Rockstar is anything BUT transparent: It has been over a year since the "Expanded and Enhanced" edition of GTA released for those platforms, yet Rockstar has never once broken silence about the delayed released of the content on PC. The entire lack of communication between the community and the developers is inexcusable.  I've put a lot of time into this game, and I still continue to despite my grievances, but it's not worth it. If you've yet to play GTA Online, or you're considering returning, heed my words: Do not waste your time with this game. At least not in the way I have. Have fun blowing your friends up with bazookas. Just try not to get caught up in the intoxicating pursuit of wealth.  That said, GTA V's story isn't bad. A bit dated, sure, but I'd reckon it's still worth playing.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

There are 2 sides to GTA V, there is the story mode and there is the... online, or I guess you could call it hack-fest. My review isn't on the online portion of the game though. I would have to say the game of GTA V is probably one of the most nostalgic and well crafted game mechanics out there! If I were to recommend this game to anyone I would recommend to play the story! This game has an amazing story to it, well put together and just an all around well told story all the way up to the final missions of the game. The voice acting is top tier! The cast did an amazing job getting you immersed into the story, you can genuinely feel the characters and their emotions I would almost say its kind of like a movie almost. The game works well not very many bugs maybe a few here and there but what game doesn't. This story is one to definitely remember, one of the best stories to a modern day game based in todays society portrayed in a really well put way! There isn't very many games based in our time-frame or our modern life mostly they are based in the future or way in the past or they are horror games. For a game to feel as real as GTA V with top tier voice acting and a well put together story I would have to recommend this game for that reason alone... don't play online.

[h1] My GTA V Review [/h1] [h3] Rating: 4 out of 10 stolen cars [/h3] [hr][/hr]  [h2] Graphics [/h2] The graphics of the game are good, and even though the game was released over 10 years ago, you can still enjoy them. However, graphics are not the most important aspect, as we all know.  [h2] User Interface [/h2] The user interface is simple yet clear; I have absolutely nothing to complain about in this regard.  [h2] Performance [/h2] With my PC, I've never had any issues with the game and could always play it at maximum settings. However, this also depends on the type of PC you have.  [h2] Controls [/h2] The controls are simple and fully customizable, but they could offer more (I personally miss functions like being able to lie down in combat, and sometimes, the weapon wheel behaves a bit strangely).  [h2] Story in Singleplayer & Characters [/h2] The story mode is decent. The narrative isn't outstanding but is still interesting. The three main characters are well-written, although they can sometimes come across as cliché. Nonetheless, each of them has a (limited) background story, and you understand their motivations for their individual actions. Unfortunately, I personally miss the ability to influence the story or at least individual missions and the option of three different endings doesn't make it any better when the path to them is absolutely linear, and as a player, you have no influence on the game world or anything else. I'll give half a point for the singleplayer heists, which offer at least two different approaches for most heists, providing some variety.  [h2] Character, Weapon, and Car Customization & Modifications [/h2] I think it's cool that you can customize, tune, and paint your weapons and cars as you wish, both in singleplayer and multiplayer. There are more options available for cars, which makes sense. When it comes to clothing, it's a bit different. While you can customize your character in multiplayer and distribute outfits accordingly, you can't do the same in singleplayer. The outfits of the playable characters always reset (unfortunately, you also can't change the main vehicle of the three main characters in singleplayer).  [h2] Immersion [/h2] While the game world of GTA V initially looks lively because it's filled with NPCs going about their activities, it becomes clear that it's not quite as dynamic as it appears. NPCs sometimes behave strangely, repeat the same animations when certain events occur, and sometimes, they don't even have a sense of orientation. For instance, I observed a police car ramming into my car repeatedly for about 3 minutes instead of simply going around it. It's also bizarre how quickly you can accumulate wanted stars from the police and how fast they arrive, respawn, and seem to always know your exact location. Another annoying feature in multiplayer is the calls you receive every time you enter the game. These are usually 2 to 4 calls from NPCs telling you the same things. You have to answer these calls each time before you can hang up.  [h2] City & Game World Exploration [/h2] The game world is large, offering a variety of different areas, making it feel like a realistic city and its surroundings. There's a large urban area representing a typical US city, areas with a lot of nature, and smaller, more remote towns.  [h2] Music [/h2] The music in the missions is okay but nothing special. What I find fantastic, however, is the selection of radio stations; there's something for every musical taste, and if someone can't find anything they like, there's the feature to add your own music. Simply fantastic!  [h2] Gameplay & Missions in Online Mode [/h2] After about 10 years, the online mode is a joke. Initially, when I bought the game, I liked it because of the many options for character customization, apartments, garages, and the open world to explore and complete missions. Unfortunately, the game, at least for me, quickly became boring because the missions are often the same or similar, making it less enjoyable.  [h2] New Content & Updates? [/h2] Over the years, some content has been added to the multiplayer (not always good content), while the singleplayer was left empty. New cars and weapons were never implemented in the singleplayer, probably because they couldn't make additional money from it.  [h2] Online Balancing & Pay to Win [/h2] In multiplayer, there are sometimes ridiculously overpowered weapons and cars that throw the game's balance out the window. These items, as well as some clothing and cars, are so expensive that it's tedious to earn them in-game. But luckily, you have the option to buy Shark Cards (in-game currency) with real money! (Sarcasm) This way, you can have the perfect combination of overpriced in-game items that pay-to-win players can easily acquire (if they're willing to invest their hard-earned money into an online game)...  [h2] Apartments & Garages [/h2] When I saw that it was possible to buy apartments and garages at the beginning, I was excited and saved up until I could afford one. Unfortunately, the disappointment was greater than I expected: from the cheapest to the most expensive, they have very few functions (except for being chosen as spawn points and some having a garage for cars). You can interact with some things, like drinking smoothies, watching TV, or getting your character so drunk that they pass out. While garages still serve a purpose, apartments are pretty much useless (unless you want to plan heists). You're better off investing your extra money in a good armored car or weapons.  [h2] Cheaters & Modding [/h2] I could maybe overlook these other issues if GTA Online could finally deal with the wave of cheaters. The problem existed years ago, and it still exists today. Players who play normally get banned, partly because of cheaters (who might shower you with a ton of money in a short time, resulting in an automatic ban), while players who obviously cheat, using explosive ammunition, becoming invincible, teleporting, or blatantly spawning cars, whales, or Ferris wheels, don't get banned, or it takes forever. Today was the first time in a while that I played GTA V, and when I entered multiplayer, it was hard to find a lobby without at least one cheater unless you're in a private session.  [h2] Replayability [/h2] I would play the game again for the story mode, as I currently do. While other games have captivated me more, it always depends on personal preference and the type of games one prefers. To experience different endings or have an alternative to multiplayer, it's worth it.  [h2] Summary [/h2] If you're interested in the story mode, I can still recommend it, but the multiplayer is absolutely not worth it (anymore).  Rating: 4 out of 10 stolen cars, would not recommend

Buyer beware- Do not purchase this game with the expectation that you'll actually be able to play this game in public lobbies. Every. Single. Lobby is filled with kids using Mod Menus. I won't list all the stuff that they do but it's constant kicking from lobby, crashing your game, forcing animations on your character, teleporting you to random missions in the game, dropping weapons on your character that are a major pain to get rid of, taking control of your character when driving or doing anything, removing all cars from lobby.   These mods make all the load times longer. & guess what happens to the poor kids that report these blatant cheaters? The mod menu notifies the mod user that a report has been sent, tells them who sent the report, and blocks the report from ever making it to the server. So guess who starts getting harassed? A young unsuspecting kid.   Online is unplayable, it's a horrible experience. Rockstar promoting the PC version of this game as "Online" is nothing short of fraud. There is no online, there are public lobbies filled with modders. Absolute dumpster fire.  If you purchase this game with the intention of playing it online, I assure you, you will be very disappointed.

"Grand Theft Auto V: My Second Life as a Digital Daredevil"  Rating: ★★★★★  Grand Theft Auto V, the game where I've discovered my alter ego as a digital daredevil. Move over, Evel Knievel, I've got a rocket-propelled motorcycle and a thirst for mayhem!  Pros:  - I've learned that in Los Santos, the traffic lights are mere suggestions. Green, red, or blue, I'll drive through them all - and sometimes even the buildings! - The game's pedestrians have a unique way of coping with chaos. They'll scream, curse, and sometimes even join me in my criminal escapades, like they've been waiting for a chance to break bad. - I've become a fashion icon. Whether I'm sporting a tuxedo while robbing a bank or a Hawaiian shirt while parachuting from a helicopter, I'm always dressed for success. - GTA V has taught me that versatility is key. One minute, I'm a mastermind heist planner, the next, I'm a stuntman extraordinaire, and then I'm just a guy trying to play golf in the middle of a gang war.  Cons:  - My sense of traffic rules is a bit skewed in the real world now. My passengers aren't thrilled when I try to reenact my highway adventures. - My friends and I have turned every online session into a chaotic competition. Who can survive the longest with a 5-star wanted level? Who can jump a motorcycle over the most rooftops? The winner gets bragging rights, but everyone else ends up in the hospital. - I've developed a habit of looking for hidden packages in real life, hoping to stumble upon a stash of cash or a shiny weapon upgrade. So far, no luck. - GTA V has ruined my ability to watch a movie without considering how much chaos I can cause with a helicopter in that same scenario.  Grand Theft Auto V is a digital playground where you can embrace your inner outlaw, explore a sprawling virtual city, and create the most insane stories with friends. It's the kind of game where you'll start a mission but end up in a completely unrelated adventure, like skydiving into a military base just for kicks.  To those considering a visit to this virtual world: Buckle up, enjoy the madness, and remember that in GTA V, the only limit is your imagination, and the occasional rocket launcher.  In conclusion, GTA V is where I've learned that sometimes, life's best moments happen when you drive off the beaten path... literally.  Overall rating: ★★★★★

Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) stands as a true masterpiece of open-world gaming, and it's not hard to see why. Rockstar Games has crafted an experience that delivers on every front, from its expansive open world to its captivating characters and engaging gameplay.  One of GTA V's most striking features is the sprawling, beautifully detailed city of Los Santos. The level of realism and attention to detail is nothing short of astonishing. Whether you're cruising down the busy streets, exploring the gritty neighborhoods, or soaring over the stunning landscape in an aircraft, the world feels alive and dynamic. The diversity of environments, from the urban jungle to the tranquil countryside, adds to the game's immersive quality.  But it's not just about the world; it's the people who inhabit it that make GTA V shine. The game's three protagonists—Michael, Franklin, and Trevor—are incredibly well-developed and offer distinct personalities and backgrounds. Their intertwining stories create a narrative that's engaging and full of memorable moments. The voice acting is top-notch, making these characters feel like real people with their quirks and flaws.  The sheer variety of activities and missions is staggering. From high-octane heists that require meticulous planning to offbeat side missions that can range from absurd to touching, GTA V keeps you constantly entertained. The game never forces you down a linear path, allowing you to explore at your own pace and choose how you want to tackle missions.

This game fucking sucks lol.  Between a billion game breaking bugs, everything constantly crashing, horrendous enemy balancing, and some absolutely dogshit players, I should not like GTA V. In between productive segments, things almost always break down into inter-group mayhem and it's the funniest thing every single time. No other game allows me to finish a mission with friends and then immediately send them flying cross-map with the ass end of my car.   Also just, really good for putting on a podcast and keeping your hands busy for a few hours. Hell, that makes up about half of the hours I do have.   overall, this game is not good, but it's fun, and I can absolutely recommend it for its now miniscule price.

When you finally play GTA V 10 years after release and realize it's still cooler than your ex's Instagram feed...  😎🚗 "Rollin' through Los Santos like a boss!"  🌟 Story: 10/10 GTA V's story hooks you harder than a catfish on a fishing line! It's like binge-watching the best crime drama while being the star of the show. You're in for a ride, and you won't want to get off! 🎥🔥  💥 Open World: 11/10 Los Santos is basically a character in itself. It's like a living, breathing city where anything can happen. From high-speed chases to epic ramp jumps, the possibilities are endless. You're the director of your own action movie!  🎵 Music and Visuals: 9/10 The tunes are so fire, you'll feel like you're in your own music video. And the visuals? It's like someone poured HD sauce all over your screen. You can practically smell the exhaust fumes and feel the city's pulse.  🎯 Missions and Side Missions: 69/10 Every mission is like a mini heist movie. Explosions, shootouts, and more plot twists than a soap opera. And the side missions? They're like little nuggets of gold scattered throughout Los Santos. You'll never run out of things to do!  ⏳ Timeless Classic: 10/10 Playing this 10 years after release, and it's still as fresh as a brand new game! GTA V was basically the Elon Musk of its time—way ahead of the curve. Rockstar really knew what they were doing.  🚀 Overall: 10/10 "Grand Theft Auto V" isn't just a game; it's a cultural phenomenon. A game so good, it ages like fine wine. If you haven't played it yet, what are you even doing with your life? Get ready for a ride that'll leave you saying, "I can't believe I waited this long!" 🌆🎮

I just wanted to share with you all my experience playing GTA V. It's one of the most immersive and entertaining games I've ever played! The attention to detail in the open world is incredible, and the story is both compelling and engaging.  I love how much freedom there is in the game - I can choose how to complete missions and what activities to engage in, and there's always something new to discover. The game's graphics and animations are top-notch, and the driving and shooting mechanics feel very smooth and satisfying.  I've also spent a ton of time exploring the vast multiplayer mode with my friends, which has been an absolute blast. We've tried out all the different game modes available and have had so much fun messing around in the open world with our custom characters.  As a gamer, I can confidently say that GTA V is one of the best games out there right now, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone reading this. With its huge amount of content and incredible replayability, you'll find yourself coming back to GTA V time and again.

There is a work around that get you into and empty session, which is great if you are going about it all solo, but it's not a great work around if you are trying to play with friends. This port of the game really has trouble on PC especially with newer hardware (like RTX 3060 and I7-10) I have gone through a bunch of videos and websites explaining how to prevent the countless crashing I experienced, which unfortunately seems pretty common. I changed & updated everything that was talked about on the computer and in game. I even downloaded FPS optimization packs that are reported to help with the initialization error crashes. There were two types of crashes. Initialization errors that are tied to the graphics cards (reportedly) and full crashes without error that just sent me back to steam.   I powered my way through the campaign and lost track of the "fixes" that I had to do that were overall unsuccessful. I am now uninstalling the game and not touching it again. I find it frustrating and disappointing that such a popular game has such a bad PC port and that it is up to the community to try and fix and optimize the game. I mean Rockstar are the same people that charge $50 for a red dead 1 port when recent full remakes of games have been an average of $40. Why should I expect for them to manage one of their biggest sources of profit when the fans are doing it for them...

Grand Theft Auto V is a true masterpiece that continues to captivate players with its deep and immersive gaming universe. It's not just a game; it's an experience that will leave a mark on your gaming memory.  Right from the start, the game draws you in with its multitude of possibilities and a dynamically alive world. From the sprawling city to rural landscapes and untamed nature, every corner of the virtual world springs to life before your eyes. You can freely explore, interact with characters and the environment, and, of course, embark on incredible heists and adventures.  The seamless transition between playable characters adds a unique dimension to the gameplay. Each of the main protagonists has their own distinct story, skills, and personality, allowing you to fully immerse yourself in diverse aspects of the plot and gameplay.  The story campaign in GTA V captivates with its intrigue and unexpected twists. You'll encounter thrilling missions that provide an adrenaline rush and serve as a true test of your agility and strategic thinking.  The multiplayer mode, GTA Online, is a sandbox for creativity and fun. You can create your own gangs, participate in competitions, races, and join a vast community of players to collaboratively plan elaborate heists or simply enjoy quality time together.  Equally impressive is the technical aspect of the game. The graphics, animations, and sound design come together to create an incredibly realistic world that fully engulfs you in the gaming universe.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V remains an undeniable classic in the world of video games. Its deep world, captivating narrative, multi-faceted characters, and the opportunity for online interaction make it a must-play for both seasoned gamers and newcomers. Don't miss the chance to dive into this unique gaming world and become a part of its history.

Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) is nothing short of a gaming phenomenon, and it's easy to see why. Rockstar Games has crafted an open-world masterpiece that continues to captivate players worldwide. Here's why I can't stop praising this game:  First and foremost, the open-world of Los Santos is an absolute marvel. It's vast, diverse, and teeming with life. From the bustling streets of downtown to the serene beauty of Blaine County's wilderness, every inch of this world feels meticulously designed and alive. Whether you're driving like a maniac, flying high above the city, or exploring off the beaten path, there's always something exciting to discover.  The story is another highlight. With three playable protagonists, each with their own unique personality and motivations, GTA V offers a narrative experience unlike any other in the series. The characters are brilliantly written, and the voice acting is top-notch, bringing them to life in a way that makes you genuinely care about their fates. The heists, in particular, are thrilling and masterfully executed, providing some of the most memorable moments in gaming.  The freedom GTA V offers is staggering. You can choose to follow the main story, embark on countless side missions, or simply wreak havoc in the city. The variety of activities is mind-boggling, from adrenaline-pumping car chases to leisurely rounds of golf. The sense of immersion is unparalleled, thanks to the attention to detail in every aspect of the game.  Speaking of detail, the graphics are a testament to Rockstar's dedication to creating a visually stunning experience. Even years after its initial release, GTA V continues to impress with its realistic lighting, weather effects, and meticulously crafted environments. It's a game that looks and feels ahead of its time.  GTA Online adds even more longevity to this already massive game. The multiplayer mode allows you to create your own criminal empire, participate in heists with friends, and engage in a wide range of activities in the ever-expanding online world of Los Santos. The constant updates and additions from Rockstar keep the online experience fresh and exciting.  The soundtrack is legendary, featuring a diverse range of music across various radio stations. Whether you're into classic rock, hip-hop, or electronic beats, you'll find something that suits your taste, enhancing the atmosphere of the game.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V is a triumph of open-world game design, storytelling, and sheer fun. It's a game that continues to evolve and impress, even years after its release. If you haven't experienced the chaos, thrills, and adventure of Los Santos, there's no better time than now. Jump into this virtual playground, and get ready for a wild, unforgettable ride!

Grand Theft Auto V? More like Grind Fest Auto V.  Okay, I'd be lying if I said I haven't been enjoying the new content that's been added since the last time I played GTA Online 5 years ago, but the sheer amount of grinding you have to do to buy anything due to everything being priced ridiculously high now is insane. Like, you need to have a ton of money before you can a buy a business so can make enough money to be able to afford to buy stuff. Also, no fun to be had in public lobbies as they're still plagued by griefers, so I've only been playing in invite only lobbies, essentially playing GTA Online as a single player game. If you're thinking about buying the game in 2023 and starting from rank 1 in Online, don't bother.   Obviously this is a review of GTA Online. I don't think anyone is buying GTA V for the single player story anymore.

REASONS WHY GTA V IS NOT FUN  NO 1: MANGOTHEORY Mangotheory is a bot that happens to join the lobby and ruin the experience for everyone. When it joins, the avatar stand still as if AFK with godmode (allowing it to be uninterrupted with re-spawning) and starts to promote their MONEY/XP and Unlock glitches in the public chat. they then promote their discord channel for you to join to acquire cheats. This has been confirmed to be a bot by many players I've spoken to in the chat.   NO 2: Real Cheaters Unlike Mangotheory (a bot), you can encounter many real people who have found a way to bring a cheat engine into the public lobbies. These players have many abilities to screw over the players in the game. Ability 1: Godmode  Godmode make the player impossible to kill, giving them the advantage to follow you around and kill your avatar anytime they feel like it, making it impossible to have fun with others who a trying to enjoy the game. Ability 2: Teleportation  Teleportation remove the need to chase down another player when trolling. Everytime I've tried to escape a cheater would just teleport right next to me and kill me. This Teleportation cheats is so bad that it even allows cheaters to enter a your apartment (in-game), meaning that even the safe zones aren't protected. Ability 3: Messing with your Avatar  I've only played this game for a short time but have already lost count of the amount of times my character has been killed out of the blue without any warning. Cheaters can essentially nuke a public lobby, killing all present players simultaneously, which would just lead to an argument in the chat. one time i ran into a cheater that made everyone in the lobby slowly levitate into the sky and then dropping us to our deaths and even after re-spawning you would go back to levitating forcing everyone to leave and join another lobby. Ability 4: Server Wide Kicking  When a cheater happen to get in an argument with an actual player, it always ends with the cheater kicking everyone from the public lobby and sending us to a solo lobby, which makes the player having to go through the hassle of joining another public lobby to interact with players again. Ability 5: Messing with level and money Within my first 10 minutes of playing GTA V Online i was learning all the basics of what i can do and how to do it (Tutorial). When i was given the chance to finally free roam the GTA V world and do as i please, my screen was filled with notifications saying I've collected 10/10 collectable/secrat cash. This gave my player $1M of in-game currency and my level jumped from 1-30 in an instant allowing me to unlock the achievement  "reach rank 25". When i had a look at the chat it was one cheater saying your welcome and then leaving the game after promoting where and how to get the hacks. This took away the fun for grinding for money and items if they were this easy to obtain with cheats.   NO 3: Public Lobbies When i bought GTA V i was expecting to run into a couple of bad apples or sweats who player the game seriously, mixed in with a couple of nice players who would make it fun. but in order to have any fun with the online aspect of GTA V you would have to either play with friends on in a crew only session or find any discord servers which promotes a private server to join without cheaters.  NO 4. Anti-Cheat This is my first time playing GTA V online and I've never experienced a game with a terrible anti-cheat system. Until  I see that Rockstar has introduced and implemented a functional anti-cheat system.  Thanks for your co-operation  Sab

Rockstar's Grand Theft Auto V is a massive open-world action game that offers an incredible amount of freedom to explore the vast city of Los Santos and surrounding countryside. After its initial release in 2013, it still holds up well nearly a decade later as one of the most ambitious and entertaining open world games ever created.  GTA V allows you to play as three different protagonists - Michael, Franklin and Trevor. Each character has their own skillsets and special abilities, and you can switch between them at will. This gives you a lot of strategic options during missions and allows you to see the story from different perspectives.  The sprawling open world is packed with details that make Los Santos feel like a living, breathing city. There are countless vehicles to drive, stunt jumps to make, random events to discover and side activities like tennis, golf and scuba diving. The amount of content is almost overwhelming.  Missions provide plenty of over-the-top action, from large scale heists to street races and shootouts. Gunplay feels impactful and driving mechanics are smooth. Even mundane activities like customizing cars is enjoyable thanks to the level of depth and options.  With amazing writing, voice acting and character development, GTA V's story and satire of Southern California life is entertaining from start to finish. Though some themes and humor haven't aged perfectly, it's an engaging crime story fueled by greed and a memorable cast of characters.  GTA Online has kept the experience feeling fresh for years with new modes and content updates. It does have some repetitive grind, but playing and wreaking havoc with friends is a total blast.  Some gameplay and graphics elements feel a bit dated now, but GTA V remains one of the most impressive open world experiences out there. The incredible attention to detail paired with exciting action and dark humor makes this a crime saga not to be missed.

Well, as a fan of GTA games, I can say that GTA V is a good game. But the game has four cons for me.    Firstly, I don't like the story of the game. If you want to earn some cash, to play normal, I recommend you to play in private session. And if you want to enjoy online, you need to have friends to play online with them. GTA Online missions are good, can say that better than the story missions.   Third con is about chatting system in online. Sometimes you can see your friend's chat, sometimes can't.    Fourth con is about online again. Well, there were some guns, cars in the game, but then Rockstar removed them from the game, that's why I think that older players have more advantage about that things which I mentioned.  Edit: Rockstar fixed third and fourth problems. Well done

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead– murdered by my brother-in-law, Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now, and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, he asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded. I... I always thought Hank was a very moral man, and I was particularly vulnerable at the time – something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me in on a ride-along and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin, so I agreed. Hank had a partner, a businessman named Gustavo Fring. Hank sold me into servitude to this man. And when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling-out. Things escalated. Fring was able to arrange – uh, I guess... I guess you call it a "hit" – on Hank, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured. And I wound up paying his medical bills, which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge. Working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring. The bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA. To keep me in line, he took my children. For three months, he kept them. My wife had no idea of my criminal activities, and was horrified to learn what I had done. I was in hell. I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, and in response, he gave me this. [Walt points to the bruise on his face left by Hank in "Blood Money."] I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. All I could think to do was to make this video and hope that the world will finally see this man for what he really is.

I've had so much fun and met so many people while playing this game, not to mention all of the content there is, its practically endless. If any new player read this and decide to get the game I have a few tips, don't buy a low-mid end apartment, buy a high end one, but don't get expensive ones. You can get one for 200k which might seem like a lot, but you can make that back from the original heists. Also buy the diamond casino membership in-game, it allows you to spin a wheel every 24 hours and get a prize, whether that be money, Xp, or a car. In total Ive had so much fun in this game and will continue to play it untill gta 6 comes out (around march-april 2024)

GTA V Review  Review is after completing the main story missions, all side missions, finding all collectibles, clearing the entire map and achieving 100% completion on single player mode. As a side note: never cared for multiplayer. [hr][/hr]   [b]Story[/b] My favorite GTA game was San Andreas. After playing this game, my favorite GTA game is San Andreas. Yes, that didn’t change. It’s hard to compete against Carl Johnson’s version of the hero's journey. Having said that GTA V is an absolute gem in a caliber of its own. A diamond of a game. I highly encourage gamers to 100% the single player aspect of the game. As you explore the game to find all collectibles you will see just how much detail developers integrated into this world. Also Space Docker is the ultimate vehicle in the game!   [b]Gameplay[/b] Took me a while to figure out how to do the knife flights correctly for the achievement. Other than that, the remainder of the gameplay was superb. I was; however, jealous of all the cool vehicles and weapons the developer implemented in GTA Online.   [b]Graphics[/b] On a league of their own considering how detailed the world is. The only benchmark they need to surpass for the next game is their own.   [b]Controls[/b] Played on PC with mouse and keyboard. Gameplay and gunplay was smooth and responsive.    [b]Side Missions[/b] Completed all of them. I had to, you see, because they were all so good.   [b]Music/Soundtrack/Voice[/b] Excellent curated selection of songs as usual. Voice acting from all 3 main characters was at peak quality.   [b]Performance[/b] Experienced no crashes and the game ran smoothly on my PC (which is a mid-range PC). It did not cause undue heating of the CPU and GPU.   How in the world is Rockstar going to surpass this game? Yes I know they did Red Dead Redemption 2 afterwards, but that game did not have as many moving parts as this game did.  Overall Score 10/10

Rating: ★★★★★  I've had the immense pleasure of diving into the world of Grand Theft Auto V for the past five months, and I can confidently say that this game is nothing short of a modern gaming masterpiece. Rockstar Games has truly outdone themselves with this open-world epic, delivering an experience that sets the bar for open-world action-adventure games.  Graphics and Visuals (★★★★★): From the moment I stepped into the fictional city of Los Santos, I was awestruck by its breathtaking visuals. The attention to detail is astonishing, with stunningly realistic character models, lifelike environments, and a day-night cycle that adds depth and immersion to the world. Even after months of gameplay, I still find myself stopping to admire the sunrise over the city or the reflections in the rain-soaked streets.  Gameplay and Mechanics (★★★★★): GTA V seamlessly blends a gripping narrative with an open-world playground that encourages exploration and experimentation. The three playable protagonists, Michael, Franklin, and Trevor, each bring their unique personalities and skills to the table, making for a diverse and dynamic gameplay experience. The controls are intuitive, and the variety of vehicles, weapons, and activities at your disposal ensures that boredom is a foreign concept in this game.  Storyline and Characters (★★★★★): The narrative in GTA V is an absolute triumph. It's not just a crime caper; it's a thought-provoking exploration of the American Dream, ambition, and morality. The three protagonists' intertwined stories provide a refreshing perspective on the criminal underworld, and the supporting cast of characters is as memorable as they are unpredictable. The sharp writing and superb voice acting elevate the storytelling to new heights.  Multiplayer (★★★★★): Grand Theft Auto Online adds another layer of enjoyment to the game. Whether you're racing with friends, tackling heists, or simply causing mayhem in the vast open world, the multiplayer mode extends the game's longevity indefinitely. Frequent updates and a thriving online community ensure that there's always something new to discover.  Conclusion: Grand Theft Auto V is an enduring gem in the world of video games. Five months into my journey, I'm still finding new things to do, new secrets to uncover, and new ways to be amazed by the sheer scale and detail of Los Santos. This game represents a high watermark for the industry and is a must-play for any gamer. Rockstar Games' commitment to quality is evident in every pixel, and the result is nothing short of breathtaking. Five months in, and I can confidently say that GTA V is the best game I've ever played. If you haven't experienced it yet, do yourself a favor and dive into this open-world masterpiece. You won't be disappointed.

Grand Theft Auto V is the most realistic life simulator I've ever played. Forget about those boring "sims" games where you make friends, build houses, and go to work. In GTA V, you can do it all – and then some!  Pros:  Excellent traffic AI: NPCs drive as if they're on a mission to reenact every action movie car chase. Realistic economics: Who knew a life of crime could be so profitable? Just don't ask me how I got that yacht. Endless entertainment: From playing golf to parachuting off Mount Chiliad, there's something for everyone. "Trevor Philips Industries" – the only workplace that never gets old. Cons:  Terrible road rage: It's hard to maintain my zen-like calm when my fellow motorists are trying to recreate the next Fast & Furious movie on the freeway. Clothes shopping addiction: My character spends more on clothes than I do in real life, and I'm not even mad about it. Overall, if you've ever wondered what it's like to be a stunt driver, a skydiving pro, a billionaire playboy, or a criminal mastermind, this game has got you covered. Just be prepared to lose track of time and your moral compass. I've been a criminal, but I've never been so law-abiding in my life – in a video game, of course!  Remember, it's all in good fun, and the virtual world of GTA V is a riot. Just try not to get too carried away, or you might find yourself on the wrong side of the law in real life too!

I'm an Italian gamer and this review was written entirely with Google Translate. I would like to start this review by saying that despite the one star review I love Rockstar products and above all I love GTA V, I have all of Benny's custom cars and 40 other vehicles, I have never had any problems and in fact I have also made purchases to go forward and I don't want to cheat, but I have to say I feel cheated about something that happened. I switch from PS4 to PC and buy GTA, I try to recover the account but I can't and after two days I search on Google and find it written that it cannot be done, which I find absurd given the possibility of cross play. I don't demand a refund but I do demand that a game like GTA V has the ability to transfer accounts from PS4 to PC. I know maybe my review won't mean much to you but I hope you will read it and give a fan the chance to play their favorite game on PC

RockStar Social Club is criminal.  Stop doing this for the single player experience.  I get it for multiplayer and the like.  But your spyware programs are annoying.  Coming back to play after years of inactivity to have a little fun and the game is unplayable until solving riddles of password protections and linking accounts to play a little quiet game. Gamers could never come up with boycott big enough to trash these companies because the game design is excellent and the gameplay is fun, but I certainly wish there would be a proactive effort by these AAA studios in delivering a solution to these grand marketing schemes. My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

This has got to be the most sucked off game ever. There is no reason this game should be as popular as it is. Almost everything about this game is bad. The controls are so confusing is makes you feel like a toddler who has just been told to pilot an F22 raptor. Like why the fuck would middle mouse button open the menu. The loading time is so unreasonably long is makes you wonder if they just make it load for that long to mess with their players. The game play is mid at best, like there are so many other options for games you could play with the same if not better features. And one of the main selling points of the game, the heists, are utter filth found from the deepest depths of the filthiest dump. You spend 45 minutes setting it up just only for one civilian to catch a stray and make you lose all your progress and end up making $20. The game also takes up a whopping 100 gigabytes and, as expected for the size, takes forever yo re install. It is also so poorly optimized on steam, you have to make a social club account and if you forget that password then it's just over for you I guess because the password resetting website crashed every time you enter a new password. Only after you do some stupid extra thing you shouldn't have to do you can then reset your password. And don't even get me started on how hard it is to make money. you feel like you are making good progress and then you realize that the cheapest non shit car is over 1 million dollars. plus, for some vehicles, you need special garages to even buy some of the better things. Ever wonder why this game goes on sale for so cheap. The only reason I play this game is because my dumb ass friends keep asking me to play it. I would much rather do unpaid work than play this game. For anyone who is considering buying this game who hasn't gotten it yet and for those who are considering re installing it, don't.

The game suffered from a real stagnation over all those pvp horrible mechanics, futuristic vehicles being added and much much more. Now it got way better on grinding and it would be great if it wasn't for the cheaters and modders. Not that I'm against on adding money to your account or messing around with friends or even randoms but we all know that most of modders only grief and destroy other people's cargo. Imagine grinding or waiting for a full bunker and watching it all being destroyed by a modder who just orb'd everyone in the lobby. If you bought the supplies you just lost $300k but if you grinded for supply missions you just lost 3 hours of your time playing the game. I'm not saying that you couldn't have known the risk of selling in public lobbies but at this point you are always griefed by modders and if you don't sell in public not only you are losing profit that allows you to buy more stuff and enjoy the game but also you'll find yourself playing all alone as if it was singleplayer with more content.   This game ask players to cheat because no one will grind all their lifes to get an Opel Corsa or even spend 1500€ just to buy everything they want and not worry about grinding. I would grind if it wasn't for modders and I prefere the pc version just for the option of playing with more than 60 fps and with mouse and keyboard.  If you will ban players at least ban the ones messing up with your game everyday just griefing and killing everyone. It's not even a legitimate tactic to grief it's against the rules!   Part 2:  The latest DLC is the worst so far. Took out more content that it added.  The missions are basic except for "On Parade" which gave me a cool challenge actually. There's no story at all, we don't have any cutscenes and the side characters only speak to us on the missions, we never see Charlie at all.  I would actually pay at least 5€ just to play a good DLC or 15€ for all the things half priced. Instead you just make players to pay 6-8 Million dollars to buy an avenger or 1.5M just for the upgrade and what do you get? 350k. Come on.

Title: Grand Theft Auto V - An Epic Experience Marred by Load Times, Cheaters, and Glitches  Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) is undoubtedly a modern gaming masterpiece that delivers an exhilarating open-world experience like no other. From the sprawling city of Los Santos to the captivating narratives of its three protagonists, this game is an action-packed adventure that has set a new standard in the gaming industry. However, amidst the praise, there are some significant drawbacks that need addressing.  First and foremost, GTA V's open-world is an absolute triumph. The attention to detail in recreating Los Angeles is awe-inspiring, and the sheer size of the map is mind-boggling. Exploring this virtual world is a true joy, with an abundance of side activities, missions, and random encounters that keep players engaged for hours on end.  The characters are brilliantly written and performed, with Michael, Franklin, and Trevor each bringing their unique charm and complexity to the story. The narrative is a rollercoaster ride filled with memorable moments and unexpected twists, making it one of the best in the series.  The game's visuals are stunning, especially on more powerful hardware. The attention to detail in the environment, character models, and vehicle designs is nothing short of remarkable. The soundtrack perfectly complements the atmosphere, featuring an eclectic mix of music that suits every mood.  However, the experience takes a hit when it comes to load times. It's baffling that even on high-end systems, players often find themselves staring at loading screens for what feels like an eternity. This issue disrupts the otherwise immersive experience and can be incredibly frustrating, especially when transitioning between story missions and online play.  Speaking of online play, GTA Online has its share of problems. The presence of cheaters and hackers in online lobbies has plagued the game since its inception. It's disheartening to see players exploit the game's mechanics to gain an unfair advantage, ruining the experience for others. Rockstar's efforts to combat these issues have been inconsistent at best, leaving legitimate players to suffer the consequences.  Furthermore, frequent glitches and bugs continue to mar the GTA V experience. These can range from minor inconveniences like mission markers disappearing to game-breaking issues that force players to restart missions or even the entire game. It's frustrating to encounter these problems in a game that has been on the market for years and has received numerous updates.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V remains a gaming masterpiece that deserves praise for its open-world design, storytelling, and attention to detail. However, the long load times, persistent issues with cheaters in online lobbies, and frequent glitches detract from what could be a flawless experience. While it's certainly worth playing for its strengths, it's disheartening to see these issues persist in a game of such high caliber. Rockstar Games should prioritize addressing these concerns to ensure that GTA V continues to shine as one of the greatest open-world games of all time.
