In comparison to it's predecessor, GTA IV, it has significant downgrades in it's physics engine and driving mechanics. The story mode doesn't get anywhere near as dark but it introduces many new fun mechanics. If you're strictly interested in the single player experience, I would honestly recommend GTA IV first. That being said, for people more interested in multiplayer, GTA V's online experience suffers from many issues, steer away from public lobbies. The game has fallen off and all of their content released after 2017 has only contributed to it's downfall.  The only reason I can recommend this game is because despite it's shortcomings and terrible updates, it still has a lot to offer and is typically on sale for $15 or less. Just buy it, it's been nearly 10 years.

Grand Theft Auto V is a sandbox game that takes place in the streets in the fictional crime city of Los Santos (based upon los angeles). Within the game, you can complete missions, heists, own businesses, and one of my favorites: commit mass genocide upon innocent civilians. All jokes aside, GTA is one of my favorite games, just because of the wide variety of content that it offers. You can really do almost anything crime-related that you see in movies, ranging from escaping the cops in a high-speed police pursuit, to robbing the richest man on earth.        The game has two entirely separate parts. There's the story mode, and the online mode. For a person who enjoys a compelling adventure, story mode has one of the best experiences gaming has to offer, with you being able to play the role as a criminal millionaire father of two millennial kids (Michael), a physco named Trevor, or a nice but rough gangster who goes by Franklin.        The online version on the other hand, puts you in a server with around 30 other people, offering a different experience entirely. While you can still do things like rob stores, do heists, and run businesses, the goal of the online version is to simply aquire as much money as possible, and grief other players with the most overpowered vehicles and weapons the game has to offer. This version requires A LOT more time and dedication than the story mode to really do anything, and the grinding that is needed to earn any substantial amount of money is gruesome and tedius. If you don't have irl money to just buy your way up the ranks, or enough time for the insane amount of grinding, I would just focus on the story mode.   Overall, Both aspects of the game are cool, but I'd say the story mode is where the real fun is at. The game doesn't cost much money, and tbh it gives you a pretty good bang for your buck, so I personally would recommend getting it. Anywho that was my opinion. hope ya'll have a good one. peace

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⡿⠿⠿⠿⠿⢿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿ ⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⠟⠋⠁⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠉⠻⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿ ⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⠁⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⢺⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿ ⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠆⠜⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿ ⣿⣿⣿⣿⠿⠿⠛⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠉⠻⣿⣿⣿⣿ ⣿⣿⡏⠁⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⣀⣠⣤⣤⣶⣶⣶⣶⣶⣦⣤⡄⠀⠀⠀⠀⢀⣴⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿ ⣿⣷⣄⠀⠀⠀⢠⣾⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⢿⡧⠇⢀⣤⣶⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿ ⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣾⣮⣭⣿⡻⣽⣒⠀⣤⣜⣭⠐⢐⣒⠢⢰⢸⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿ ⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣏⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⡟⣾⣿⠂⢈⢿⣷⣞⣸⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿ ⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣽⣿⣿⣷⣶⣾⡿⠿⣿⠗⠈⢻⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿ ⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⡿⠻⠋⠉⠑⠀⠀⢘⢻⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿ ⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⡿⠟⢹⣿⣿⡇⢀⣶⣶⠴⠶⠀⠀⢽⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿ ⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⡿⠀⠀⢸⣿⣿⠀⠀⠣⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⡟⢿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿ ⣿⣿⣿⡿⠟⠋⠀⠀⠀⠀⠹⣿⣧⣀⠀⠀⠀⠀⡀⣴⠁⢘⡙⢿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿ ⠉⠉⠁⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠈⠙⢿⠗⠂⠄⠀⣴⡟⠀⠀⡃⠀⠉⠉⠟⡿⣿⣿⣿⣿ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⢷⠾⠛⠂⢹⠀⠀⠀⢡⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠙⠛⠿⢿

FINALLY  I've completed this title a second time now since I completed it in the Xbox 360.  There's not much to say really. Everybody knows GTA V. It's a classic now, I would say. Great story, great mechanics and great soundtrack. A campaign that I've replayed a thousand times already because of how good it is.  On the other hand, I really like GTA Online, but I feel Rockstar has not been the same since all the attention went down only to this section. I would've wanted a more balanced way of dealing with the other games in the company, like releasing a good remaster of the GTA trilogy, to add content to RDO or to simply make new games like they used to. I'm sad about the way the company is right now, and one can only hope they were what they used to be years ago.

宗教と政治はしばしば一部の人々にすべての視点を失い、感情的な子供のように怒鳴り、絶賛し、続けることに道を譲ります。彼らは理性を持ってそれを議論することを拒否するか、そうでなければ彼らは議論を行うための地獄の方法である議論の人身攻撃を好むかのどちらかです。まあ、とにかく、少し前に私は選挙と、キャンペーンがどのように問題を無視し、代わりに攻撃的で個人的ながらくたに固執しているかについて話していましたそれは政府を運営することの実質的な問題とは何の関係もありませんでした(あなたが候補者のスピーチといわゆる討論に従ったならばあなたが知っているように、それはすべて真実です)。とにかく、私が話していた男の一人は、彼が突然笑って、私たち全員がshtでいっぱいだと言ったときを除いて、会話全体で一言も言わなかった、そしてそれが私たち全員がアメリカ合衆国を憎む方法だったのなら、なぜ私たち全員がロシアや中国に住まなかったのか!次にあなたが知っていることは、咲く議論全体が乱闘のようであり、形容詞は厚くそして速く飛んで、騒音は信じられないほどでした!誰かが「雌犬の息子」と言った、そして私は彼が「ろくでなし!」と言ったと思う。(私は確信が持てませんでした;それはすべてとても混乱していました。まあ、とにかく、私はそれをすべて合理的なレベルに戻そうとしていました。たとえば、私はそれをすべて始めた人と話をしようとしました、そして私は彼に私たちが皆たわごとでいっぱいであるとはどういう意味ですか?彼はそれを知っていたように事実の陳述をしていましたか、そして彼の主張を裏付ける彼の文書はどこにありましたか?ソクラテスは私が彼の議論に反論した方法を誇りに思っていただろうと思います。つまり、私はそれに反論しようとしました。しかし、彼が反論として提供できたのは、私たち全員がたわごとでいっぱいだったことについて、もっと同じでした。しかし、彼は理由を言いませんでした。彼はただそれを繰り返し続けました。それとロシアと中国と共産主義のカモについての部分。そして、私は少し腹を立てて、彼のアイデアを彼のお尻に詰め込むように彼に言ったことを告白しなければなりません(あなたが私に言う必要はありませんが、議論で誰かを説得する方法はほとんどありません)。それから彼は塩辛くなり、私が黙らなければ私に口にパンチを与えると脅しました。そして、私は本当に熱くなり、他の人も熱くなりました。そして、私たちは皆、保守党氏のshtを打ち負かしました。そして、結局のところ、彼は非難されるのは自分自身だけでした。これはまだ自由な国であり、私のような仲間に「兄弟、あなたはsh * tでいっぱいです」と言う人は誰でも、理由を言うかどうか尋ねられたときに丁寧に答える準備ができています!

Alright, let's get one thing straight – the story in GTA V? Yeah, it's like it was given to a 16 years old pi*mp to write it, it's a hot mess that even a Brain death wouldn't write. But hold up, before you go running for the hills, this game still shines brighter than a supernova.  I mean, come on, we're talking about a game made by Rockstar. It's like Rockstar read the book of mayhem, tore it up, and rewrote it with a rocket launcher in hand. And hey, let's not forget that the online chaos is like a never-ending party in the underworld.  Sure, the story might be a dumpster fire, but let's not kid ourselves – this game is like an old buddy from way back when. Nostalgia hits you harder than a freight train, and you can't help but remember the good times you've had with this bad boy. I've practically lived, breathed, and thrown controllers at the screen because of this game. It's the kind of nostalgia trip that makes you wanna hug your console and thank it for all the hours of pure insanity.  So, let's cut the crap and give credit where it's due. GTA V might have a story that's more messed up than a pi*mp on caffeine, but damn, it's the kind of mess we can't help but love. It's like that crazy ex you can't forget – infuriating and irresistible at the same damn time. So grab your weapons, rev up those engines, and dive headfirst into the chaos, because this game is a wild ride you won't want to miss.

GTAV story mode has dozens of hours worth of content to offer, and i have to point out that i don't personally know anyone who attained a 100% completion yet. That's just about where the fun ends; GTA Online is completely broken, and instead of fixing known issues, Rockstar games keeps adding new content that breaks the game even more.  all the new content that Rockstar Games adds is boring, there's nothing interesting. all the latest missions basically force you to use heavy weapons like minigun, RPG, etc. which gets boring very quickly. It's straight up impossible to finish them with a simple assault rifle, whether it's caused by a dozen enemies spawning at your own spawn point, or the fact that the NPCs have an absurd accuracy and can give you a headshot even when they don't see you through the bushes.  Old content has few missions that keep repeating over and over and become repetitive very quickly - at this point I am doing them just for the money, and even then i often don't want to launch them.  Public online sessions are unplayable, you have about an 80% chance of joining a lobby with a cheater who will teleport you all across the map against your will, lock you in a cage, explode you, or even give you modded money which can easily result in you getting banned and having your entire progress reset. Rockstar games has supposedly done some changes recently, but I have not noticed any difference, same goes for my friends.  I couldn't forget to mention how Rockstar games has recently removed almost 200 old vehicles with no rational explanation. They are now incredibly difficult or impossible to obtain, even though many of them were very popular in the playerbase. The reasoning Rockstar games has given us is that "they wanted to remove vehicles that weren't being purchased very often, to reduce how much we would have to scroll on the websites."  GTA Online also used to have many different competitive jobs, especially adversary modes. I remember browsing through a list of hundreds of different adversary modes the game had to offer. Recently I have come to the horrible discovery that Rockstar games has yet again deleted the old content and that the list now contains barely 60 adversary modes, and exactly none of the ones i used to play. I haven't found any announcement about this anywhere, only people complaining about it and being equally as confused as me  TL;DR: this game is absolutely not worth buying in 2023 and onward, and that's coming from someone who's been playing since 2016. If you do want to get it, do yourself a favor and wait for a sale

Honestly at this point i would not recommend GTA V it has been 10 Years and it just has a lot of issues. Leveling up in the LS Car meet takes an insane amount of time their is no fast way to do it, unless you wanna leave you PC on idle for hours to unlock car meet exclusive liveries. The Dre contract while it can earn you a good amount of money the 40 minute cool down or so really kinda kills it. This game has really become more of a cool down simulator where you always have a timer before you can make big money. Which is of course intentional because shark cards exist and they want you to buy those. Grinding is very tedious in this game. so many vehicles and customization's are locked behind other items you have to purchase which could be really annoying. The heists are a good way to make money, but if you have no one to play with it can be difficult to do alone and at times just are not worth it. Now GTA V can be fun to play online with friends and the story is not terrible by any means. But all the stupid tactics they use to make everything as annoying as possible in hopes that you will buy their shark cards is well unbearable at times. I have put many hours into this, most of it is from idle leveling in the ls car meet. Not really worth it though. You also can not have more than one vehicle out at a time which is frustrating. It should allow you to have at  least your car and jet out at the same time. You also can not fast travel to your own,owned properties. The cut scenes for missions and heists are not skippable because of how they were developed also you can not turn off dialogue alone because it is mixed with the SFX and listening to Lester and Franklin, Dre etc gets really old really fast.

Peanut Butter Cookies  Ingredients 1 cup unsalted butter 1 cup crunchy peanut butter 1 cup white sugar 1 cup packed brown sugar 2 large eggs 2 ½ cups all-purpose flour 1 ½ teaspoons baking soda 1 teaspoon baking powder ½ teaspoon salt Directions Beat butter, peanut butter, white sugar, and brown sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth; beat in eggs. Sift flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt into a separate bowl; stir into butter mixture until dough is just combined. Chill cookie dough in the refrigerator for 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Roll dough into 1-inch balls and place 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Flatten each ball with a fork, making a crisscross pattern. Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden, about 10 minutes. Cool on the baking sheets briefly before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. (nice game tho)

"Grand Theft Auto V (GTA 5) is an exhilarating open-world action-adventure game that captivates players with its sprawling virtual world and immersive gameplay. Set in the fictional city of Los Santos, the game offers a richly detailed environment where players can freely explore, engage in various activities, and embark on a gripping criminal narrative.  The game boasts stunning graphics and attention to detail that bring the city to life, from bustling urban streets to serene countryside landscapes. The variety of characters, each with their own stories, adds depth to the narrative, making for a compelling single-player experience.  GTA 5's gameplay is a seamless blend of story missions, heists, and a myriad of side activities. Whether driving high-speed vehicles, participating in thrilling shootouts, or just enjoying leisurely pastimes like tennis or golf, there's never a dull moment. The diverse range of vehicles, weapons, and customization options ensures that players can tailor their experience to suit their preferences.  One highlight of GTA 5 is the innovative "GTA Online" mode, offering a dynamic multiplayer environment. Friends can team up to tackle missions, races, and challenges, or engage in more chaotic activities like open-world mayhem and heists. The constant updates and new content injected into the online world keep the experience fresh and exciting.  While GTA 5's storyline and gameplay are undeniably engaging, it's important to note that the game's mature themes, including violence, crime, and adult content, may not be suitable for all audiences. Despite this, GTA 5 remains a standout title in the gaming world, offering a blend of action, exploration, and storytelling that continues to captivate players."

I used to love this game, now however it is unplayable online. In every session you will find hackers who have modded their game in some way, which disrupts the whole server and can cause grief to any player playing on it. Other hackers don't even bother modding their game, but instead can tell you your own IP address - best to use a VPN if you do play online.  Mostly though, it's the mod hackers who pull out laser guns and can edit any other player's location, appearance or environment that you got to watch out for. You'll also find that Rockstar are very tolerant of these kinds of players, unfortunately.

Hello and welcome what is hopefully my final attempt at completing GTA 5 without taking any damage. I have a max HP of 1 so any damage from any source will immediately kill me. I also want this to be a no-hit run, so Trevor's special ability is disabled. Because while it prevents you from taking damage, it does not prevent you from being hit by things. I have successfully completed every single mission without taking any damage. I should have yet to do it all in one go. My current personal best for an entire run is one bit of damage and therefore one death. Obviously very close to a perfect run, so I'm hoping this time I'll get an actual perfect run and avoid all damage entirely.

Go ahead and report them all you want, because in a new feature Rockstar rolled out with this game, they simply won't give a shit! Rockstar will never, *never*, under any circumstances, ban a griefer who is openly modding in an online lobby, but if you should ever find an exploit that allows you to make money quickly without your obligatory tithe to the almighty Shark Card, you can expect your account to be reset and/or banned within the hour.  Money exploits are patched instantly. High payout missions will be immediately nerfed. Any possible chance of having fun in this game will be immediately identified by Rockstar's elite teams and removed before you can actually get the idea that maybe this is a fun game. I cannot believe this game is turning 10 years old.  Even if you dislike open world games, even if you prefer another GTA title over this one, and despite the pit that is GTA Online and the downright disgusting and disrespectful treatment towards fans and modders from Take-Two Interactive, there is no denying just how special Grand Theft Auto V is.  This absolute beast of a game in single player still feels like the most rich, beautiful and entertaining open world game ever made; even after having finished it on all 7th and 8th gen consoles and PC.  From excitedly coming home from school on September 17th 2013 to a freshly collected pre-order for the Xbox 360, to reluctantly buying this game a fifth time on Steam in 2023, every playthrough feels like a fresh experience. Whether it be the order in which I tackle main and side missions, a new detail I never noticed previously, a random event I don't recall or never discovered, switching up my approach to a heist, a radio song making action in the moment more impactful or just finding a new way to make my own fun out in free roam; GTA V is a timeless masterpiece and I think I'll be revisiting even another decade down the line, even if GTA VI tops it.  Bravo, Rockstar Games. Thank you.

Grand Theft Auto V: A Captivating Dual Experience - Story Mode and Online Fun!  ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5/5) - An Epic Crime Saga Awaits! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐  GTA V is an undisputed classic that continues to stand the test of time. Rockstar Games has crafted a masterpiece that seamlessly weaves two enthralling experiences: the thrilling Story Mode and the expansive Online world. Whether you're a fan of immersive narratives or crave open-world chaos with friends, GTA V delivers in every aspect!  **Story Mode:** From the very first heist to the last adrenaline-pumping escape, GTA V's Story Mode takes you on a roller-coaster ride through the criminal underbelly of Los Santos. The diverse trio of protagonists, Michael, Trevor, and Franklin, bring unique personalities and perspectives, making the narrative engaging and unpredictable.  The city of Los Santos is a living, breathing entity filled with vibrant characters, stunning landscapes, and a plethora of activities. Exploring the world is a joy in itself, with countless side missions, activities, and random encounters scattered throughout the map.  The missions are incredibly well-crafted, offering a balanced mix of action, driving, and exploration. The ability to switch between characters during missions adds a refreshing tactical element, giving you multiple perspectives on unfolding events.  Furthermore, the attention to detail is second to none. The radio stations, pedestrians, and city life all contribute to the immersive experience, creating an atmosphere that draws you deeper into the game's captivating universe.  **Online Mode:** Once you've exhausted the single-player campaign, GTA Online welcomes you to an ever-evolving multiplayer playground. The sheer scale of the online world is astonishing, and the possibilities are boundless.  Forming a crew with friends or joining a public lobby opens up a wealth of activities to enjoy together. Whether you're competing in adrenaline-pumping races, pulling off daring heists, or just causing chaos in the streets, GTA Online ensures you're never short of thrilling experiences.  The regular updates and expansions bring fresh content, keeping the online community engaged and excited. From new vehicles and weapons to engaging game modes, there's always something new to explore and conquer.  One of the highlights of GTA Online is the potential for player-created content. Rockstar's Creator tools empower you to design your own races, deathmatches, and other custom experiences, fostering a vibrant and ever-growing user-generated community.  **Conclusion:** Grand Theft Auto V continues to shine as a crowning achievement in the gaming world. With its compelling Story Mode and ever-expanding Online Mode, the game offers an unparalleled combination of storytelling and open-world freedom.  Whether you're a single-player enthusiast or crave chaotic multiplayer fun, GTA V caters to all tastes. Its exceptional attention to detail, engaging characters, and a dynamic world ensure that every session feels fresh and exciting.  If you haven't experienced the epic saga of Grand Theft Auto V, I wholeheartedly recommend diving into its thrilling story and exploring the vast possibilities of GTA Online. Strap in for an unforgettable journey filled with heists, high-speed chases, and endless adventures in the sprawling playground that is Los Santos!

I am a 55 year old biker and trucker father, and probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my son many happy memories.  Thank you

GTA V's story mode is an absolute masterpiece of gaming narrative. With its captivating characters, compelling plot, and immersive gameplay, Rockstar Games has created an unforgettable experience. Stepping into the shoes of Michael, Franklin, and Trevor, players are taken on a thrilling journey through the crime-ridden world of Los Santos. The seamless switching between the three protagonists and the exhilarating heist missions make the gameplay engaging.  Beyond the main storyline, the game offers a plethora of sidequests and activities, adding to the richness of the experience. The production is top-notch with a stunning open-world environment and graphics that seem to sand strong to this day. GTA V's story mode sets the bar high for gaming narratives and is a must-play for both series fans and newcomers.

As a new player of Grand Theft Auto V, I must admit that I was blown away by the sheer scale and detail of the game. Rockstar Games truly delivered an open-world masterpiece that leaves players immersed in a virtual playground of crime, action, and adventure.  Graphics: 9.5/10 The graphics are stunning, with a vibrant and lifelike portrayal of Los Santos. The city feels alive, and the attention to detail in both urban and countryside environments is impressive.  Gameplay: 9.5/10 The gameplay is diverse and engaging, with a compelling storyline that features three unique protagonists. The open-world design allows for unparalleled freedom, offering a wide range of activities and missions to enjoy. The combat mechanics are solid and satisfying, providing an adrenaline-pumping experience during intense moments.  Multiplayer Experience: 9/10 The seamless transition between single-player and GTA Online mode enhances the social aspect of the game. Co-op missions and competitive activities provide endless fun, though the competitive nature of the GTA Online community might be intimidating for new players.  Character Progression and Customization: 9/10 The character progression system and customization options add depth and personalization to the game. Players can grow and improve their characters, making them uniquely their own within the vast world of Los Santos.  Learning Curve: 8.5/10 The game's immense scale can be overwhelming for newcomers, leading to a slightly steep learning curve. Understanding the controls and mechanics takes time, but the rewarding gameplay makes it worth the effort.  Mature Content: 8/10 GTA V's portrayal of a gritty and realistic world occasionally pushes the boundaries with mature content and themes. While it adds to the game's authenticity, it may not be suitable for all players.  Overall, as a new player of GTA V, I thoroughly enjoyed my time in Los Santos. The game's vast open world, engaging storyline, and plethora of activities kept me entertained for hours on end. Grand Theft Auto V is an iconic title that has rightfully earned its place as one of the greatest open-world games of all time. Whether you're a fan of action, exploration, or simply want to create chaos in a virtual world, GTA V delivers an experience like no other.

Grand Theft Auto V is an open-world action game with a variety of different gamemodes. The game features a single-player story and an online world which has received many updates and improvements over the years. Although GTA online has been receiving countless updates, R* still hasn't managed to do anything about a cheater problem. There are many other problems in GTA online besides cheaters including griefers, long loading times and forced co-op work. Many features to ease out solo player have however been added to the game but still at least a one friend is required to unlock and enjoy all the activities the game contains.  [h1]Gameplay[/h1] [b]Story[/b]: There are three protagonists ([i]Michael, Franklin and Trevor[/i]) and the story follows their criminal life. Can't say if I enjoyed the story or not since I have yet to finish it.  [b]Missions and Heists ([i]online[/i])[/b]: There are a lot of missions in GTA online some of which can be completed solo while others require 2 or even 4 people. Heists have a couple of setup missions and the whole heist usually takes around an hour to complete. Single missions however take somewhere between 5-20 minutes each. There are nowadays sort of mini-heists introduced in tuners update which have 2 setups and take around 20-40 minutes to complete.  [b]Unbalanced enemies ([i]online[/i])[/b]: The missions and heists have very different enemies especially if we compare and old mission to a new one. A lot of the enemies are quite easy ([i]cops for example[/i]) to defeat but then there are few missions where the enemies just straight up murder you from a mile away. Doomsday heists are a pretty good example of a very difficult enemies. However a civilian with a car is the most dangerous enemy in the entire game. It is just simply impossible to know what they are going to do. They might for example randomly run you down or head on collide with you on a motorway.  [b]Unbalanced payouts ([i]online[/i])[/b]: As mentioned previously there a many mission and heists. Most of the missions have a horrible payout for amount of time they take to complete. Some of the heists are a perfect example of this. Let's take two heists for example which both take around one hour to complete, other pays $500,000 and the other pays $1,500,000. I wonder which one I should play hmm... oh... I forgot to mention that the first heist requires 4 players while they second can be completed solo. There are also shark cards that can be bought to gain some extra money. But the payouts of those ([i]including the slight increase a while ago[/i]) are even more horrible than some of the missions. For example the biggest shark card costs $75 and that will give you $10,000,000 in game which doesn't sound too bad. However when you take a look of what you can actually buy with it is like 3 cars and maybe a shirt. You can just as easily save your $75 and make the $10,000,000 in game in like 5-8 hours while having some fun with the process.  [b]Properties and Vehicles ([i]online[/i])[/b]: There are a lot of vehicles in GTA online some of which you are still able to buy anytime due to recent changes. Most of the vehicles however cannot be bought anymore from the websites but have to either be bought from a dealership or win as a prize when they appear ([i]dealership deals and prizes change once a week[/i]). There are also a lot of properties in the game most of which you have to own to play some of the missions and heists. Pricing of the properties is somewhat balanced but pricing of the vehicles is not. There are for example a lot of over $2,000,000 cars which are absolutely garbage to drive. I seriously recommend new players to watch some guides before buying anything ([i]vehicles mostly[/i]).  [b]Cheaters and Griefers ([i]online[/i])[/b]: GTA online has a lot of cheaters and griefers. Some of the cheaters however are harmless but most are not and they will try to ruin everyone's experience playing the game. I wouldn't recommend anyone to play in a public lobby for this reason. Don't lose faith in the game just because the community is what it is.  [h1]Would I recommend this game?[/h1] - Yes ([i]wouldn't really play over 2000 hours otherwise[/i]). - Definitely worth it if on sale, the game has many problems but still a great game underneath. - Don't, in the love of god, buy shark cards.

Just to be clear, I'm leaving this review for GTA Online. I haven't given the story a try, so if you're looking to purchase for the single player, disregard this review.  GTAO is not worth playing anymore, at any price. The content is great, and there aren't any games that really scratch the same itch (including RDRO), but the game is so unstable that I can't recommend anyone try it if they don't already own it. Half of your time is spent actually getting into a lobby, between long load times and straight up crashes/freezes. Once your in, you might also find that content just doesn't work or is difficult to actually access (multiple times I'll load into a lobby to find that I can't launch my Securoserve or Motorcycle Club, for example). And even then, when everything is working, every single lobby is filled with hackers/modders. This is not hyperbole, I legitimately have not played a lobby without someone spamming booming noises trying to get me to buy GTA$ or spawning NPCs to murder me or any other number of griefing hacks.  You can eventually get the game to function and when it does it's fantastic. Like I said before GTAO's content is fantastic and incredibly unique, but to get to the gameplay you have to wade through an ocean of dogshit. If you're considering picking up this game just to play Online, look elsewhere. GTAO is no longer worth your time.

Coming up on 10,000 hours in this game. I can safely say it has taught me programming.  I used GTA:V as a stepping stone over 5 years to teach me a lot of programming concepts, and explore various technologies by building multiplayer experiences through alternative multiplayer frameworks such as alt:V and FiveM.  This game has had a profound effect on my life through third-party multiplayer mods and it took me at hour 9,000 to actually play the single player of this game. I never even bothered with the story because I was so enthralled by writing small game modes using alternative clients.  As a programmer, or someone who wants to become a programmer. Take a look at some the alternative mods because they can teach you a lot. I've since moved on to game development.  This game jump started my professional career as a software engineer.

I've never been a fan of GTA. As a kid, I played a few titles like GTA: Vice City and GTA: San Andreas, but they never really held my interest for long. I quickly lost interest, to put it shortly. However, this year (although now I regret not doing it earlier), I decided to give GTA V a chance, and I don't regret it at all. I always used to say that GTA games are senseless, just mindless chaos, car thefts, and being a ruthless serial killer - I mean... I still partly think that, but this time, I set aside my prejudices and fell in love with GTA V. The story, characters, Los Santos, side activities, attention to detail, dialogues, all of it just keeps me hooked! Every hour spent in GTA V brings me a lot of laughter and gives me so much fun. I haven't tried Online yet; for now, I'm having a blast in Story Mode. I've heard that Online mode is for masochists and people with nerves of steel, who have to deal with hackers/modders in their everyday gaming. Maybe someday, I'll join that Online community and see how strong my mental state is. Anyway, I recommend this masterpiece to everyone.

[h1] One of a legends of open-world !!! 8/10 [/h1] Grand Theft Auto V is an absolute triumph, delivering an adrenaline-pumping gaming experience that's second to none. The vast open-world of Los Santos is a sprawling playground for mayhem and mischief, inviting players to unleash their inner criminal mastermind.  From the moment you step into the shoes of three diverse protagonists, the engaging narrative takes you on a roller-coaster ride filled with unexpected twists and turns. The well-crafted characters, laced with dark humor, make every mission a thrilling adventure.  The attention to detail in this virtual world is astonishing; the bustling city feels alive, teeming with pedestrians and dynamic events that breathe life into the gameplay. The diverse activities, be it adrenaline-fueled heists or leisurely pastimes like golf, guarantee endless hours of fun.  The driving mechanics are smooth as silk, making the thrilling high-speed chases a true delight. The sheer array of vehicles available for hijacking adds an exciting layer of variety to the gameplay.  The online multiplayer component, GTA Online, is an ever-evolving beast in its own right. The multiplayer mode boasts an enormous array of activities and customization options that cater to all types of players, fostering a vibrant and interconnected community.  Graphically, Grand Theft Auto V is a sight to behold, with stunning visuals that capture the essence of an ever-changing metropolis. The attention to detail in every building, car, and pedestrian showcases the developers' dedication to crafting a visually immersive experience.  The soundtrack is a symphony of musical genius, perfectly capturing the essence of each moment and adding depth to the gameplay experience.  Despite some minor glitches, Rockstar Games' continuous support through updates ensures a smooth and enjoyable experience for players. The modding community, too, breathes new life into the game with creative modifications and additions. :) Grand Theft Auto V is a tour de force that elevates the open-world genre to new heights. With its engrossing narrative, seamless mechanics, and a bustling online community, this game is a must-have for any gaming enthusiast. Whether you're an action junkie, a fan of immersive storytelling, or a multiplayer aficionado, GTA V has something truly exceptional to offer. Strap in and embark on this criminal escapade - you won't be disappointed.

This is a legendary game. More precisely, the last part of the legendary Grand Theft Auto series of games, or, briefly, GTA. Although the fifth part of GTA was released to the world a long time ago, it still does not look outdated. This game is still fun and enjoyable to play. And if you don’t play, then just arrange a pogrom on the streets or in the open spaces of a large open world. Even now, the elaboration of the surrounding world is impressive. Even the seabed is detailed. The game has an interesting storyline of three characters that is just fun to play. It's also fun to explore the world. If you are a fan of this series of games, you definitely need to play this game. It's better than reading too many words.  I definitely recommend this game to everyone!

Do you like Grand Theft Auto V? I've been a big Rockstar Games fan ever since the release of their 2001 masterpiece, Grand Theft Auto III. Before that, I really didn't understand any of their work. It was too quirky for my taste. But when GTA III came out in '01, I think they really came into their own, commercially and artistically.  The whole game has a clear, crisp graphics, and a new sheen of consummate professionalism that really gives the gameplay a big boost. It's been compared to Saints Row, but I think GTA has a far more bitter, cynical sense of humor.  In 2013, Rockstar Games released this; Grand Theft Auto V, their most accomplished game yet. I think their undisputed masterpiece is "Three Leaf Clover", a mission where your character robs a bank. The mission is extremely intense and by the time it ends, it has an emotional resonance that's very hard to shake. It's a perfect encapsulation of the narrative strength of the game, something Rockstar has perfected. It's about breaking the law, but on a deeper level, it's a devastating critique of the capitalist machinery that drives our society.  The game's graphics, especially in the Los Santos city, are so bright and incredibly detailed that they really highlight the game's underlying message of the falseness of the American Dream. This isn't just a great action-adventure game, it's a great sociopolitical statement.  But I also think Grand Theft Auto V works because of its three-dimensional characters. Michael, a retired bank robber, is a vivid portrayal of a man struggling with the emptiness of success. Franklin, a young hustler, showcases the struggles of someone trying to escape the harsh realities of urban life. And Trevor, the game's most anarchic figure, provides a chilling glimpse into the psyche of a true sociopath. It's this trifecta of perspectives that makes the game a standout in the gaming industry.  The online multiplayer mode is fun, a great way to blow off steam, and also quite addicting. It adds to the replayability of the game, making it more than worth its price.  You can tell that Rockstar Games was really firing on all cylinders here, because the game's breadth and depth are almost staggering. Every mission feels meticulously crafted, every character brims with life, every satirical jab hits its mark. In terms of sheer scope and ambition, there's really nothing else quite like it.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V's immersive narrative, top-notch gameplay mechanics, and cutting satirical humor make it not just a standout title in the Grand Theft Auto series, but also a high watermark in the history of video gaming. It's only in the context of this complete artistic statement that the brilliance of the game truly shines through.

Honestly, unless you are willing to put an extra $20 (MINIMUM) into a decent mod menu, this game is not worth it. The state of PC GTA in 2023 is pretty rough, with roughly half of every lobby having cheats in some capacity (not hyperbole, genuinely at least 50% of every public lobby you get into).  If you are really dead-set on riding the 2013 nostalgia train, I do encourage you to look up "Stand Free". Stand Menu offers the "Protections" portion of their mod menu to everyone completely for free. This, at the very least, will stop most Griefing, Kicking, or Crashing methods, and it will make your GTAO experience in 2023 at least tolerable.

Grand Theft Auto V (GTA 5) is an absolute masterpiece that has taken the gaming world by storm. Developed by Rockstar Games, this action-packed open-world adventure has set a new standard for gaming excellence. From jaw-dropping graphics to a captivating storyline, unforgettable characters, and a vast, never-ending world, GTA 5 offers an unparalleled gaming experience that will keep you hooked for hours on end.  Visually stunning, GTA 5 boasts some of the most breathtaking graphics ever seen in a video game. The attention to detail in the sprawling landscapes of Los Santos and Blaine County is simply awe-inspiring. From bustling cityscapes to serene countryside views, the game's graphics immerse you in a living, breathing world that feels incredibly realistic. Character models are meticulously crafted, and every aspect of the environment is richly textured. The seamless transition between day and night cycles and dynamic weather effects further enhance the game's visual appeal. Prepare to be blown away by the beauty and realism of GTA 5's graphics. The storyline of GTA 5 is an epic rollercoaster ride that takes players on a thrilling journey through the lives of three distinct protagonists: Michael, Franklin, and Trevor. Each character is skillfully developed, with their own unique personality, motivations, and background, making them relatable and compelling. The narrative weaves a gripping tale of crime, redemption, and the pursuit of the American dream. As you delve deeper into the characters' lives, you'll find yourself emotionally invested in their struggles and triumphs. The non-linear storytelling approach allows players to experience the story from multiple perspectives, adding a layer of depth that is rarely seen in games. The heart and soul of GTA 5 lies in its diverse and unforgettable cast of characters. Michael, the retired criminal seeking to reconcile with his troubled past; Franklin, the ambitious street-smart hustler; and Trevor, the unhinged and unpredictable force of chaos, come together to create a perfect blend of chemistry and conflict. Their interactions and relationships are incredibly well-written, and the voice acting is top-notch, bringing the characters to life in a way that feels natural and authentic. Whether you love them or loathe them, the characters in GTA 5 leave a lasting impression that will stay with you long after you've completed the game. One of the most impressive aspects of GTA 5 is the seemingly endless amount of content and activities it offers. Beyond the main storyline, the game is teeming with side missions, random encounters, and a myriad of recreational options. From adrenaline-pumping heists to leisurely rounds of golf or tennis, there's always something to do in Los Santos. The online multiplayer mode, GTA Online, takes the experience to a whole new level, allowing players to team up with friends and explore the vast open world together. The constant updates and additions to GTA Online ensure that the game remains fresh and exciting, even after years of play. Grand Theft Auto V is more than just a game; it's an interactive masterpiece that sets the benchmark for open-world gaming. With stunning graphics, a gripping storyline, memorable characters, and a never-ending supply of activities, GTA 5 provides an unparalleled gaming experience. Whether you're a seasoned gamer or new to the world of video games, GTA 5 is an absolute must-play. Prepare to be captivated by its charm, immersed in its world, and thoroughly entertained by its endless possibilities. Step into the shoes of Michael, Franklin, and Trevor, and embark on a journey that will leave you breathless and begging for more. Grand Theft Auto V is nothing short of a gaming marvel, and it will undoubtedly be remembered as one of the greatest video games of all time.

After hours in this game, i can assure you that it is only worth your time if you are a cheater or want to play the singe player story mode. Ignoring the constant game breaking bugs and rampant server issues, this game can be fun. However, there are cheaters and modders everywhere who constantly harass you and prevent you from playing the game while you cant do anything about it except leave the game. Cheats include invincibility, teleportation, killing every player in their vicinity or every player in the lobby, kicking everyone from the lobby, transporting everyone in the lobby to a location or specific players to locations, changing it so that it looks like they didn't kill everyone, etc. This doesn't mention how cheaters can openly talk about cheating in chat or how bots will destroy your eardrums by announcing cheats and money for sale to the entire lobby. This especially matters in a game based upon money where cheating can ruin hours of hard work and patience. Until rockstar cares about the player, this game will remain unplayable.

I'm gonna be honest here, GTA V is an amazing game that I skipped out on for years, and after playing it, I can guarantee that the singleplayer story was fun, and messing around offline was also fun, the game's pretty good in that regard.  However, I bought the game in the hopes of playing the Online mode with friends, and ran into a brick wall.  Rockstar requires you to use its Social Club to log into Online mode, and while I hate the use of a separate launcher and service when I already have Steam, I just ignored it and kept going.  That wouldn't be a problem if I could actually log into Online mode, because whenever I tried, it'd display "Social Club is offline - Sorry, Rockstar Game Services are unavailable..."  This wasn't during any downtime in the servers I know of, mind you, this was over the course of several days, and as far as I see, it is an issue that hits a good few people.  I tried every suggestion I could find to fix the issue - restarting my computer, a clean reinstall of the Rockstar Launcher, a clean reinstall of GTA V, fiddling with my firewall settings, tinkering with the DNS settings, and even what Rockstar suggests, and nothing worked.  I could log into the launcher and play singleplayer, but I couldn't even log in in-game.  As far as I can see, the game is just fucked - sure, I can replay the story, but I bought this to play with friends, not to play alone.  In short, buy this at your discretion - it's a fun game, but if you run into the same issue I have, good luck getting past it.  I know some of these fixes work for a few people, but in most cases, I'd wager those're flukes.

A Crime-Fueled Open-World Masterpiece  Rating: ★★★★★ (5/5)  This exceptional work of art is the epitome of open-world gaming, seamlessly blending an immersive narrative with a vast sandbox world ripe for exploration. Rockstar Games has crafted a crime-filled masterpiece that continues to captivate players with its compelling characters, dynamic gameplay, and an ever-evolving online experience.  A Triple Protagonist Experience: GTA V introduces a unique storytelling approach, allowing players to step into the shoes of three diverse protagonists – Michael, Franklin, and Trevor. Each character has their own distinct personality, motives, and story arcs, intertwining in a thrilling tale of crime, loyalty, and betrayal.  A Living and Breathing Los Santos: The fictional city of Los Santos is the star of the show, boasting an incredibly detailed open-world that feels alive at every turn. From bustling city streets to serene rural areas, the world is teeming with life, and every nook and cranny is filled with something to do or discover.  Dynamic Heists and Action: GTA V's heists are a highlight, offering exhilarating missions that require precise planning, teamwork, and daring execution. Whether you're robbing banks or hijacking armored trucks, the high-stakes action keeps you on the edge of your seat, feeling like the mastermind of a crime syndicate.  A Playground of Mayhem: GTA V is all about freedom, and the game encourages you to embrace your wild side. Engage in high-speed police chases, cause chaos with explosive weaponry, or simply take in the sights from the skies with stolen helicopters. The sandbox environment invites you to unleash your creativity and take on the city as you see fit.  Endless Online Adventures: Beyond the single-player experience, GTA Online offers an expansive multiplayer world where you can join friends or meet new players. Participate in a wide array of activities, from competitive races and deathmatches to cooperative missions and heists. The ever-expanding content ensures that there's always something new to enjoy.  Immersive Side Activities: In addition to the main story and online adventures, GTA V features an array of engaging side activities. Play a round of golf, engage in a game of tennis, or try your luck at the casino. These diversions add depth to the world and provide a refreshing break from the criminal underworld.  Visual Splendor and Attention to Detail: The game's graphics are nothing short of extraordinary, showcasing an attention to detail that brings the world of Los Santos to life. Whether it's the vibrant cityscape or the beautiful natural landscapes, GTA V's visual splendor is a testament to Rockstar's commitment to excellence.  Final Verdict: Grand Theft Auto V is an unparalleled open-world experience that has stood the test of time. Its gripping narrative, dynamic gameplay, and ever-evolving online component make it an essential addition to any gamer's library. Embrace the criminal underworld of Los Santos, and immerse yourself in a world of crime, action, and endless adventure in this groundbreaking masterpiece from Rockstar Games.

GTAV through Steam is actualy my second purchase of GTA 5.  I lost my first complete GTA 5 install due to malicious modders. I lost more than two hundred dollars worth of shark card purchases, many, many millions in gta money , real estate, autos, and planes. Over ten years worth of gaming hours and accumulated assets an RP were lost when a modder stole my on-line identity and Rockstar has failed to recover it for me. If you buy GTA for the PC you can expect relentless harassment by modders who can do to you what they did to me and Rockstar can not do a thing to stop them. If you do buy the game, you can also google and check out the Kiddions mod menu. It is a free menu system that allows you to spawn most of the vehicles in the game for use in the current session.  It is a fun game to play on those rare occasions when there are no modders and no one trying to sell you menus to further ruin your enjoyment. Just dont invest more your hard earned money on the game than you want to potentialy lose in an instant.

I think my only complaint would be the fact that most of my friends who do play GTA, play on Xbox so because I have a GTA 5 Xbox account, I hate having to always switch between accounts. GTA Online, the multiplayer mode, has evolved with time, providing numerous engaging activities for players to enjoy. While some may have grown tired of the game over the years, its objective greatness remains undeniable. From an outstanding map design to a perfect sandbox setting, GTA V offers endless hours of entertainment. Regardless of when it first released, it would still amaze players and be hailed as an exceptional gaming masterpiece

Bought specifically to play GTA online, just to check it out after 10 odd years not touching it. Needless to say it hasn't changed much. The Online experience is plagued with cheaters, currency selling spam bots that destroy your eardrums and content solely tailored towards group play. I'm getting old already and my friends don't have time to sit down with me for a 5 hour GTA session. But honestly, I'm just not interested in tailoring my time around others. So I've been playing private lobbies. Fine, whatever, but this leads me to the content offered to my level 15 (only because some hacker was in my first game and was apparently giving everyone xp and cash every little while.) After the tutorial mission with Lamar, you're literally thrown into overwhelming positions and or missions you have no means to deal with.  -Mission to go steal van that has drugs in it. Sure, np. Nick the van and get chased and gunned down by 4 chasing vehicles because only have a pistol. Death, mission failed but hey, got points and money.... Real fun.  -Next I accept some of the criminal empire pack that came bundled with the game. F-ing clueless. So I pick CEO of the bank instead of leader of Bike gang. Take my first mission after spending about 10%  of my networth on bank and warehouse. One crate of narcotics, sweet. Just go and pick it up, there might be some resistance but I've spent some money at a gun van earlier and bought a decent rifle. Head towards the drop, Mayweather has intervened and taken off... IN A HELICOPTER?? The f........ Chased helicopter around for 20 minutes shooting at it with my rifle cause wtf else was I supposed to do? Of course it does nothing and fail because of timer. Half an hour wasted doing nothing but losing money.  I'm sure it's a good game played in a group. But as a "new" solo player just jumping in to explore content for the first time it was by far one of the worst online experiences I have ever encountered. The most fun I had was in the dressing room trying to make  my female avatar more pleasant to look at. The rest was stress, frustration and ultimately disappointment.  Not totally sure what I was expecting. Something along the lines of the single player with the option to run with other players. Of course I'll be (or at least trying to be) checking out more content but HS, after 10 years. This really shows the incompetence (or neglect?) of Rockstar.  Edit: The single player is as good as it was on release.. but that's it. Any and all content released for this game since, has been for GTA online. So if you want a true solo experience you're gated to very limited content. The push to live service is obvious, they can milk people for money but always multiplayer all the time spoils the experience. Be it trolls, spam, cheaters/hacks. It's just unappealing. There's a reason why genuine MMOs and singleplayer online games like Genshin and Honkai cater to solo players.

While the General Concept of Grand Theft Auto is good, There are too many hackers at this point, you have a 60% chance(Or More) that any public session you go into will contain 1 hacker MINIMUM. Other than that, I seem to disconnect from hosts sessions a lot (Mainly Diamond Heists) before even being able to actually join them, causing a wasted 1-3 minutes in loading time every single time I go to try and join that the heist, you also have a lot of people who both kick you, fail to change their sessions to Private to avoid people constantly joining, leading to you being kicked since they only want their friend in there, OR you have hosts that start the mission, then either leave right after, or it's a joined player that leaves after it's already been started, leading to a huge frustration when trying to ever join in on Heists/Missions. You also have people that try and trick you and pull you into helping them with Setups for heists, but then most won't even invite you to the actual heist, leading you to not really want to help people with more of their setups.

If this was 2013, and Obama was still president, I'd give GTA V a 10/10. But it's not 2013 anymore. And Rockstar Games refuses to leave this relic behind for newer titles due to pure greed.   GTA Online is a bloated, shameless, scam of a game that becomes more and more ridiculous with it's greed with with every update. Now they're removing hundreds of previously purchasable cars to put them behind a subscription service. If this was EA or Activision, Angry Joe and The Act Man would be leading a gamer mob to their headquarters. But Rockstar always gets a pass. And this has had dire consequences for gaming.  The fact that GTA V has been milked as long as it has, and red dead online, the supposed "greatest game ever" according to Kotaku journalists, had its online mode abandoned so early, has sent a clear message to Rockstar and take two that they can do whatever they want, and nobody will stop them. No amount of despicable anti consumer practices will ever be punished because "omg guys, GTA VI might come out one day!"   I hate the legacy GTA V, and GTA Online have left for gaming. It sent a clear message to scumbag AAA developers that this kind of nonsense would be tolerated. Just look at Overwatch 2, or anthem, or cyberpunk, or sea of thieves, or no man's sky, or battlefront 2. This is all a result of a post GTA online landscape.   GTA V, I curse the day you ever came out.

Ah yes, Grand Theft Auto. The game series i grew up with. Actually, ive learmed English thru this game. When i was just 4 years old i was already playing GTA IV. with like 7 i started playing GTA V on my brothers PS3, then PS4 abd now PC and PS5. God knows how many years later im still here playing this game.   Story: 10/10 Full with Action, and really good storytelling.  Graphics: PS3: 8/10 for its time it was advanced PS4: 7/10 It has good graphics but PS5 and PC: 10/10 becouse even tho this used to be a PS3 game and is over 10 years old, the graphics are amazing on these two platforms.  Gameplay: 10/10 it just feels amazing, without doubt the best gameplay i had ever seen, untill RDR2 came out.  DLCs: 5/10 used to be amazing but got let down by Rockstar Games and now the new DLCs are just boring. 2 DLCs every year, one in summer and one in winter.  Overall: 8/10 Its just an amazing game i grew up with and even learned a whole language from. If you are thinking about buying it to play the story, do it, its worth it. Online is fun, but buying the game alone for the story is enough. I bought some VR glasses, and later found out that you can play this game with a mod in VR. I played the whole story in VR, it was just amazing.  Thank you Rockstar Games for this title, you made my childhood.  (and Leon even tho we planned to make Operation Militarybase when we was in 3. grade, ad you cant park the Jet you stole in your garage even tho we thought we chould, we have to do it one day (WHEN YOU FINALLY GET YOUR PC))   -Blxfroxt

Shitton of stuff is thrown right at you, and you have no idea where to start, what to do, what is there available from the very beginning, how to start some random DLC RGB LBGT+ update that came out 4 years ago, 3/4 of content requires other people to play.  Your phone is constantly spammed with random bullshit of new stuff unlocked available blah blah blah. UI is horrible, making even Ubisoft design team look good in comparison.   In my 5 hours of playing this, I've managed to rob a few stores, complete 1 race, steal an RV and deliver it to some place, also got a free house and an armored car.   Whats my objective? How to progress the game? Nah, dude, you dont need that, so basically here is some random popup that sends you to a mission with $6000 award.   Jesus Christ, what a mess.

TLDR: The game WAS great. Online isn't worth trying to get into if you haven't already. But, if you just want a fun singleplayer story campgain, the game is still acceptable.   At its core, this game is timeless. It's fantastic for wasting time, whether you enjoy roaming around in singleplayer with a mod menu (or playing the campaign) or screwing around in gta online with friends, but the recent monetization updates have really been trying to kill the online aspect of gta. If you are a new player and you are unwilling to purchase money through shark cards or other micro transactions, it's really not worth trying to get into. And even if you are willing to spend the extra money, be prepared to deal with infinite black screen loading bugs (brought on by modders in the lobby) and other griefing from hackers and modders. And even if you get lucky enough to not be in a lobby with them, good luck avoiding idiots riding flying bikes and shooting you with missiles just because you exist in the lobby.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, my son invited me and he took us into a casino heist.. I was a bit confused about the games mechanics and so I asked my Son for help. my son hosted a game for me to join so he could teach me how to drive a car and how to purchase weapons, we had an absolute blast. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

The friends were imperfect in one way or another, so they helped each other to fill what they were lacking and embarked on a journey to make their wishes come true. The Scarecrow wanted a brain, the  Tin Woodsman wanted a heart, the Cowardly Lion wanted courage, and Dorothy  wanted to return home.  The one they thought to be the great wizard instead gave the Woodsman a lead heart.  "But you're a machine, that means you were built to serve humans. Don't you understand? Machines don't need a heart. Good job making it all the way here though, take this as compensation. Be sure to tell  everyone waiting for you that your wish definitely came true."  Some left with satisfaction. The friends departed and were never to be seen again. The hard, cold lead was depressing.   The Tin Woodsman couldn't agree with this. In anger, he swung his axe through the wizard's heart. The warm heart was pulsing vigorously. He shoved the lead into the wizard's now empty chest. For the first time in his life, the Woodsman started laughing at the sight, and felt a pleasure he'd never had before.  Grabbing a chunk of mushy hearts, he shoves it into his "chest." There will never be enough hearts. Once a Woodsman, he now cuts down people instead of trees. This is a forest full of hearts. No matter how many he cuts down, the forest still remains dense. A kind person would carry a warmer heart.  When the heart is lost, the Woodsman will fall to his knees in sorrow, clutching his empty chest. As if begging for the only thing he has left not to be taken

GTA V is a game that has quickly become a classic, offering a one-of-a-kind open-world gaming experience. With an engaging storyline and well-developed characters, the game offers a story that you can follow through the eyes of three different protagonists.  The game is beautifully designed, with cinematic-quality graphics and an impressive soundtrack. The Los Santos environment is large, varied, and offers an immersive experience you won't want to leave. There's so much to do in the open world of GTA V, you could spend hours just exploring, biking, golfing, and more.  The multiplayer mode, GTA Online, is also offered fun, providing a different gameplay experience than the single-player campaign. You can create your own character, buy properties, run errands, participate in heists and many other online activities with your friends.  All in all, GTA V is an exciting, beautifully crafted and action-packed game that delivers an unforgettable gaming experience. With an engaging storyline, memorable characters, cinematic-quality graphics, and an outstanding soundtrack, this game is a modern classic that every gamer should try. If you're looking for an open-world game with a wide variety of things to do, GTA V is the game for you.

As an avid gamer and fan of the Grand Theft Auto series, I recently embarked on an adrenaline-fueled journey through the fictional streets of Los Santos in Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V). Rockstar Games has truly outdone themselves with this installment, creating an open-world masterpiece that leaves players hooked from the very start.  The first thing that struck me about GTA V is its stunning visuals and attention to detail. The game's graphics are simply breathtaking, and the vast and diverse landscapes of Los Santos, from the bustling urban sprawl to the serene countryside, are meticulously crafted. The level of immersion is unparalleled as the city feels alive, with pedestrians going about their daily routines, AI-controlled cars obeying traffic rules, and dynamic weather effects adding to the overall realism.  The heart of GTA V lies in its captivating storyline, which revolves around three unique protagonists: Michael, a retired bank robber seeking redemption; Franklin, a young and ambitious gangster aiming for a better life; and Trevor, a chaotic and unpredictable character with a dark past. The seamless switch between these characters throughout the game allows players to experience the story from various perspectives, making it all the more engrossing.  Rockstar Games has excelled in creating characters that feel genuine, flawed, and relatable. Their development over the course of the game is nothing short of remarkable, drawing players emotionally closer to the narrative. The writing is sharp, laced with dark humor and unexpected twists that keep players constantly on their toes.  What truly sets GTA V apart is the sheer freedom it offers within its open-world environment. Players can engage in a plethora of activities, from taking on thrilling heists and daring missions to participating in various side quests and recreational endeavors. The world is your playground, and whether you're racing cars, playing golf, base jumping, or indulging in a game of tennis, there's never a dull moment.  The game's online multiplayer mode, Grand Theft Auto Online, adds another layer of excitement to the already content-rich experience. With regular updates and a thriving community, the multiplayer aspect ensures that players will be entertained for countless hours beyond the main storyline.  However, it's worth noting that GTA V is intended for mature audiences due to its explicit content, violence, and language. While it contributes to the authenticity of the game's setting, parents should exercise caution and consider the game's rating before allowing younger players to delve into it.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V is an exceptional masterpiece in the gaming industry. With its breathtaking graphics, engaging narrative, and unparalleled freedom, it sets the benchmark for open-world gaming experiences. Despite being released several years ago, GTA V's enduring popularity speaks volumes about its lasting impact on the gaming community. If you're a fan of action-packed adventures and immersive storytelling, this game is an absolute must-play.

Whilst the game in itself is fun, and the griefers seem to have subsided, modders are still rampant, and can do serious damage. Also, way too much content is made available to you at the beginning, and it can be extremely overwhelming, especially since you aren't given an explanation. Another thing, the game takes an unreasonably long time to load, and it often ends up just stuck in a loop of loading, and when tabbing out whilst loading in, the game may just crash. Heist missions have a tendency to crash a lot as well, so forget about playing one of the main parts of the game.  Singleplayer is ok.  All in all, I'd say get it if it's ever in a better state, or get another game.

Title: An Unforgettable Adventure in Los Santos - GTA V Delivers!  Review: I can't recommend Grand Theft Auto V enough! The open world in this game is absolutely incredible, offering endless possibilities for exploration and excitement. Whether I'm cruising through the bustling streets of Los Santos or venturing into the picturesque countryside, the level of detail is simply astounding.  The missions in GTA V are nothing short of superb. Each one feels unique and brings its own set of challenges and thrills. From high-speed heists to heart-pounding shootouts, the gameplay keeps you on the edge of your seat throughout the entire journey.  And let's talk about the graphics - they are mind-blowing! The attention to detail in every aspect of the game, from the character models to the dynamic weather effects, truly elevates the gaming experience to a whole new level.  I've spent countless hours in Los Santos, and with each playthrough, I discover something new and exciting. The freedom to make choices, coupled with the rich narrative, keeps me coming back for more.  If you're a fan of open-world adventures and enjoy immersive gameplay, GTA V is an absolute must-play. Rockstar Games has truly outdone themselves with this masterpiece. So grab your virtual car keys and dive into the world of GTA V - you won't be disappointed!

Unraveling the Tapestry of Los Santos: Grand Theft Auto V  Score: 9.4/10  Rockstar Games' Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) is a technical marvel and narrative powerhouse that marks a high point in the storied history of open-world gaming. This landmark title adeptly weaves a dense tapestry of story, action, and exploration, resulting in a gaming experience that is as provocative as it is fun. With a staggering level of depth and breadth, GTA V earns an impressive 9.4 out of 10.  GTA V's primary narrative is an intricate saga of crime and ambition, set against the backdrop of the sprawling city of Los Santos and its surrounding areas. The plot is made richer by the three protagonists - Michael, Franklin, and Trevor, each with their own distinct personalities and storylines that intertwine brilliantly. The game's bold choice to allow players to switch between these characters at almost any point is innovative and provides a unique and engaging storytelling mechanism.  GTA V's open-world design is a testament to Rockstar's attention to detail and commitment to creating an immersive experience. Los Santos is a living, breathing city with diverse districts that accurately mirror the multicultural fabric of Southern California. From sun-kissed beaches and bustling downtown streets to arid desert expanses and towering mountain ranges, the world feels alive and is an absolute joy to explore.  The gameplay in GTA V offers a perfect balance between chaotic action and strategic planning. Whether you're engaging in high-octane car chases, meticulously planning and executing heists, or simply exploring the city in your downtime, the game constantly keeps you entertained. The cover-based shooting mechanics feel smooth, the driving is satisfyingly responsive, and the sheer variety of vehicles and weapons available adds to the game's replayability.  Graphically, GTA V is stunning. The level of detail, realistic physics, dynamic weather, and day-night cycle create an aesthetically pleasing and believable world. The voice acting is top-notch, and the radio stations with their various genres of music and entertaining talk-show segments significantly add to the game's atmosphere.  Additionally, the inclusion of GTA Online provides a robust and continually evolving multiplayer experience, where players can engage in a plethora of activities, from races and deathmatches to cooperative heists, further extending the game's lifespan.  Nevertheless, the game is not without its flaws. Some may find the game's portrayal of violence and its treatment of certain societal issues controversial. Also, although GTA Online is a rich addition, it occasionally suffers from server issues and an environment that may be unwelcoming to newcomers.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V stands as an exemplar in the realm of open-world games. Its engaging narrative, meticulously crafted world, diverse gameplay mechanics, and compelling multiplayer component make it a game that any player can appreciate. While not without its minor setbacks and potential controversy, the scale and quality of what it offers are undeniable, making GTA V a must-play title in the annals of gaming history.

GTA 5 stands unparalleled as the quintessential gaming masterpiece, epitomizing the pinnacle of interactive entertainment. The game's compelling characters, witty dialogue, and engrossing missions weave a cinematic tapestry that keeps players captivated from the first moment to the last. At this point they just need to move on to GTA 6 and let GTA 5 die already

Great campaign, great open world.  The online is also awesome as long as you're free roaming.  Once you try entering matchmaking, it becomes garbage. As you'd expect in a GTA game, the driving and car variety is very solid.
