It is no longer recommended for any player to play GTAOL to buy this game. Its life cycle is basically at the end, and the only thing left is lingering and more garbage content. We gave Rockstar a couple of year to improve this game, and his updated content is getting more and more worse. Here is why I don't recommend anyone to buy GTAOL anymore. · Extremely worst online environment If you go to a public session, that is, a session where a group of stranger players are together, there is a high probability that someone will cheat. Even if you hide, you will easily encounter cheats such as teleport all players to a cage to kill you. You will also be unable to press the game menu due to repeated killings. And if you want to play as in private, you can avoid it, but the premise is that you are not targeted by any cheats, otherwise the cheats will always join your session or mission, and then continue to send you to the cage to kill, or crash your game. Even if you never mess with any cheaters, you will encounter ballstorture random invitations (indiscriminate invitations that last for a year, and even forcefully pull players into new sessions) And what’s Rockstar do anything about this? They just simply disabled the function for players to invite public players from private sessions to play missions together. At the same time, players can no longer search for missions enabled in different sessions (it was possible before this update), so players have made so many sacrifices, presumably the problem of cheating has been well improved! As a result, at least million cheats that invite harassment and attack players indiscriminately across the server can be found on the internet everywhere, 1/4 of which is ballstorture! ! ! This is their attitude towards cheating! ! ! They don't even care about cheats that affect the overall situation, and the rest of the minor troublemakers are out of their control. · Extreme disgusting update content If the extremely disgusting environment can be avoided by relying on absolute isolation, then the remaining big problem that you absolutely cannot avoid is the update content that is getting more and more disgusting. If it is said that last summer’s ULP series mission update, there are at least some additional content to praise (hidden contacts, auto store classification options, yes, they dragged it out for almost 10 years), but this year there is almost nothing to praise! The Worst Jobs of Los Santos Drug Wars, It's perfunctory like taking out some small Job separately, and then telling us that this is a big update? Players who may have never played before don’t know what the concept of the usual major task update is. If you don’t consider the update of PVP content, the previous task update is generally Apartment heist, Doomsday heist (the coolest and most sci-fi), Diamond Casino heist, and large-scale heist missions such as Cayo Perico heist. Apartment heist is the number one benchmark in the 4-player cooperation series. It can sneak in or force a sudden attack, and there are many ways to play. And hallucinogens even scored chapters and chapters, and the next chapter was delayed for almost half a year, and even a difficult mode (that is, the chance of resurrection was reduced) had to be squeezed out for several months! Such efficiency is unprecedented and outrageous. Maybe it’s okay to play these trash mission, and you can play some other stuff in the game(such as race or sth), then the next content is definitely the most disgusting. · Extreme disgusting operation mode Grand Theft Auto, charges related to car theft, right? the focus is on stealing and cars, Auto! ! ! In their latest update, they deleted nearly 200 cars! And that number is still growing! What is the reason given by Rockstar? "Lesser-used vehicles will be removed from in-game websites to streamline the browsing experience", so, Rockstar must be very concerned about the player's browsing experience, right? Oh, in addition to deleting nearly 200 cars, it is just adding a few categories, and then? Is there a search by name? Are there more filter rules? After viewing a car's introduction, can I stay at the last browsed position when going back to the previous page instead of browsing from the beginning? nothing! A flying motorcycle of 2 million, they increased it to EIGHT MILLION after several price increases, which is equivalent to do The Cayo Perico Heist at least 5 times in a row, and each time it has to be a profit of 1.8 million (equivalent to a single person's exclusive bonus + door glitch + good luck to get the highest value goods enough to fill the backpack), you can afford this vehicle, if you are not so lucky, you have to do The Cayo Perico Heist more times! At the same time, I don’t know what happening with Rockstar. They often launch various garbage missions. Not only are the rewards not good, but the missions are also not good. For example, the last Halloween was limited to collect 200 jack-o’-lanterns for a week, with random effects such as explosions and electric shocks, or collect 100 props. This way of creating "out of print" is very disgusting. In order to add a little collection value to their perfunctory clothes, they engage in this kind of disgusting time-limited collection. Whoever does it will be disgusted. They forcefully reflect the difficulty of collecting this piece of clothing to add so-called value. However, I still can't wear it in the mission, which is amazing. There is also the mission editor. They have more and more restrictions on the mission editor. Recently, they even added an item blacklist, which made most of the interesting player-made maps unplayable,Although he was scolded back, no one can guarantee when he will delete it again. In addition, it also limits the player's earning speed. The most profitable Cayo Perico has added a 3-hour CD for single-player clearance and a 48-minute CD for multi-player clearance. Other large-scale jobs have also added a 48-minute CD (mandatory multiplayer). Before the player has fully played, some people may think that limiting the earning speed can allow the player to experience this growth process. However, when faced with a broken gun worth hundreds of thousands (more expensive than many real estates), most people will not dislike the short CD, but only complain about the abnormal inflation in Los Santos. After all, rockstar knows that it is too easy for players to make money and buy things, so they will not buy its GTA+ members and shark cards. · Endless glitches and crashes Various benign glitches in this game help players make more money in jobs. Vicious glitches such as decrease bullets cause players to lose hundreds of thousands of ammunition costs in vain every time, and even game crash and decrease revenue. Rockstar will only repair the former, and the latter is basically left to the community. Fun glitches get fixed, and annoying glitches pile up, never really getting fixed. Such a worse and disgusting online environment is the only one among so many open worlds, and it is getting more and more worse and disgusting! And you know what? I wouldn't be surprised if a lot of content is exclusive to GTA+ members a year from now, especially the 200+ cars that got deleted, because that's something that Rockstar would come up with!

Timeless and exceptional, GTA V continues to captivate players even a decade after its release. Its vast open world, engaging storylines, and endless opportunities for mayhem make it an undeniable classic. While we eagerly await the potential arrival of GTA VI, we recommend diving into the immersive world of Red Dead Redemption 2 (RDR2) to satiate your appetite for adventure. However, it's worth acknowledging that some players have expressed concerns about Rockstar's monetization practices, which may leave a bitter taste for some. Nevertheless, GTA V remains a must-play experience for any gaming enthusiast.

Even though I have substantially more hours than what's on my steam due to the fact I've played it most on ps3 and xbox one, I am sitting here writing my dead to right honest review of GTA 5. Although the overall gameplay experience will change as you go from story mode to online play, it is a solid experience. Graphics are smooth and stutter free and quite stunning if you're playing on the highest possible settings, it is quite enjoyable even if you have to settle with lower graphics. I myself am playing on the highest possible settings with my ASUS TUF gaming laptop, it has NVIDIA Geforce GTX 1650 graphics card and AMD Ryzen 5 4600H processor and 32 GB ram (aftermarket custom job as the laptop orginally only has 8GB, but upgrade was nessecary to play newer games without issues) so if you have a computer, either a tower or laptop with similar or higher specs - you are more than capable of playing GTA 5 and enjoying the experience as you go along. Story is detailed and rich in different ways you can take to reach the same goal, added bonus is that you have three characters to choose from and 3 different endings of story mode when you get that far. Loads of possibilities as in how you play the game and spend your time, if you either want to go full sandbox and stunt cars, planes, helicopters or a BMX bite along the mountain side - litteraly only thing stopping you is your own imagination same goes with online play - wanna go full rampage mode, or settle down with owning businesses and earning big bucks by owning a night club etc, the choice is yours. But, there is a big but here. Online play can be good and it can be just as bad, lots of toxic players and just the same amount of hackers and cheaters. However, there is a work around to play online mode and not being lobbied with tons of these by using the resource monitor methode (use google and watch how it is done) I myself am fond of that and have been enjoying online play even more ever since I found out about that. Theres a million different ways to play and if you like the game as much as I have, you will loose lots of hours on it. Bon voyage and enjoy.

Grand Theft Auto V is a masterpiece of open-world gaming, showcasing Rockstar Games' unparalleled ability to create immersive, exhilarating, and sometimes controversial experiences. Released years ago, it remains an enduring classic that has stood the test of time, captivating players with its dynamic storytelling, breathtaking visuals, and endless possibilities for chaotic fun.  The narrative of Grand Theft Auto V revolves around three distinct protagonists: Michael, a retired bank robber living a life of luxury; Franklin, a street-smart hustler eager for bigger opportunities; and Trevor, an unhinged, psychopathic criminal with a penchant for chaos. Their lives intertwine in a gripping tale of heists, betrayal, and self-discovery, drawing players deep into the dark underbelly of Los Santos.  From the moment you set foot in the sprawling city of Los Santos, it becomes apparent that Rockstar has spared no expense in crafting a visually stunning world. The attention to detail is unparalleled, with bustling streets, picturesque landscapes, and vibrant characters breathing life into every corner of the game. The level of realism is astonishing, making you feel like you're an active participant in a living, breathing metropolis.  One of the key highlights of Grand Theft Auto V is its immense open-world freedom. Players are presented with a vast playground where they can engage in an assortment of activities, ranging from adrenaline-pumping heists and high-speed police chases to more casual endeavors like golf, tennis, and stock market trading. The plethora of side missions and mini-games keeps players entertained for hours on end.  The humor and satire embedded in the game's dialogue and radio stations add a layer of wit and charm to the experience. Rockstar's ability to mock various aspects of modern society, politics, and popular culture in an entertaining way is commendable, albeit often controversial.  However, it's worth noting that Grand Theft Auto V is rated M for Mature for a reason. The game is not suitable for younger audiences due to its intense violence, explicit language, and adult themes. Parents should exercise caution and be mindful of the game's content.  Despite its brilliance, the game is not without some minor flaws. The occasional mission difficulty spikes and overly aggressive police AI can be frustrating, but they hardly detract from the overall enjoyment.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V remains a landmark in gaming history, setting a standard for open-world games that few have matched. Its engrossing narrative, impeccable graphics, and an abundance of activities make it an unforgettable experience. If you have the stomach for mature content and are eager to explore a virtual world like no other, Grand Theft Auto V is an absolute must-play.

The environments are pretty bland, especially the city. Things that deserve praise: the game is pretty easy, it runs smooth, the graphics are nice, and it's compatible with Windows 10. Overall it's missing a lot of charm that previous games in the series had, but it's a decent driving simulator. Update: There's lots of fun mods to improve the game! That makes it worth it!

GTA V is a game that I've known about since it launched but I haven't really been able to play it until around 3 years ago when I got it on console. After buying it for PC and playing through single player again this is what I have to say. The main storyline is fairly solid though a bit convoluted and has a lot going on which is kind of expected when there are 3 main protagonists. Although it's still fun, engaging, and worth your time in my opinion. The online mode on the other hand is a bit of a shitshow. For one, it's very grindy as the payouts for missions and business sales are very low compared to the vehicle and property prices. Another issue is modders who can either ruin your session or lead to a lot of silliness and fun times, and there's almost no inbetween. And with a recent update, Rockstar removed around 180 vehicles from the websites. For reference, the game had somewhere around 700 vehicles before the update. That aside, there are some fun things you can do like rob stores, play PvP, mess around with your friends or random people, etc. All said, this game still holds up pretty well nearly 10 years on and I think it's worth the money especially if you get in on sale.

Chilli con carne recipe  if you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding Chilli con carne recipe you've come to the right place,  Ingredients  1 large onion 1 red pepper 2 garlic cloves 1 tbsp oil 1 heaped tsp hot chilli powder (or 1 level tbsp if you only have mild)  1 tsp paprika 1 tsp ground cumin 500g lean minced beef 1 beef stock cube 400g can chopped tomatoes ½ tsp dried marjoram 1 tsp sugar (or add a thumbnail-sized piece of dark chocolate along with the beans instead, see tip)  2 tbsp tomato purée 410g can red kidney beans plain boiled long grain rice, to serve soured cream, to serve  Directions  STEP 1 Prepare your vegetables. Chop 1 large onion into small dice, about 5mm square. The easiest way to do this is to cut the onion in half from root to tip, peel it and slice each half into thick matchsticks lengthways, not quite cutting all the way to the root end so they are still held together. Slice across the matchsticks into neat dice.  STEP 2 Cut 1 red pepper in half lengthways, remove stalk and wash the seeds away, then chop. Peel and finely chop 2 garlic cloves.  STEP 3 Start cooking. Put your pan on the hob over a medium heat. Add 1 tbsp oil and leave it for 1-2 minutes until hot (a little longer for an electric hob).  STEP 4 Add the onion and cook, stirring fairly frequently, for about 5 minutes, or until the onion is soft, squidgy and slightly translucent.  STEP 5 Tip in the garlic, red pepper, 1 heaped tsp hot chilli powder or 1 level tbsp mild chilli powder, 1 tsp paprika and 1 tsp ground cumin.  STEP 6 Give it a good stir, then leave it to cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.  STEP 7 Brown 500g lean minced beef. Turn the heat up a bit, add the meat to the pan and break it up with your spoon or spatula. The mix should sizzle a bit when you add the mince.  STEP 8 Keep stirring and prodding for at least 5 minutes, until all the mince is in uniform, mince-sized lumps and there are no more pink bits. Make sure you keep the heat hot enough for the meat to fry and become brown, rather than just stew.  STEP 9 Make the sauce. Crumble 1 beef stock cube into 300ml hot water. Pour this into the pan with the mince mixture.   info. This great chilli recipe has to be one of the best dishes to serve to friends for a casual get-together. An easy sharing favourite that uses up storecupboard ingredients. it's also freezable

Grand Theft Auto V Online is an exceptional multiplayer experience that has captivated players around the world, myself included. Rockstar Games has created a vast and dynamic online world that offers endless thrills, boundless opportunities for exploration, and an unparalleled sense of camaraderie. It's no wonder that GTA 5 Online continues to be a beloved and enduring gaming community.  One of the greatest strengths of GTA 5 Online is its immersive open world. Los Santos comes alive in multiplayer, with players seamlessly interacting with each other in a bustling city teeming with activities and events. Whether you're racing through the streets, engaging in intense gunfights, or embarking on thrilling heists with friends, the sheer scale and attention to detail make the online experience truly immersive and unforgettable.  The level of customization available in GTA 5 Online is astonishing. From designing your own unique character to customizing vehicles, properties, and even businesses, the game offers a wealth of options to express your personal style and preferences. This freedom allows players to create their own narratives within the world, forging their own path as they rise through the criminal ranks or simply enjoy the vibrant virtual playground.  The multiplayer missions and heists are the pinnacle of cooperative gameplay. Joining forces with friends or fellow players to plan and execute elaborate heists is an exhilarating experience. Each mission presents its own challenges, requiring strategic coordination and teamwork to succeed. The satisfaction of pulling off a heist flawlessly and reaping the rewards together is unmatched.  GTA 5 Online goes beyond traditional multiplayer experiences with its diverse range of activities. From adrenaline-pumping races, competitive modes, and engaging team-based events to leisurely pursuits like golf, tennis, and even virtual nightclubs, there is something for everyone. The constant updates and additions from Rockstar Games ensure that the online world remains fresh and vibrant, keeping players engaged and eager to explore new content.  What truly sets GTA 5 Online apart is its incredible community. The game has fostered a strong and passionate player base, fostering friendships, alliances, and even rivalries. The shared experiences and interactions with other players create unforgettable moments that are discussed, celebrated, and cherished. Whether you're teaming up with friends or forming new alliances, the social aspect of GTA 5 Online adds a layer of depth and enjoyment that keeps players coming back for more.  Grand Theft Auto V Online is a testament to Rockstar Games' dedication to creating immersive and thrilling multiplayer experiences. With its expansive world, endless possibilities, and vibrant community, GTA 5 Online remains a must-play for any gamer seeking an unforgettable multiplayer adventure. Strap in, gather your crew, and prepare to embark on an exhilarating journey through the streets of Los Santos like no other.

Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) is an absolute triumph in the realm of open-world gaming. Rockstar Games has outdone themselves with this masterpiece, delivering a captivating and immersive experience that pushes the boundaries of what a video game can achieve.  From the moment you step foot into the sprawling metropolis of Los Santos, you're immediately struck by the stunning attention to detail and the sheer scale of the world. The city is a living, breathing entity, bustling with activity, diverse neighborhoods, and countless secrets to discover. The level of immersion is unparalleled, with the realistic visuals, dynamic weather systems, and an impressive day-night cycle that brings the city to life.  GTA V offers an unforgettable narrative experience, masterfully interweaving the lives of three distinct protagonists: Michael, Franklin, and Trevor. Each character has their own compelling story arc, motivations, and unique abilities. The writing is top-notch, filled with sharp dialogue, memorable moments, and unexpected twists that keep you engaged and invested in their journeys. The depth of character development is astounding, making you care deeply about their fates and forging a genuine emotional connection.  The gameplay mechanics of GTA V are a true highlight. The controls are smooth and responsive, allowing for seamless navigation through the city streets and intense action sequences. The game offers a staggering amount of activities and missions, ranging from high-octane heists and thrilling car chases to leisurely pastimes like golf, tennis, and even skydiving. The sheer variety ensures that there's always something exciting to do, catering to a wide range of player preferences.  One of the most impressive aspects of GTA V is its dynamic and living world. The AI-driven NPCs go about their daily routines, creating an authentic sense of immersion. From pedestrians interacting with one another to drivers obeying traffic laws (or not), the attention to detail is astonishing. The world reacts to your actions, whether it's causing chaos or engaging in criminal activities. It's a sandbox playground that allows for unparalleled freedom and exploration.  The multiplayer component of GTA V, Grand Theft Auto Online, is a massive and ever-evolving experience in its own right. It offers a vast open-world playground for players to interact, compete, and collaborate with each other. The continuous updates and additions from Rockstar Games ensure that the online experience remains fresh and engaging, with a wide range of activities, missions, and customization options to keep players coming back for more.  GTA V's soundtrack is nothing short of exceptional, featuring an eclectic mix of music across various genres that perfectly captures the essence of Los Santos. The radio stations offer a diverse selection of songs and entertaining talk shows that add to the immersive experience.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V is a groundbreaking achievement that pushes the boundaries of open-world gaming. Its stunning visuals, engrossing narrative, vast gameplay opportunities, and a living, breathing world make it a true masterpiece. Whether you're immersing yourself in the single-player story or embarking on adventures with friends in Grand Theft Auto Online, GTA V offers an unparalleled gaming experience that will keep you engaged, entertained, and coming back for more. Get ready to be swept away into the captivating world of Grand Theft Auto V.

Wow writing a Steam review for GTA V in 2023, somethings never change. Well I've been playing this since it came out and online didn't even exist. Lets talk post release shall we, Online has been a major success the story is just a faster way to load into the game now sorta. Lets talk about the goods, since release of online play there's been so much added from property and vehicles to the actual content and missions even just customizing your character and running business's like some sort of tycoon lots to come back for every so often. Unfortunately every good comes with a bad, from missions lagging out or your game just all out disconnecting and kicking you out to stare at steam library stage. I have even had missions all out not pay me after completing the objectives. This is especially annoying because everything in this game is so damn expensive and I cant for any reason understand why. For any new car you'll need to complete at least 2 heists to afford it and that's assuming everyone's either down to not get paid more or down to give you more money than the other 3 members. I'm of course talking about the 3 other people you're doing a heist with. Unfortunately hackers and modders are the real troopers keeping this game alive, almost every lobby you join will have at least one. Normally you just have to wait out 20 minutes of them murdering you and sweet talk them in public chat and they'll give ya a hand out or at least let you ride around in their modded vehicle wreaking havoc. Anyways having spent the past 2 weeks just really grinding out this game in slew of excitement for the GTA VI announcement trailer I find myself enjoying the game a lot.

GTA 5, also known as "Grand Theft Auto V," is not just a game; it's a wild rollercoaster ride through the world of crime and mayhem, with a dash of hilarity thrown in for good measure. If you've ever wanted to live out your wildest criminal fantasies without any real-life consequences, this game is your golden ticket. But beware, because chaos and comedy go hand in hand in Los Santos.  First off, let's talk about the characters. Michael, Trevor, and Franklin form a trio that's as dysfunctional as a broken joystick. Michael is the retired bank robber with family issues, Trevor is the psychopath with a twisted sense of humor, and Franklin is just trying to make a name for himself. Their interactions are like a never-ending episode of a crime-based sitcom, and their banter will have you laughing out loud between heists.  But it's not just the characters that bring the comedy gold. The open-world environment of Los Santos is an absolute playground for the mischievous. You can steal cars, run over pedestrians, cause massive explosions, and even go skydiving while dressed as a chicken. Yes, you read that right. The sheer absurdity of the side activities and random encounters is worth the price of admission alone.  And let's not forget about the radio stations. Whether you're cruising in a stolen sports car or evading the cops, the radio will never let you down. The satirical talk shows, ridiculous commercials, and catchy tunes make driving around the city an absolute joy. I've lost count of how many times I've found myself laughing hysterically at the witty commentary or dancing in my chair to some 80s power ballad while being chased by the police.  Of course, there's also the online mode, where you can team up with friends or complete strangers to cause even more chaos together. From crazy races where the laws of physics seem optional to heists that require a level of coordination that's equal parts hilarious and frustrating, it's a multiplayer experience unlike any other.  Now, it's important to mention that GTA 5 isn't just about the laughs. It also boasts a gripping story that delves into the dark underbelly of crime and greed. But let's be real, most of us are here for the wacky shenanigans and the joy of pushing the boundaries of what's possible within the game's virtual world.  In the end, GTA 5 is a game that doesn't take itself too seriously. It embraces the ridiculousness of its own existence and invites players to join in on the fun. If you're looking for a hilarious, action-packed adventure that will keep you entertained for hours on end, grab your controller, buckle up, and get ready for a ride that's as crazy as it is unforgettable. Just remember, it's all fun and games until you accidentally run over a cow and end up with a five-star wanted level. Good luck, and enjoy the mayhem!

Some of it was trying to make the game playable but most was trying to play the game only to have it crash on me.

Grand Theft Auto V, a game that has become a timeless classic, continues to captivate players with its enjoyable gameplay, multiplayer experience, and impressive graphics. As someone who has spent countless hours exploring the streets of Los Santos, I find myself drawn to the fun and immersive world that GTA V offers.  One of the standout aspects of GTA V is its multiplayer mode, Grand Theft Auto Online. The ability to join forces with friends and engage in various activities, from heists to races, adds an extra layer of excitement and camaraderie. The multiplayer component has undoubtedly contributed to the game's longevity and replayability.  Visually, GTA V impresses with its detailed and vibrant graphics. The sprawling city of Los Santos comes to life with its bustling streets, breathtaking landscapes, and meticulously designed environments. Rockstar Games' attention to detail is commendable, and it enhances the overall immersive experience of the game.  In terms of storytelling, GTA V initially stood out with its compelling narrative and memorable characters. The intertwining stories of Michael, Franklin, and Trevor offered a diverse perspective and added depth to the game. However, as time has passed, the storytelling has somewhat lost its impact, and it feels like the game could benefit from fresh ideas and a new installment.  Looking ahead, it's clear that the GTA franchise needs to evolve. While GTA V has undoubtedly been a monumental success, the anticipation for GTA 6 and the promise of new and exciting features is growing. Players are eager for Rockstar Games to introduce innovative gameplay mechanics, a captivating storyline, and even more immersive graphics in the next installment.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V remains an incredibly enjoyable game, particularly when played with friends and taking advantage of the vast multiplayer world. Its stunning graphics and initially compelling storytelling have left a lasting impression. However, as the franchise moves forward, the anticipation for GTA 6 and the hope for fresh experiences and advancements in the series continue to grow.

Main Game is worth the price , But multiplayer is not  Due to Decline in players making it impossible to earn cash unless you grind for months    Grand Theft Auto V Main Game:  Grand Theft Auto V, developed by Rockstar Games, is a masterfully crafted open-world action-adventure game that takes players on an unforgettable journey through the crime-ridden streets of Los Santos. Bursting with an immersive narrative, captivating characters, and a vast open world to explore, this game delivers an exceptional single-player experience that truly sets the bar high.  One of the standout features of Grand Theft Auto V is its engaging storyline. The game follows the lives of three distinct protagonists, each with their own quirks, motivations, and gripping story arcs. From the explosive heists to the personal struggles of the characters, the main game weaves a compelling narrative that keeps players hooked from start to finish. The attention to detail in both the dialogue and the environment is staggering, creating an incredibly realistic and immersive world.  The open-world setting of Los Santos is a remarkable feat of game design. From the bustling city streets to the vast countryside, the level of detail and variety is awe-inspiring. Whether you're exploring the urban sprawl or embarking on a scenic drive through the countryside, there's always something to discover or experience. The world feels alive, filled with countless activities, side missions, and secrets to uncover, making every playthrough a unique adventure.  The gameplay mechanics in Grand Theft Auto V are polished and satisfying. Whether you're engaging in intense gunfights, driving high-speed vehicles, or executing meticulously planned heists, the controls feel tight and responsive. The wide range of weapons, vehicles, and customization options further enhance the gameplay, allowing players to tailor their experience to their preferences.  Grand Theft Auto V Multiplayer:  While the main game of Grand Theft Auto V shines brightly, the multiplayer component, Grand Theft Auto Online, presents a more mixed experience. While it initially burst onto the scene with immense popularity, it's worth noting that the player count has been dwindling over time.  The multiplayer aspect of Grand Theft Auto V offers a sprawling open world that allows players to engage in various activities with others. From completing missions and heists together to participating in adrenaline-fueled races and competitive challenges, there is no shortage of content to enjoy. The ability to create and customize your own character also adds a personal touch to the experience.  However, the declining player count is an issue that can affect the overall enjoyment of the multiplayer aspect. Finding a full lobby or enough players to engage in certain activities can become increasingly challenging, especially as time goes on. This can result in occasional lulls in the gameplay experience and may limit the opportunities for dynamic interactions with other players.  In addition to the concerns about the dwindling player count in Grand Theft Auto Online, it's important to note that the multiplayer experience also faces criticism for its economy. The in-game currency, GTA$, is notoriously difficult to earn, particularly due to the declining player base. This can lead to frustrating and time-consuming grinding for players who wish to accumulate wealth and purchase desirable items within the game.  To mitigate this issue, Rockstar Games introduced microtransactions that allow players to purchase Shark Cards with real-world money, providing an influx of GTA$ to expedite progress. While this option can be appealing for those looking to bypass the lengthy grind, it has sparked debates about the game's reliance on real-world cash transfers to attain in-game wealth.  The heavy emphasis on microtransactions and the scarcity of in-game currency opportunities can create an imbalance between players who choose to invest real money and those who do not. This monetization strategy has garnered mixed reactions from the player community, with some feeling that it hampers the overall experience and favors players with deeper pockets.  It's important to mention that Grand Theft Auto Online does offer various ways to earn GTA$ through in-game activities, such as heists, missions, and races. However, the challenge of accumulating wealth can be a deterrent for players who seek a more balanced and accessible progression system.  While the multiplayer aspect's reliance on microtransactions and the difficulty in earning in-game currency can be a downside, it's worth noting that the core gameplay mechanics and activities within Grand Theft Auto Online still provide entertainment and opportunities for collaboration with other players.  Overall, the multiplayer component of Grand Theft Auto V, while facing issues of dwindling player count and a challenging economy, still offers engaging gameplay and a platform for cooperative experiences. However, the game would greatly benefit from finding a better balance between real-world cash transfers and in-game progression, ensuring a fair and enjoyable experience for all players, regardless of their financial investments.  Despite this issue, Grand Theft Auto Online still offers a wealth of content for those who can find active lobbies or play with friends. Additionally, Rockstar Games has been known to release regular updates and new content, keeping the multiplayer experience fresh and exciting.

Circle inside circle inside circle inside circle inside circle inside circle inside circle inside circle inside circle inside circle…  Three overhead signal sources, three characters where one is able to eclipse another, three mountains, three aligned beacons (fourth is inactive) and only two light sources that intersect one another. Only one time at a bird’s eye angle would one see a flipped side of a triangle. It’s all about taking a look.  Flipped everything would move differently as the days go by, at the second day, at the same time, it would be further than before. Two light sources are both aligned directly from whatever place you draw a line, as in order for one to move, both have to move together. When the dark light falls, the shape that ends at the right destination, this is when the signal is set to active. The signal would be circulating and vibrating differently as you enter a sound zone. Grand Theft Auto V (GTA 5) is a game that's like attending a wedding where everyone's drunk, there's a llama in the punch bowl, and the bride just stole a helicopter. And somehow, that's what makes it absolutely glorious.  In the wide, sun-drenched, bullet-riddled world of Los Santos, you'll experience life as a retired criminal trying to enjoy his golden years. Too bad these golden years involve more high-speed chases, explosions, and questionable life choices than an action movie marathon.  At its core, GTA 5 is about freedom. The freedom to drive like a maniac, to spend your hard-earned (or stolen) cash on military-grade firepower, to run a multi-million dollar criminal enterprise. And let's not forget the freedom to parachute from a plane in a chicken suit, because why not?  Playing as Michael feels like starring in your own reality TV show where you're constantly one step away from a mental breakdown. As Franklin, you're hustling and grinding your way to the top, all while dealing with the most comically dysfunctional friends imaginable. And then there's Trevor... sweet, psychotic Trevor. Spending a day in his shoes is akin to attending a non-stop adrenaline-fueled party at a madhouse.  Despite its age, GTA 5 is still a riotous romp that refuses to age gracefully. It's the party animal who's still chugging shots while everyone else has long since passed out. The graphics still hold up, the soundtrack is eclectic, and the city of Los Santos is as lively and unpredictable as ever.  Is it perfect? Nope. You'll probably end up hammering your keyboard at least once when you fail a mission because you accidentally ran over a pedestrian, got a wanted level, and then were promptly obliterated by the police. But that's all part of the chaotic charm.  n conclusion, if you've ever wanted to experience the thrill of a high-speed police chase from the comfort of your own home, GTA 5 is the game for you. Just remember: in Los Santos, the only rules are the ones you break. Now, if you'll excuse me, I need to head back into the game. My pet mountain lion, Mr. Fluffy, gets antsy if I leave him in the car too long. And trust me, you haven't seen chaos until you've seen a bored mountain lion in a virtual city.

Modders can mess with you in many ways - force you out of your apartment, bunker, nightclub etc to take out everyone in the session. Overall, I love GTA Online and I've had a lot of fun with it, but the hacker issue is slowly but surely ruining the experience.

Grand Theft Auto V is an extraordinary video game that has truly pushed the boundaries of open-world gaming, delivering an unparalleled experience of crime, chaos, and adventure. Developed by Rockstar Games, this masterpiece has captivated millions of players worldwide, including myself, with its stunning visuals, immersive gameplay, and an intricately woven storyline.  From the moment you step foot into the sprawling metropolis of Los Santos, you are instantly transported into a living, breathing world that feels incredibly authentic. The attention to detail is unparalleled, with meticulously designed landscapes, bustling city streets, and a diverse cast of characters that make the game's universe feel vibrant and alive.  One of the standout features of Grand Theft Auto V is its three playable protagonists: Michael, a retired bank robber seeking redemption, Franklin, a street-smart hustler looking for a way out of his dead-end life, and Trevor, a volatile psychopath with a penchant for chaos. Each character brings a unique perspective to the game, and their intertwined narratives create a compelling and engaging storyline that keeps you hooked from start to finish.  The gameplay mechanics in GTA V are exceptional, offering a seamless blend of driving, shooting, and exploration. Whether you're engaging in high-speed pursuits, engaging in thrilling heists, or simply wandering the streets causing mayhem, the controls are intuitive and responsive, providing a satisfying sense of control. The ability to switch between characters at any time adds a layer of depth and strategic planning, allowing you to approach missions from different angles.  One cannot discuss Grand Theft Auto V without mentioning its online multiplayer mode, Grand Theft Auto Online. It is a living, ever-evolving world where players can create their own criminal empire, team up with friends, participate in thrilling missions, and compete in a wide range of activities. The sheer scope of content and the constant updates and additions by Rockstar Games ensure that there is always something new to explore and experience.  Furthermore, the game's soundtrack deserves special praise. From the catchy radio tunes to the atmospheric ambient scores, the music in GTA V perfectly complements the gameplay and helps create an immersive experience.  In terms of graphics, Grand Theft Auto V is a visual marvel. The attention to detail is astonishing, with stunning landscapes, realistic character models, and breathtaking weather effects. The game's ability to maintain a high level of visual fidelity while delivering a vast open world is a testament to the technical prowess of the developers.  Grand Theft Auto V is not without its controversies, as its mature themes and depiction of violence may not be suitable for all players. However, it remains a landmark achievement in the world of gaming, pushing boundaries, and setting new standards for open-world experiences.

Rating: 5/5 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟  Holy guacamole, folks! GTA 5 is an absolute blast and a crime wave of epic proportions. I've never had so much fun breaking the law without facing the consequences... in a video game, of course!  From the moment I fired up the game, I was thrown into a massive sandbox of mischief, complete with a gazillion opportunities to wreak havoc on the unsuspecting citizens of Los Santos. Seriously, it's like the city has an unlimited supply of stolen vehicles, and I'm the Robin Hood of joyriding!  The storyline is wilder than a rodeo on caffeine. I found myself rooting for the three protagonists, Michael, Trevor, and Franklin, even though they're as nutty as a fruitcake. The banter between them had me laughing harder than a hyena on laughing gas. These guys know how to deliver some seriously hilarious dialogue while blowing stuff up!  Speaking of blowing stuff up, the sheer amount of chaos you can unleash in this game is mind-blowing. Need a break from stealing cars? How about skydiving off Mount Chiliad and crashing into a swimming pool? Or maybe you're in the mood to rampage through the city with a rocket launcher, turning everything into a fiery mess? The possibilities are as endless as my cackling laughter while causing mayhem!  And let's not forget about GTA Online, where the real party is at. It's like a never-ending carnival of insanity, with players from all over the world teaming up to pull off heists, race cars, or simply engage in a friendly brawl on the streets. Trust me, the chaos multiplier increases exponentially when you add other players into the mix. It's like a symphony of virtual pandemonium!  Visually, GTA 5 is a stunner. The graphics are so jaw-droppingly gorgeous that I found myself stopping mid-crime spree just to admire the sunsets, the stunning cityscapes, and the mesmerizing details. It's like stepping into a virtual postcard... if that postcard also happened to include explosions and a guy in a chicken suit robbing a convenience store.  All in all, GTA 5 is an absolute gem of a game. It's like a never-ending comedy show with explosions, car chases, and a whole lot of laughs. If you're in the mood for some hilarious, over-the-top action, buckle up and dive into the chaos. Just remember, it's all in good fun, folks. Leave the real-life crime to the fictional pixels!  Disclaimer: No virtual citizens were harmed during my gameplay sessions. Well, maybe a few hundred, but who's counting? It's all part of the fun, right?

After you beat story mode there is barely anything to do because Rockstar made it so tons of businesses, missions and vehicles are only in online. The only way to get these in story mode is installing mods. Even mods have their problems though. They are a lot harder to install then regular mods because GTA 5 doesn't have a steam workshop, SO EVERY TIME YOU ADD A MOD IT CORRUPTS THE ENTIRE GAME, but then it also starts CRASHING!!!! Regular GTA 5 crashed once every hour for me. I got some mods and then it starts crashing ONCE EVERY 5 MINUTES. It is basically unplayable considering it takes 10 MINUTES TO LOAD BACK IN. The only way I could fix the crashing is to UPGRADE MY RAM TO 32 GIGS TO MAKE A GAME PLAYABLE. This game is garbage and you have two options to play the game after you beat the mediocre story, play online and grind for hours only to get blown up by opressor mark twos, or spend hours manually installing mods only to have the game corrupt and for your hours of hard work to be deleted. I absolutely fucking hate this game, it's shitty online and the lack of a steam workshop.  Update : It got even worse, now I can't even play story mode. I tried it without  mods and with mods and both of them gave me this activation error. I've reinstalled the game multiple times but nothing works, spending hard earned money for a game that doesn't work is crazy.

I can't even count how many times I've purchased this game or on how many consoles I have played it on at this point. GTA V is one of my favorite game stories of all time and online still continues to impress me with new innovations and additions still presently being introduced with fun, well imagined stories and adventures. Nothing compares to the jelly-like driving in this game. GTA V Online is not for the faint of heart and has become a much more expansive place then when I began playing online shortly after game release. There has always been an issue with "modders/hackers/trolls" online and despite some friendly players every now and then, the amount of trolling and disrespectful gamers can make the game... well lets not throw a controller. Like I said, this game is not for the faint of heart but if you can hang you are going to have a great trip. I look forward to GTA VI.

I am an old player. I have an account where I grinded countless hours. Not only does my account not transfer, but I was banned on my new account after only one month of playing this game. I got 221 hours in this game total.  I was banned because I got tired of the countless times I was killed, often by players with a mod menu. I downloaded a mod menu, not to hurt people, but to protect myself. People were booting me from sessions, locking me in boxes, shooting fireworks out of their you know what, among many other things. I spent a hundred dollars on this game and instead of getting a warning or anything like that, I was straight suspended for 2 months. I played this game before and I even put money into it, even though my friends said it was a waste. You guys have a cash cow, a money pit, and you have a fraudulent way to run your servers. I get not wanting modders and stuff but I didn't hurt anyone. I get taking the stuff away and a ban for a day or two, but no, no warning no nothing. Like I said, I put $100 into this game, and now I can't even get online. Not that I want to join the toxic free roam where players have all the cool shit, and I can't access my account on PC. My account is on Xbox, but I'm switching to PC. Does Rockstar understand? No. Do they care? No. I'll tell you what. I'm never playing your stupid game again, and I won't be buying GTA6 if you ever come out with that, and I'm going to let everyone I know to never play it or get the new one either. I hope your corrupt company goes out of business, and I'll be sure to report your business for your fraudulent play. You guys do this all the time. I've seen it on Xbox and it's no way to run a business. You can't control the hackers, so you make everyone scared and then unsuspecting players like me are stuck after spending our hard earned money with a ban for protecting ourselves from the hackers you can't control. Your company is a joke and I hope people wake up to the garbage this game is. Don't think you're going to get away with my hundred bucks either.

Grand Theft Auto V: A Thrilling and Unforgettable Gaming Experience  Introduction: Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) has undoubtedly solidified its place as one of the most iconic and beloved video games of all time. Developed by Rockstar Games, this open-world action-adventure masterpiece takes players on a thrilling journey through the sprawling city of Los Santos. With its immersive gameplay, captivating storyline, and vast array of activities, GTA V offers an incredible gaming experience that is bound to leave players enthralled.  Expansive Open World: One of the standout features of GTA V is its meticulously crafted open world. Los Santos is a bustling and vibrant city, filled with diverse environments, from bustling city streets to serene countryside and picturesque beaches. The level of detail is astonishing, immersing players in a living, breathing world where every nook and cranny holds secrets, surprises, and countless opportunities for exploration.  Engaging Storyline and Memorable Characters: The game's narrative is a tour de force, weaving together the lives of three compelling protagonists: Michael, Franklin, and Trevor. Each character brings a unique perspective and personality to the table, resulting in a rich and engaging story that keeps players invested from start to finish. The writing is top-notch, filled with memorable moments, unexpected twists, and a perfect blend of drama and dark humor.  Unparalleled Gameplay Freedom: GTA V offers unparalleled freedom when it comes to gameplay. Whether you're following the main storyline, engaging in side missions, or simply wreaking havoc across the city, the game provides an incredible level of choice and agency. Want to participate in high-speed car chases, engage in thrilling heists, or just indulge in some leisurely activities like golf or tennis? GTA V has it all, allowing players to shape their own unique experiences within the vast sandbox.  Thrilling Multiplayer Experience: Beyond the single-player campaign, GTA V introduces Grand Theft Auto Online, an expansive multiplayer component that offers endless hours of entertainment. Joining forces with friends or meeting new players, you can engage in cooperative missions, intense competitive races, or simply explore the vast online world together. The constant updates and additions from Rockstar ensure that there's always something new and exciting to discover, making for an ever-evolving multiplayer experience.  Immersive Graphics and Soundtrack: GTA V's graphics are nothing short of stunning, with attention to detail that brings the world to life. From the bustling streets filled with pedestrians and vehicles to the dynamic weather and breathtaking sunsets, the visual fidelity is exceptional. The game is also complemented by an incredible soundtrack, featuring a diverse range of music across multiple genres, perfectly setting the tone for each moment and enhancing the overall immersion.  Conclusion: Grand Theft Auto V is an extraordinary gaming experience that lives up to its reputation as a modern masterpiece. Its expansive open world, engaging storyline, and unparalleled freedom of gameplay combine to create an unforgettable adventure. Whether you're a fan of action, exploration, or immersive storytelling, GTA V delivers on all fronts. Prepare to be captivated by its vastness, entertained by its gameplay, and immersed in its world. Grand Theft Auto V is an absolute must-play for any gaming enthusiast seeking a thrilling and fun-filled experience.

Rating: ★★★★☆ (4/5)  Oh boy, where do I even begin with Grand Theft Auto (GTA)? This game is like a rollercoaster ride on steroids with a side of extra cheese! If you're looking for a gaming experience that is absolutely bonkers, then strap in and get ready for a wild and wacky adventure.  First things first, the open-world in GTA is mind-blowing. You've got an entire city at your fingertips, just waiting to be explored and wreak havoc upon. Whether you want to take a leisurely drive through the streets, jump off a skyscraper, or cause chaos with rocket launchers and tanks, the possibilities are endless. And hey, if you ever get tired of the main storyline, you can always hop on a bicycle and chase down some unsuspecting pedestrians for a good laugh.  Let's talk about the characters, shall we? Rockstar Games has a knack for creating some of the most memorable and downright outrageous characters in gaming history. From the eccentric Trevor with his unpredictable behavior to the suave and smooth-talking Michael, you'll find yourself laughing at their antics and wondering how on earth they manage to stay alive with all the shenanigans they get into.  One of the best things about GTA is the humor. The game doesn't take itself too seriously, and that's what makes it so entertaining. You'll encounter radio stations with hilarious talk shows, outrageous commercials, and even the occasional celebrity cameo. The satire and social commentary sprinkled throughout the game will have you chuckling and shaking your head in equal measure.  Now, let's address the elephant in the room: the mayhem. GTA is all about embracing your inner chaos agent. You can steal cars, rob banks, cause massive explosions, and go on rampages that would make Godzilla proud. Just remember, it's all in the name of good, silly fun. I mean, where else can you fly a helicopter while dressed as a chicken, shooting rockets at your enemies? Only in GTA, my friend.  In terms of technical aspects, GTA on Steam runs like a well-oiled machine. The graphics are top-notch, the controls are smooth, and the attention to detail is impressive. The developers have put in a lot of effort to create a living, breathing world that feels alive and vibrant.  However, I have to deduct one star because, let's face it, GTA isn't exactly known for its realism. Sometimes the missions can get a bit repetitive, and the AI can be a little wonky. But hey, who needs realism when you can hijack a fighter jet and do loop-de-loops in the sky?  All in all, if you're looking for a game that will make you laugh, gasp, and question your sanity, then Grand Theft Auto on Steam is the perfect choice. It's a wild and wacky adventure that will keep you entertained for hours on end. Just be prepared to embrace the madness and leave your serious pants at the door. Enjoy the chaos, my fellow gamers!

If you want to get this to play the single player mode, it's worth it. If you want to play online, DO NOT PURCHASE. Lobbies are FULL of hackers. Instead of fixing this issue, rockstar decided to enable people to play GTA ONLINE ALONE IN AN INVITE ONLY SESSION. You are forced to play this online multiplayer game alone, in a private lobby, unless you want to constantly get griefed by people flying through the air in vehicles that will blow you up in one shot. This game used to be fun, but now every aspect of the game has been finely tuned by rockstar to entice you into spending real money on shark cards. They removed content from pc players and then put it behind a pay wall THAT WE DONT EVEN HAVE ACCESS TO. PC is not anywhere near the front of their minds as they get ready to put out GTA 6. its been a year and a half since they added awesome new cars that go 30-60 mph faster than any car on pc, and yet we still arent allowed to use any of them. we all hoped that after a year, they would release it to the pc crowd, but instead of giving us these faster cars, THEY TOOK NEARLY 200 CARS AWAY FROM US. all new content is just reused assets from single player missions, they constantly reduce the earning potential from businesses, unless one is part of a double money event, and even then, those businesses are not as good at making you money as the cayo perico heist, which they put a massive cooldown on. overall, it can be a fun game and i loved it. really loved it. but the blatant lack of care for the pc community is downright infuriating week after week, month after month of being forgotten. not worth it on PC.  unless you're going to hack/mod in the online. in which case, congratulations, you are now part of the problem. the only way to have fun on this game is to either try to have fun grinding boring repetitive missions over and over again just to purchase an overpriced, underperforming car. any car that was reasonably priced for its performance was REMOVED FROM THE DAMN GAME.  pathetic support for an extremely large community. again, i used to love this game but it feels like having a girlfriend who goes out every weekend and cheats on you and then comes home expecting you to take her out on a date. dont let rockstar c*ck you. if you want to play it that badly just wait for gta 6 or be prepared to be bitterly disappointed after a few hours, once you realize how long itll take to get something that doesn't really enhance the gameplay experience. Or just do what rockstar really wants you to do. not enjoy the game. but spend more money on it in the hopes that you might actually eventually enjoy it.

A Game that I would happily purchase on every platform available and spend time with my friends to always kill some time.  It has always received constant updates with regards to graphics, game modes, vehicles, events, missions, customisation, apartments, activities and more.  I will briefly say that the main story line is an experience one must play more than once, it is unforgettable and action-packed with a lot of exciting moments and many interesting ways to play around the world and how it'll be affected.  But the main focus is the multi-player, it is without a doubt a true experience that MUST be enjoyed with friends as it brings about the true possibilities this game can provide which consist of Heists, Death matches, Races, Casinos, Water Activities, Illegal Business, Hitmen and more.  There will always be a memorable moment for everyone, from struggling to perfect a Heist without any deaths, to the joys of travelling in Custom Sport Cars whilst listening to the Radio which constantly get updated and play a mix of classic songs and modern rap whenever you choose.  9/10 - I wish I have a chance to experience the game for the first time again.

[h1]GTA V (STEAM EDITION)[/h1]  This review is from someone who's never played GTA before so just so you know. Ngl the gameplay is great and the whole way the game and story is structured is really good. Story is great and in general a great game. Cars are rip-offs from real ones (Karin Calico = Toyota Celica (1990s) etc) but they're still epic. You can do a lot in terms of customisation of cars in both Story Mode and Online. One main problem for me is the hackers on GTA online. A while back I crashed into another car in online by accident and this guy comes out throwing whatever at me, before I know it I'm GTA online level 106 and have found all collectables or whatever they're called. Also the 106GB storage needed is a bit big for a lot of people, pretty sure it's mainly for the map for non-online play, not sure but it is big.  Anyway overall it's a great game would recommend because it's like nothing else really out there. Grand Theft Auto 5 delivers an exhilarating experience with its enjoyable costume customization and a wide variety of cars to choose from, allowing players to fully immerse themselves in their chosen roles and missions. The game's interactive multiplayer aspect adds an extra layer of excitement and engagement. While the graphics are visually appealing, especially with an upgraded VGA, the passage of time has made it evident that newer titles like Red Dead Online have surpassed GTA 5 in terms of visual presentation. Nonetheless, the game's captivating storyline, a trademark of Rockstar, leaves a lasting impact, particularly the memorable decision of choosing which character receives the final shot after spending the entire game with two companions. Overall, Grand Theft Auto 5 stands as an excellent game, but fans eagerly await the arrival of a new installment in the series, perhaps in the form of GTA 6.

I have recently had the pleasure of diving into the world of Grand Theft Auto 5 (GTA 5) and its online counterpart, and I must say it has been an absolutely fantastic experience. Rockstar Games has truly created a masterpiece that captivates players with its immersive gameplay, stunning visuals, and an expansive open world that offers endless opportunities for excitement and exploration.  One of the standout features of GTA 5 is its compelling storyline. The game introduces us to three unique protagonists, each with their own compelling backstories and personalities. The writing and voice acting are top-notch, drawing players into a gritty and often humorous narrative filled with unexpected twists and turns. The character development is superb, making it easy to form a strong connection with these virtual personas.  The open world of Los Santos is an absolute marvel. The attention to detail is astounding, from the bustling streets to the towering skyscrapers and lush countryside. Whether I'm cruising through the city in a flashy sports car or embarking on an adrenaline-pumping heist, the level of immersion is unparalleled. The world feels alive, with pedestrians going about their daily lives, emergency services responding to incidents, and a wide array of activities to engage in, such as tennis, golf, and even skydiving.  GTA Online takes the already outstanding single-player experience and expands it into a multiplayer realm. It provides a vast and dynamic playground for players to team up or compete against each other in a variety of game modes and activities. Whether I'm participating in adrenaline-fueled races, engaging in intense heists with friends, or simply exploring the open world together, the multiplayer aspect adds a whole new dimension of fun and excitement.  Rockstar Games has done an excellent job of supporting GTA Online with regular updates and new content, ensuring that the experience remains fresh and engaging. They consistently introduce new missions, vehicles, and game modes, keeping players hooked and invested in the online world. The ability to customize and personalize my character and own luxury properties provides a sense of progression and achievement, further enhancing the long-term appeal of the game.  Furthermore, the community surrounding GTA 5 and Online is incredibly vibrant and diverse. Interacting with other players from around the world adds an unpredictable and dynamic element to the gameplay. Whether it's teaming up for cooperative missions or engaging in heated battles in the competitive modes, the multiplayer aspect fosters a sense of camaraderie and friendly competition.  In conclusion, GTA 5 and its online counterpart provide an unparalleled gaming experience. The captivating storyline, immersive open world, and the dynamic multiplayer component make it a true masterpiece. Rockstar Games has created a virtual world that offers endless hours of entertainment, and their commitment to ongoing updates and content ensures that players are continually engaged. If you're looking for a game that combines thrilling action, immersive storytelling, and limitless possibilities, GTA 5 and GTA Online are an absolute must-play.

The driving in the game is therapeutic.  One of the best things about GTA V Online is the variety of cars and vehicles you can drive, especially the ones that can fly. Yes, you heard me right, there are some cars and bikes that can take off and soar through the air like a bird or a plane. Imagine the fun you can have with your friends, cruising around the city, dodging bullets and missiles, and laughing at the poor souls stuck on the ground. Here are some of the coolest flying vehicles you can get in GTA V Online:  Imponte Deluxo: This is a classic sports car that looks like it came straight out of a sci-fi movie. It has gull-wing doors, a sleek design, and a hidden feature: it can fly. At the click of a button, you can switch between car mode and hover/fly mode, and glide over any obstacle in your way. You can also equip it with weapons such as a machine gun and homing missiles, making it a deadly aerial threat. The Deluxo can be purchased from Warstock Cache & Carry for $5,750,0001. Pegassi Oppressor: This is a motorcycle that has wings and a rocket boost. It can jump and glide for a limited amount of time, or use the boost to fly faster and higher. It can also be fitted with weapons such as a machine gun and homing missiles, making it a versatile vehicle for both land and air combat. The Oppressor can be purchased from Warstock Cache & Carry for $2,750,0001. Pegassi Oppressor Mk II: This is an upgraded version of the Oppressor, that replaces the wheels with the ability to hover and fly. It’s faster, more agile, and more stable than its predecessor, and can also be fitted with weapons such as homing missiles and countermeasures. The Oppressor Mk II can be purchased from Warstock Cache & Carry for $8,000,0001. Mammoth Thruster (Jetpack): This is a jetpack that lets you fly like a superhero. It has two thrusters on the sides that propel you forward and upward, and two smaller ones on the back that help you steer. It can also be fitted with weapons such as homing missiles, making it a fun and powerful gadget to use. The Thruster (Jetpack) can be purchased from Warstock Cache & Carry for $2,500,0001.  These are just some of the flying vehicles you can get in GTA V Online. There are also planes, helicopters, blimps, and more that you can use to explore the sky. You can also do various activities with your friends in GTA V Online, such as races, deathmatches, heists, missions, freemode events, business battles, drug wars2, and more. GTA V Online is a game that never gets boring, because there’s always something new and exciting to do with your friends.

Steam says I have 352 hours on GTAV/GTAO. Considering I ported my character over from Xbox 360, it should be at least double that.   So lets say 112 hours.  I have spent aproximately 112 hours playing this video game.  Yet I cannot recommend it.  Yes I have had some of the best gaming I've ever had with this game. I thoroughly enjoyed the single player campaign, I played online mostly and had a a character legitimately over level 100 and with a nice sum of money set aside. I even supported the game further with the very occasional shark card. I was there for the DNS glitch that caused 9 billion dollar bounties to occur, and I was there when they cut literally everyone's funds to 500,000 as a "fix"  But one day I was playing and some guy joins the server, forcibly teleports myself and a handful of others to him, freezes us, and makes bags of money rain from the sky.  Don't get me wrong, I'm not stupid, I know people hack and people give out money. I've seen countless people ask for them and praise them etc. I've generally ignored them, but this guy didn't give me much of a choice.  Regardless once I figured out what was happening I left the server. I didn't want the money in my bank so I blew it customizing street cars and blowing them up.  A couple hours later I was temporarily banned and my character was reset. I lost all of my cars, including old ones with rare paint jobs that could only be obtained by an exploit that had been patched, not to mention the majority of that 112 hours I'd put into having a character I liked.  Rockstar punished me for something that was thrust upon me. My ingame wallet was raped and they decided to blame the victim.  There was no way for me to voice my displeasure to Rockstar. No appeals process for them to hear my case, check the evidence, and see my innocence.  That was several months ago. I uninstalled the game and let it go.  I'm only writing this now so that others can see what they're getting into.  Yes, as I've said, this game is incredibly fun and contains hours upon hours of content. From an objective standpoint, its very good value for money and the free, regular, DLC is a nice touch.  What ruins all of that is the way Rockstar treats its customers. There's no consistency, and no compassion. I know people in real life that have been taking free money for ages and they've never had any trouble. Yet it happens to me once, without my consent, and I get temp banned and lose literally everything.  What motivation is there to play legitimately then? If people who do can lose everything in an instant with no way to appeal the decision, and those who don't can get away with it indefinitely.  Hell you actually get a bonus for playing illegitimately because those people can just make new accounts and hack their way back to wealth and experience.  Rockstar, if you actually end up reading this, please start treating your customers with some compassion. Don't assume we're all hackers.

Grand Theft Auto V is one of the best thrilling open-world action-adventure game that I've played till date. It combines a gripping narrative with immersive gameplay. Set in the fictional city of Los Santos, it follows three protagonists—Michael, Franklin, and Trevor—each with a unique story. The game excels in its realistic graphics, diverse missions, and an expansive open-world environment. With engaging heists, dynamic characters, and a plethora of activities, GTA V offers an unparalleled gaming experience. Whether cruising through the city, participating in high-stakes robberies, or exploring the vast landscape, the game captivates players with its depth and attention to detail. A modern classic that continues to captivate audiences till date despite being released such a long time ago.

The campaign is fantastic and immersive, so go play it if you haven't. However,  There are too many modders in GTA Online, I encounter at least one each session. They have the powers to completely break your online experience. If you do anything to annoy them perhaps accidentally, they have the power to remove you from the session. For a company like Rockstar, this is unacceptable.

I did not enjoy Grand Theft Auto V.  Played for 45 hours, reached 25% completion. For me, this was simply hard work.  The graphics quality is amazing if compared with GTA San-Andreas. The depth of all the crazy characters and the scope of the map is epic. (Seems good so far?!?)  But the game-play in each "mission" is mundane silly shooting or driving or pointing things at other things. And the complexity of the controls ... (I am using an Xbox360 controller with the game running on a Windows PC) ... are completely confusing, overwhelming, and the functions of buttons and sticks keeps changing in bizarre ways when you move from being on foot to driving to flying, and all sorts of other special activities.  In summary, I don't think this is really a "game". It is more like watching a mashup of Adventure Films, TV soap operas, Soft Porn, Reality TV programs, and Art movies - but, instead of simply watching the films, the"player" is constantly being told to press some buttons and tilt some joystics in a rather moronic fashion.  I found it very difficult to find the right buttons or joysticks or D-pad controls in each situation, and to read the instructions popping up on screen and then vanishing, and to control the gun / camera / car / etc with the required accuracy and speed, And all for what purpose? Just so the plot of the GTA V "film" (that is called "Story Mode" in GTA V) can proceed. No thank-you.  There are so many controls, and so many overlapping control actions, that some of the actions involve holding certain buttons whilst pressing other buttons in a strictly timed sequence. If you do the button convolutions wrong in sequence or in timing then it just does something different - not what is needed. Near impossible for me to sort all that out when in the heat of battle against opposing ground and air forces - and needing to switch between three different player characters - all in the same helicopter!  Go to "Ammunation" gun ranges to practise shooting? No good. The shooting controls are different when in the gun range from those in the real world. I could not pass the first round of anything in the gun ranges.  The only player-controlled activity that I enjoyed in this game was to take a cross-country motorbike ride out over the hills to the coast, and take a swim in the ocean. For that activity there are simple controls, great graphics, and all at the player's own choice and control. But that activity is nothing to do with the "missions" of the game.  After playing for three weeks I uninstalled the game. I am glad I saw the graphics on a 2K PC monitor. Apart from that one pleasure I regard the experience as a waste of my money and a waste of my time.

Oh boy, where do I even begin with GTA V? It's like strapping yourself into a rocket-powered roller coaster that takes you on a thrill ride you never wanted to end! Here's my hilariously chaotic review of this insane game:  First off, let's talk about the story. It's like a crazy mashup of a Hollywood blockbuster, a soap opera, and a fever dream. You've got three protagonists: Michael, the retired bank robber who can't resist one last score; Franklin, the street-smart hustler with dreams of making it big; and Trevor, the absolute madman who's so unpredictable, you'll question your own sanity just by being in the same virtual universe as him. These characters are so outlandishly entertaining that you'll find yourself cheering for the bad guys and laughing maniacally at their ridiculous antics.The world of Los Santos is a sprawling playground of mayhem and debauchery. Want to go skydiving? Sure, why not! Feel like taking a leisurely drive through the city? Good luck avoiding the inevitable car crash or pedestrian pile-up because, let's be honest, following traffic rules is for boring people. And don't even get me started on the police chases. Nothing beats stealing a cop car, causing utter chaos, and then escaping by the skin of your teeth, all while laughing manically at the sheer absurdity of it all.

As an open action adventure game in a virtual world, GTA 5 is undoubtedly a very good game.  It offers a huge game world with a rich variety of missions and activities, full of excitement and challenges.   First of all, the game screen of GTA 5 is very exquisite, and the details are handled very well.  Whether it is city buildings, vehicle models or character movements, it all gives people a realistic feeling.  At the same time, the sound effects and soundtrack of the game are also very good, which can enhance the atmosphere and immersion of the game.   Secondly, the plot of GTA 5 is very exciting, full of suspense, excitement and surprises.  Players can play different roles and experience different story lines, which makes the game more attractive and deep.   In addition, GTA 5 also provides a variety of game content and activities.  Players can freely explore the game world, drive various vehicles, participate in various tasks and challenges, and can also play online multiplayer games with other players.  These diverse ways of playing make the game more fun.

I have owned this game since October of 2015. I have played this game, with the same two characters, on XBox 360, XBox One, and then migrated to PC. I have invested well over 3000 hours into this game. Needless to say, it was for a very long time one of my favorites, if not my favorite. For over a span of one year, it was the only game I played.  With the most recent actions of Rockstar, by removing vehicles we have not only grinded for, but some of us had literally paid for, to place them behind a subscription pay-wall, I am uninstalling this game. For nearly a decade, GTAV has been a staple in my gaming collection. No more. No longer can I condone what Rockstar has done to it's player base. No more can I sit idly by and ignore the grift. No more will I allow this complete and wholesale abuse by a publisher to continue.  No. More.  Goodbye Rockstar. Thnks fr th mmrs.

There are so many bugs you encounter every day that the game leaves you fuming after every session, and all these bugs are so very frequent like almost every session you would face multiple of such issues. Some of them are: A lot of times during missions you would get in your car but it wouldn't move. You are trying to enter a getaway vehicle during a mission as passenger and you would get stuck at the car door and not because the owner have not granted permission, the door would open but you would not be able to enter. During latest mercenaries update while doing charlie mission you would engage autopilot in your avenger but would not be able to enter the cockpit again.(There are so many bugs that listing them here would not make sense, go read a subreddit and you would know what I'm talking about) It usually takes forever to be able to join a public lobby and out of nowhere you are alone in the session, even when upnp is on and the nat settings are at moderate. The money aspect of the is also focused on selling shark cards, so most of the time you would spend on grinding for money.
