[h1] Review #31 [/h1] [b] Brief: [/b] Important thing I want to note first is that I am giving this a positive review purely for the Story Mode/Singleplayer Campaign. The storytelling was really great, visuals were great, combat was randomly good or bad due to how wacky the A.I likes to be, which can make for some funny moments too though. Other than that, GTA Online has, for me personally, lost its value over time but that also could just be that now I've grown up and the desires to play this game when I was younger have faded away. So, overall, I recommend this game if you are purely interested in the singleplayer part of it.  [u] Positives [/u] [list]     [*] Great singleplayer story (Fantastic characters and visuals)     [*] Huge map to explore around     [*] The driving mechanics feel great as well, as well as there are a huge variety of vehicles out there to drive/find     [*] Achievements (though there was also GTA Online achievements so getting them all is a pain mostly)  [/list] [u] Negatives [/u] [list]     [*] My experiences with the combat in this game have been between good and bad. Sometimes the A.I works just fine, sometimes they can be dumb, though this can make funny moments too. Especially cop car A.I.     [*] (Regarding GTA Online): Without friends I don't see this being much fun, especially considering if you wish to even try doing most of the heists, you need 4 people regardless. Then to mention, random lobbies in GTA Online can have lots of cheaters/hackers, whatever you wanna call them. Or just downright annoying people on a flying motorbike with rockets that wont let you put even a toe outside where you live without being eradicated from Los Santos.     [*] (Regarding GTA Online): Now I have no idea why they thought making enemies bullet sponges when selecting a harder difficulty for 1.5x reward was a good idea for making it harder. Yes, it does make it harder, by just making it more annoying and less fun to play. I cant believe you can shoot some of these enemies in the face multiple times and they just get right back up. Unless everyone is the Terminator, I don't understand why they absorb bullets. [/list] [i] "I'm not gonna tell you if you should buy it though, that's up to you to decide, I just provide my positive and negative experiences" - wamcrash [/i]

Vintage chocolate chip cookies  Ingredients 150g salted butter, softened 80g light brown muscovado sugar 80g granulated sugar 2 tsp vanilla extract 1 large egg 225g plain flour ½ tsp bicarbonate of soda ¼ tsp salt 200g plain chocolate chips or chunks Method STEP 1 Heat the oven to 190C/fan170C/gas 5 and line two baking sheets with non-stick baking paper.  STEP 2 Put 150g softened salted butter, 80g light brown muscovado sugar and 80g granulated sugar into a bowl and beat until creamy.  STEP 3 Beat in 2 tsp vanilla extract and 1 large egg.  STEP 4 Sift 225g plain flour, ½ tsp bicarbonate of soda and ¼ tsp salt into the bowl and mix it in with a wooden spoon.  STEP 5 Add 200g plain chocolate chips or chunks and stir well.  STEP 6 Use a teaspoon to make small scoops of the mixture, spacing them well apart on the baking trays. This mixture should make about 30 cookies.  STEP 7 Bake for 8–10 mins until they are light brown on the edges and still slightly soft in the centre if you press them.  STEP 8 Leave on the tray for a couple of mins to set and then lift onto a cooling rack.  RECIPE TIPS FREEZING THE BISCUITS If you’ve frozen the biscuits, take them out and arrange them on a lined baking sheet. Once defrosted, pop them in a medium oven 190C/170 fan/gas mark 5 and heat for 2-3 mins to crisp up. Don’t leave them too long or they’ll dry out. STORING DOUGH You can keep the uncooked dough in a sealed container in the fridge for up to two weeks. Simply take some out, dollop on a lined baking tray and allow to come up to room temperature for 5 mins before baking

[b]Single Player Review:[/b]  It's hard to believe that this game launched a decade ago, was built to run on machines with as little as 512 MB of RAM, a very optimized title, and was, most importantly, the most successful entertainment product in history, surpassing other games, movies, and music in revenue. With a very engrossing story that expands the concept of multiple protagonists and points of view, this blockbuster of a game will make you feel like you're in a truly Hollywoodian story. With all the pop culture references, all satirizing the American way of life, the game utilizes heavy scripting to trick you into thinking the engine is way more powerful than it really is. Talking about mechanics, [i]GTA[/i] is a dichotomy: while the car handling is very Arcade, the game takes into consideration the number of occupants in the car for handling, so this is very much a design choice. Unfortunately, the top speeds are very limited due to loading, and breaking and acceleration are greatly exaggerated. All this makes driving for hours in a city grid very relaxing, different from the predecessor, [i]GTA IV[/i], which was more like a simulator. While being a car game and a crime simulator makes all sense since you can try out any car you like, still owning and keeping collections in single-player is pretty flawed. We are talking about a game full of personality that feels alive, from the protagonists, NPCs, cars, and even the city. You will never see a sunset like others after thousands and thousands of hours of playing. This game survived three generations of consoles and almost a decade and made a challenge to Rockstar: how can you make a sequence for a title like [i]GTA V[/i]?  [b]Multi-Player Review:[/b]  GTA multi-player was not the focus of the developers at Rockstar at the start; it was more like a parallel project using the game assets to build another game that would add value to the overall experience. With not a lot of activities and glitches, the multiplayer start was bumpy back in 2013, but with free DLC after free DLC, the game started getting more and more content, ranging from new vehicles to new missions. [i]The Heists update[/i] introduced a single-player-quality narrative and story online in 2015. With the addition of being a CEO or Motorcycle gang leader in: [i]Further Adventures in Finance and Felony[/i] and [i]Bikers[/i] DLCs in 2016, GTA turned into a full MMOish experience, with stock in warehouses and drugs in your factories being built and persisting over time. At the same time, we started seeing the rise in the price of content go along with methods to make money as a way to incentivize microtransactions. with each DLC trying to top the one before. In 2017, we reached the peak of megalomania with flying cars and bikes and satellites with orbital laser strikes with The [i]Doomsday Heist[/i], and since the negative feedback, Rockstar has been dialing back on this type of content. In 2019, we had a new location, [i]The Diamond Casino & Resort[/i], featuring later on [i]The Diamond Heist[/i]. In 2020, Rockstar launched the biggest update with [i]The Cayo Perico Heist[/i], featuring top-quality content, ways of making money, and a whole new island. In 2021, we had a Fast & Furious-inspired update with [i]Los Santos Tuners[/i] and a later one featuring Dr. Dre and Franklin Clinton from the single-player story in [i]The Contract[/i], with each update being shaped more and more by community feedback. With cars resembling more real ones, we see a spike in prices and anti-consumer practices as the PC version of the game still has not received the Next Generation upgrade to boost sales on these consoles.  One of the building blocks of one of the most successful role-playing mods that dominates [i]Twitch[/i], [i]GTA Online[/i], has been the target of controversy when the developers try to shut down FiveM. With the excuse to battle Cheating, a battle that had been lost, and almost making me give this game a negative review, the peer-to-peer network structure where GTA Online is built and relies on does not give any security against cheating and modding, and the game is not built to take security factors into account, as well as not having a real anti-cheat system and some simple scripts that can be bypassed. So at any time, you can see your progress destroyed, and the fact that some people try to push the agenda that cheating in GTA is somewhat acceptable only makes the problem worse.  At some point in time ([i]some of these problems have been fixed, others have been partialy fixed[/i]), cheaters could: Set themselves in god mode, use aimbots or auto-aim in free aim sessions, use ESPs and have every information about you, teleport themselves anywhere in the map, teleport you, give you money, [strike]take money from you through the insurance system[/strike], freeze you in place, stick objects on your character or vehicle, spawn explosions on every player in the session, [strike]spawn explosions on players and make look like it was other player that have done it in the kill feed (framing)[/strike], [strike]change their RSC nick name for players inside a session[/strike], softlock missions, modify the damage of any given weapon, give you weapons, [strike]remove your weapons[/strike], prevent you from being a CEO/Biker leader, eject you from your vehicle, give bad sport points that at some point send you to a session with other bad sport players, remove reports given to them, kick you from your session, [strike]get inside your private session[/strike], [strike]leak of your IP and location[/strike], [strike]corrupt your Online save file[/strike], [strike]control de weather sessionwide[/strike], crash your game; and the list goes on.

After having played for over 200 hours of GTAV on PC, let alone the countless amount of hours I have also played on PS3, Xbox 360, PS4 Pro, and Xbox Series X and S, I recommend this game to anyone who is looking for a game that is as close to a real life simulator as you can get, as you can do a countless number of different things all throughout los santos, from robbing gas stations to buying and selling stocks and other things along with completing tasks and missions. I absolutely love this game, and I love the fact now that I can run it in 4K at over 140 FPS with a Ryzen 9 5950x and a RTX 4090. Absolutely stunning eye candy. It makes the game that much more enjoyable of an experience. The fact that it has been on sale a bunch as well makes it that much more of a deal. Between this game and Red Dead Redemption 2, these are my two favorite games from Rockstar as of today writing this review for everyone. Definitely give this game and Red Dead 2 a chance since both of them are on sale majority of the time and the gameplay is impressive, it will not disappoint you, especially if you are running a top of the line PC as I am. You definitely cannot go wrong with this game. I hope you all enjoy it as much as I do.

Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) is a masterpiece that sets the bar high for open-world action-adventure games. From the moment you step foot into the sprawling fictional city of Los Santos, you are transported into a meticulously crafted world filled with endless possibilities and exhilarating gameplay.  The attention to detail in GTA V is astounding. The graphics are stunning, with vibrant visuals that bring the city to life. The sprawling landscapes, bustling streets, and dynamic weather effects create a truly immersive experience. Whether it's driving through the winding roads of the countryside or exploring the bustling urban metropolis, every corner of Los Santos feels alive and vibrant.  The gameplay mechanics are polished and refined, offering a seamless blend of shooting, driving, and exploration. The missions and quests are incredibly diverse, providing a perfect balance between intense action sequences, thrilling heists, and engaging storylines. The three playable protagonists bring a unique twist to the game, offering distinct perspectives and adding depth to the narrative.  One of the standout features of GTA V is the online multiplayer mode, Grand Theft Auto Online. It offers an expansive open-world playground where you can team up with friends or engage in thrilling competitive challenges. The constant updates and additions to the multiplayer mode ensure that there's always something new and exciting to explore.  Beyond the gameplay, GTA V boasts a captivating and well-written story. The characters are richly developed, with complex motivations and intertwining narratives. The voice acting is top-notch, immersing you further into the lives and struggles of these characters.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V is a true gem in the gaming industry. It combines breathtaking visuals, immersive gameplay, a compelling storyline, and a thriving online multiplayer experience. Rockstar Games has crafted a game that captivates players for countless hours, providing an unparalleled level of entertainment. Whether you're a fan of action-adventure games or simply looking for an unforgettable gaming experience, GTA V is an absolute must-play.

It's GTA V. It's a fun game, but after Rockstar removed most of the anti-cheat earlier this year there's waaayy too many cheaters trying to get you banned... Worth to buy on sale.

To put things very simply, The game can be a fun time with friends. You can have private lobbies now and grind for cash and still have a ton of content or run from the cops with a friend for the nostalgia. However, there is no anti cheat and it's BAAAAD. People can rip your IP, kick you out of a lobby, teleport trap you, explode you, etc. This has been going on for a couple years now and getting worse and Rockstar has not addressed it, despite doing weekly updates and pushing content. They recently took over half the vehicles off the in game store that you can by with the in game currency, and put them behind a paywall you need to use real world money for. It's just not worth it and not worth spending money on for such a crappy experience. Between Red Dead 2 getting no love, and how they're going to try to mine us for money in GTA6 I'm not going to bother with many Rockstar games from here on out. They can't even provide a fair and safe online experience in their most popular game and would rather use it to nickle and dime their audience.

TLDR: Game's trash, Online carries trashier business model. - It's not even worth 10yo chewed bubblegum. I'd steer clear from R* at all times. (RDR2 is another disappointment, better than GTA V, but still bad)  Game's a carrot to hook you into Online - all of the sandboxing elements that made free-roam in single player any good were stripped or at bare minimum downgraded into virtual uselessness... There's no sandboxing to be found other than some scarce robberies that give close to nothing in terms of rewards, and do not raise any interesting gameplay aspects.  Story's all over the place, doesn't feel entertaining unless the player isn't cultured enough, otherwise it's a filler of cliches that have been told and seen countless times from a wide range of entertainment media (films, games, books, comics). This GTA fails to bring anything substantial and new, the handful of new things they did bring are walled or give as little engaging interaction as possible.  Truth to be told RDR2 surpasses this game in every single aspect, and RDR2 isn't an example of a good entertainment product itself, given it's tailored to milk money from players through online with the story mode also railing and removing a massive spectrum of sandboxing. Both games are handled as corpo greed cash-cows and nothing else.  GTA 5 also lacks any sort of significant updates to fix broken parts of the game, never got any updates to get it closer to completion (a lot of obviously cut content can still be seen), and it's worse on both gameplay and UX when compared to San Andreas. Ah, Grand Theft Auto V, the virtual embodiment of mayhem, mischief, and morally questionable life choices. With a collective playtime of 344 hours across all platforms, it's safe to say that I've spent more time indulging in virtual crime than I care to admit. And what a wild, exhilarating, and occasionally infuriating ride it has been.  Let's start with the story, shall we? GTA V offers a narrative that's equal parts dark and humorous, filled with colorful characters and twisted plot twists. From the heists that require careful planning to the random encounters that leave you questioning your own sanity, the story keeps you engaged, even if it occasionally veers into absurdity.  The open-world of Los Santos is a sprawling playground for those with a penchant for chaos. Whether you're cruising the streets in stolen sports cars, wreaking havoc with reckless abandon, or engaging in epic shootouts with the authorities, the sheer freedom of choice is undeniably enticing. Just be prepared for the occasional frustration when the police force seems to have an uncanny ability to teleport right on top of you.  The visuals in GTA V are undeniably impressive. The sunsets casting vibrant hues over the cityscape, the detailed textures of the bustling streets, and the attention to detail in the character models all contribute to creating an immersive and visually stunning experience. It's almost a shame that you're too busy causing chaos to truly appreciate the beauty of it all.  The gameplay mechanics are a mixed bag. On one hand, the shooting mechanics are solid, offering a satisfying blend of precision and chaos. On the other hand, the driving physics can feel like you're piloting a soapbox derby car on a butter-coated racetrack. And let's not forget the joy of being randomly flattened by an AI-controlled vehicle that seems to have no regard for your existence.  GTA Online, the game's multiplayer component, is a chaotic and unpredictable world of its own. It's a realm where everyone fancies themselves as criminal masterminds, engaging in high-stakes heists, and battling it out for supremacy in the streets. Just be prepared for a healthy dose of griefing, overzealous hackers, and the occasional twelve-year-old shouting profanities through their headset.  But amidst the chaos and occasional frustrations, there's a certain undeniable charm to GTA V. It's a game that invites you to unleash your inner anarchist, providing a guilty pleasure in the virtual realm. Whether you're pushing the boundaries of morality or just blowing off steam after a long day, GTA V offers an escape into a world where consequences matter little and mayhem is the order of the day.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V is a snarky and audacious playground for those who revel in digital anarchy. With its engaging story, visually stunning world, and an abundance of opportunities for mischief, it's no wonder I've spent 344 hours indulging in this virtual life of crime. Just remember to approach it with a healthy dose of irony and a willingness to embrace the chaos. After all, life is too short to always play by the rules.

GTA V is an amazing game. Seriously, it's absolutely incredible! The amount of things you can do in this game is mind-blowing. From the moment you start playing, you'll be hooked, trust me. The game was released back in 2013, but it continues to shine as one of the best games out there, offering an experience that is simply unmatched.  Let's start with the story mode, which offers an engaging narrative that keeps you hooked from start to finish. Without giving away any spoilers, I can assure you that the story is well-crafted, filled with twists and turns that will leave you wanting more. The length of the story mode ensures that you'll be entertained for many hours, providing a rich and immersive experience. Moreover, the diverse cast of main characters adds depth to the narrative, making it all the more enjoyable to play through. Whether you're in the mood for chaos or simply want to partake in some cool activities, GTA V's Director mode allows you the freedom to explore and experiment without constantly worrying about the police.  Moving on to GTA V Online, the multiplayer component of the game, the amount of content and things to do is mind-boggling. Rockstar Games has consistently provided updates and expansions that keep the online world fresh and exciting. You mentioned a few of the activities, such as bunker businesses, nightclub management, and selling special cargo and vehicles, but that only scratches the surface of what's available. The addition of heists, in particular, adds a cooperative element to the gameplay, allowing you to team up with friends or other players to pull off elaborate missions. The sheer variety of activities and the continuous support from the developers ensure that GTA V Online never feels stale or repetitive.  However, it's worth noting that the game's age does come with a few drawbacks. While the visuals were impressive in 2013, newer games have since surpassed them in terms of graphical fidelity. Additionally, some players have expressed concerns about the online component, specifically regarding balancing issues and the presence of microtransactions. Nevertheless, Rockstar Games continues to support the game and address player feedback, striving to maintain an enjoyable and fair experience for all.   WARNING Be aware of cheaters in GTA V Online. Some players may resort to cheating, using hacks or mods to gain unfair advantages or disrupt the gameplay experience. Cheaters can exhibit behaviors such as invincibility, unlimited resources, griefing, and money exploits. To minimize encounters with cheaters, it is recommended to play in private sessions with trusted friends or invite-only players. Rockstar Games actively combats cheaters and encourages reporting of suspected cheaters. Despite the presence of cheaters, don't let it discourage you from enjoying the vast and exciting world of GTA V Online with precautions in place.   FINAL SUMMARY :   If you're looking for an incredible gaming experience, I highly recommend giving GTA V a try. This game offers an outstanding adventure that will keep you entertained for hours on end. With its expansive open world and countless activities, there's never a dull moment. The story mode alone is worth diving into, with its thrilling narrative and well-developed characters that will have you invested from start to finish. And don't worry, the story is long, ensuring you'll have plenty of gameplay to enjoy.  But the excitement doesn't stop there! GTA V Online is a whole new world of possibilities. You can run businesses, participate in exhilarating heists, and explore a constantly evolving online world. The amount of content available is mind-blowing, and there's always something new to discover. Trust me, you won't run out of things to do.  Prepare to be blown away by the stunning graphics. The attention to detail in the world of Los Santos is absolutely breathtaking, making the experience feel incredibly immersive. And let's not forget the fantastic soundtrack that sets the perfect tone for every moment.  Oh, and there's even more! With the Director Mode, you can unleash your creativity and become a virtual filmmaker, creating your own custom scenes and movies within the game. It's an incredible feature that adds an extra layer of fun and excitement.  In conclusion, if you're seeking an amazing gaming experience that offers endless possibilities and entertainment, GTA V is the game for you. It's a thrilling adventure that will keep you engaged for countless hours. So go ahead, jump into the action, and prepare for an unforgettable journey in the world of GTA V!

Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) is an undeniable masterpiece that continues to captivate and thrill gamers, even years after its initial release. Rockstar Games' magnum opus is an amalgamation of exceptional storytelling, stunning visuals, an expansive open world, and an unmatched level of immersion. With its intricate attention to detail and relentless innovation, GTA V effortlessly earns a perfect 10/10 rating.  One of the standout features of GTA V is its unparalleled narrative. The game weaves a gripping tale of crime, ambition, and betrayal, revolving around three unique protagonists: Michael, a retired bank robber seeking a fresh start; Franklin, a skilled hustler with dreams of leaving the gang life behind; and Trevor, a volatile and unpredictable character who adds a layer of chaotic excitement to the mix. The interweaving storylines and character development are executed flawlessly, making for a truly immersive and unforgettable experience.  The sprawling world of Los Santos is a technological marvel that sets new standards for open-world gaming. The attention to detail is astounding, with a living, breathing city that feels alive. The cityscape is a sight to behold, with stunningly realistic graphics, breathtaking vistas, and a vibrant, bustling population. From the towering skyscrapers to the gritty back alleys, every corner of Los Santos exudes authenticity and realism.  The gameplay in GTA V is a perfect blend of action, exploration, and freedom. Whether you're engaging in high-speed car chases, engaging in intense shootouts, or simply taking a leisurely drive through the city, the controls are responsive and intuitive. The variety of missions and side activities provide endless hours of entertainment, ensuring that boredom is a non-existent concept within the game.  Multiplayer is another aspect where GTA V shines. Grand Theft Auto Online offers an expansive multiplayer experience, allowing players to explore the vast world of Los Santos with friends or join forces in various cooperative and competitive game modes. The constant updates and additions from Rockstar keep the multiplayer experience fresh and engaging, making it a thriving community that stands the test of time.  GTA V's soundtrack deserves special mention, featuring an eclectic mix of genres that perfectly complement the game's atmosphere. From the pulsating beats of modern hip-hop to the nostalgic tunes of classic rock, the radio stations in the game add an extra layer of immersion, creating unforgettable moments that are etched into players' memories.  In conclusion, GTA V is an unparalleled achievement in the gaming industry. Its masterful storytelling, breathtaking visuals, immersive world, and diverse gameplay mechanics make it a true revolution in the medium. Even years after its release, it continues to captivate and impress players, solidifying its place as one of the greatest video games ever made. With a perfect score of 10/10, GTA V stands as a testament to the limitless possibilities of interactive entertainment.

Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) is an open world action-adventure video game developed by Rockstar North and published by Rockstar Games. It was released in September 2013 for PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360, in November 2014 for PlayStation 4 and Xbox One, and in April 2015 for Microsoft Windows.  GTA V is the most successful entertainment product of all time, having sold over 160 million copies worldwide. It has also won numerous awards, including Game of the Year from multiple publications.  There are many reasons why GTA V is such an amazing game. Here are just a few:      The story is well-written and engaging. The game follows three protagonists, Michael, Franklin, and Trevor, as they try to make their way in the world of crime. The story is full of twists and turns, and it keeps you hooked from beginning to end.     The characters are complex and well-developed. Each of the three protagonists is a fully realized character with their own motivations and goals. You really get to know them as you play the game, and you'll find yourself rooting for them, even though they're all criminals.     The world is incredibly detailed and realistic. Los Santos, the fictional city where the game is set, is based on Los Angeles. It's a sprawling metropolis with everything you could ever want to do, from exploring the city's many landmarks to committing crimes and causing chaos.     The gameplay is incredibly varied and fun. There's something for everyone in GTA V. You can race cars, fly planes, go on heists, and even play golf. There's no shortage of things to do in this game.     The multiplayer mode is incredibly addictive. GTA Online is a massive multiplayer mode that allows you to play with up to 30 other players. You can team up to complete heists, race cars, or just cause mayhem. It's a lot of fun, and it's easy to get sucked in for hours on end.  GTA V is an amazing game that has something for everyone. It's a must-play for any fan of open world action-adventure games.  In addition to the reasons listed above, GTA V is also notable for its groundbreaking use of technology. The game's graphics are some of the best ever seen in a video game, and the physics engine is incredibly realistic. GTA V also features a number of innovative gameplay features, such as the ability to switch between the three protagonists at will. I am a 59-year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing Grand Theft Auto V. I am a single father to my son, who is now 5. My son recently started playing Grand Theft Auto V. In less than a week, he had already played for over 20 hours. This was terrible for me because it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son because he was always out with his friends or watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account to play with my son. I started playing, but this was my first time playing a video game since the 90's, so I was quite lost. I asked my son for help, and together we spent some hours playing Grand Theft Auto V. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my son since my wife had died. Playing video games reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought me and my son closer again, and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well.

Ok game.  UPDATED REVIEW: After spending even more hours, I could say that it is a very good game. There are multiple types of businesses and honestly, you should just focus on having fun with these businesses. People nowadays are very stuck up with min-maxing everything to the point where they want to get the most amount of cash possible in the smallest amount of time and as someone who has been through that point, I could say that it makes the game quite boring at a certain point. Focus less on being efficient, try and find a business that you find fun, and do whatever you want and enjoy the game.  Some downsides that are apparent in this game are the number of cheaters that are able to freely roam around servers. There is also this glitch that I have been through ever since my first few hours of the game wherein when I open my in-game phone, and go to quick jobs, then join a heist alone, I am always stuck in this infinite loading screen loop. I have already searched it up on Reddit, some say that it is a problem with my internet, but some say it's a problem with Rockstar servers.   Playing with friends is also very easy and the overall user interface of the game is easy to deal with. It's also not a pay to win game, but it's a pay to get a head start type of game. I have played GTA 5 online across several of my accounts before and it is also disappointing how Rockstar decided to remove hundreds of cars from the game, I find it very unnecessary.  Now is a very good time to play GTA 5 because of how there are even more concurrent players than ever before, meaning that servers are very lively and you wont really feel brain dead in doing Rockstar's repetitive missions.

In the earlier phase of playing the game I enjoyed the game, including Story Mode and Online, even right now I would say that story mode is great but the story is too short and the map and story feels too small compared to the story and side missions experienced in SanAndreas. One could just complete the whole story in less than 4 days. Now coming to the online mode the big reason I would not recommend people to go for it because of my recent experiences of the online mode, and I would also recommend people with limited budget to rather wait for GTA VI instead of buying this because as soon as GTA VI is released all the focus of Rock Star will move towards Vi which would lead to no to meager updates in GTA V. Concluding that getting to my present Online experience, right now the game is in more bad condition than it was an year ago, as I am experiencing more in game bugs, increase in hackers and multiple online sessions resulting failure, I would say that if I am playing 1 Hrs in a day in online mode then I'm actually only able to play only 40 Minutes maximum because minimum 20 minutes are being taken by bugs, hackers, session initialisation, mission start and exit initialisation, session faults. which in the end leads to more frustration rather than entertainment. My personal mission experience - I was stuck at the end point of Online mission when I was delivering the cargo to a location when my vehicle stopped moving once I reached the delivery marker when I was required to move the vehicle inside a garage but was unable to because of being stuck at the marker with vehicle not moving my character unable to get out of vehicle, then I killed myself and re did the mission and again same bug. recently when I purchased an apartment I was trying to the apartment i purchased in online mode the game got all blacked out and stopped sunning. I had to stop the game and start again. on a mission I was to hide my presence from others I hid in a place as I was being hunted by other players due to one mission in online when I was hiding in an underground parking I was suddenly teleported to another location and killed by some player who was already there aiming at me in waiting as if he knew I would appear there, then I thought it might have been a bug, but when I hid again that thing continued to happen for at least 10 times till the timer was over and the hacker and bug did my game so bad that even after the end of the mission I was unable to exit the mission I was stuck at the mission timer reaching 00:00 me being unable to exit until I switched to story mode and enter another session. This is one list of harassment going on in game these days so i won't recommend anyone buying this and rather wait for GTA VI another reason being too less online players so less that it is getting to hard to get even 4 players to sometimes host a mission. I would say GTA V is nearing its end.

I will say, this is a classic game (almost too classic considering it came out in 2015 and we still dont have a sequel yet), but I have to not recommend it for two main reasons.  1) There is a severe lag issue when it comes to driving too fast. This is surprisingly one of the few games I have had to tinker with significantly to make it play well enough and that came with the issue of having to lower the graphics a lot. I don't believe it was my computer as this is a major issue that you can look up and see multiple people having on different hardware.  2) The online is filled with hackers and cheaters. Rockstar is unreliable when it comes to protecting their consumers so I would have to say if you don't know how to protect yourself well, then you shouldn't risk it because no one will be looking out for you.  If you only plan on playing the story and don't mind tinkering with your system to make it run well, then it is a good game. But if you plan on playing online or don't have the patience for fixing the game, then pass on this.

Grand Theft Auto V is an absolute masterpiece that deserves every bit of praise it receives. Rockstar Games has truly outdone themselves with this open-world extravaganza, providing an immersive, captivating, and endlessly entertaining experience for players.  First and foremost, the graphics in GTA 5 are breathtaking. The attention to detail is astounding, from the realistic lighting and weather effects to the stunningly rendered environments. The game effortlessly transports you to the sprawling metropolis of Los Santos, creating a living, breathing world that feels alive and vibrant.  The gameplay mechanics in GTA 5 are exceptional, offering a seamless blend of action, driving, and exploration. The controls are intuitive and responsive, making it easy to navigate the vast cityscape and engage in thrilling missions. Whether you're embarking on high-speed chases, engaging in intense gunfights, or simply indulging in some leisurely activities, the gameplay is consistently engaging and satisfying.  One of the standout features of GTA 5 is its incredible storytelling. The game boasts a rich and complex narrative, following the lives of three protagonists: Michael, Franklin, and Trevor. Each character is unique and well-developed, and their intertwining stories provide a level of depth rarely seen in open-world games. The writing is sharp, the dialogue is witty, and the voice acting is top-notch, creating an immersive experience that keeps you invested from start to finish.  In addition to the main storyline, GTA 5 offers a staggering amount of content and activities to enjoy. From engaging in heists and missions to participating in various side quests and challenges, there's always something new and exciting to discover. The multiplayer component, GTA Online, further extends the game's longevity, allowing players to team up with friends or engage in thrilling competitive modes.  Furthermore, Rockstar Games has demonstrated exceptional post-launch support for GTA 5. Regular updates and content expansions have kept the game fresh and engaging, introducing new missions, vehicles, and gameplay modes. The dedication to the player community is commendable and ensures that the GTA 5 experience continues to evolve over time.  In conclusion, GTA 5 on Steam is an absolute triumph of game design. With its stunning visuals, captivating gameplay, compelling storytelling, and vast amount of content, it sets the bar high for open-world games. Whether you're a fan of action, adventure, or simply exploring a vibrant virtual world, GTA 5 delivers an unforgettable experience that will keep you coming back for more.

GTA 5 Online: where you can embrace the chaos and let loose your wild side, but unfortunately, some players take it a step too far. Picture this: you're cruising down the virtual streets of Los Santos, minding your own business, when suddenly you hear it—a player spewing slurs like a malfunctioning censor machine. It's like they attended the School of Profanity and graduated with honors. But fear not, because GTA 5 has a secret weapon: the mute button! With one swift click, you can silence those foul-mouthed troublemakers and get back to enjoying the game. Remember, folks, virtual mayhem is fun, but spreading love and laughter is where the real party's at!

Considering how the remote code exploit has still not been addressed publically, considering how the online game works on PC still running on peer to peer even though it is "masked" through proxies this game is still a cyber-security hazard for anyone playing it. This is on top of all the bad decisions on the part of Rockstar and Take Two, squeezing every last penny out of the playerbase as if this game was a free to play. But instead of it being free to play to this day it costs 80% of what i paid for it in 2016, 40 euros. It's not simply enough that someone purchases a game, no no we have to milk them for every penny after. I get it, it's just greed and opportunity. But I don't have to agree with it or think it is moral.  For anyone who sees this review and wishes to play singleplayer safely, look into a firewall plugin and block every one of GTA:Online gateways. (Yes, a modder can mess with your singleplayer game and potentially inject malicious code into it as well)  What a mess..

4.5/10 - They are only keeping up with this game to sell you sharkcards. They just released an update that removed a lot of cars from being purchasable unless you pay for their SUBSCRIPTION.   The game sort of holds a monopoly on this type of game the "online open world crime GTA-esque" so they can afford to be incredibly lazy unless it's an endeavor to increase the chances that you buy those sharkcards. This guise of being a "sandbox" game while having many more MMO elements to the game is quite disingenuous.   By the way... they still haven't fixed the hackers. Every lobby on free-play has AT LEAST 1 hacker, many have half a dozen. What's almost worse is that the problems that hackers bring to this game were ALREADY present in the game - Griefing. Greifing is so bad in this game that it can be downright unplayable is most public lobbies that they fairly recently HAD to make it so you could run your organizations and businesses in a private session to get away from them.   This game is an insidious waste of energy and money. You're only somewhat better off buying this on console

Rating: ★★★★★  Review:  Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) is an absolute masterpiece that has set the bar high for open-world gaming. Developed by Rockstar Games, this fifth installment in the iconic Grand Theft Auto series offers an unparalleled experience that seamlessly blends a gripping storyline, immersive gameplay, and a vast, living world.  One of the standout features of GTA V is its captivating narrative. The game follows the lives of three protagonists: Michael, a retired bank robber seeking redemption; Franklin, a street-smart hustler looking for a way out of the gang life; and Trevor, a volatile and unpredictable character with a penchant for chaos. The intertwining stories of these characters create a rich and engaging plot that keeps players hooked from start to finish.  The attention to detail in GTA V is truly remarkable. The sprawling city of Los Santos and its surrounding areas are meticulously crafted, offering a stunningly realistic and dynamic environment. From the bustling streets filled with pedestrians and traffic to the diverse landscapes that range from urban areas to the picturesque countryside, every corner of this world feels alive and vibrant.  The gameplay mechanics in GTA V are polished and refined, providing a seamless and enjoyable experience. Whether you're engaging in high-speed car chases, participating in adrenaline-pumping heists, or simply exploring the vast open world, the controls are intuitive and responsive. The game also offers a wide range of activities and side missions, ensuring that there's always something new and exciting to discover.  One of the most impressive aspects of GTA V is its online multiplayer mode, Grand Theft Auto Online. This mode allows players to explore the world of Los Santos with friends, engage in cooperative missions, or compete against each other in various game modes. The constant updates and additions to the online mode have kept the community engaged and the experience fresh, making it a significant value addition to an already outstanding game.  Visually, GTA V is a stunning achievement. The graphics are breathtaking, with detailed character models, realistic lighting, and impressive environmental effects. The attention to detail extends to the sound design as well, with a stellar soundtrack and voice acting that brings the characters to life.  However, it's worth noting that GTA V does contain mature content and themes, which may not be suitable for all players. The game's portrayal of violence, crime, and adult situations is integral to its narrative, but it's important to exercise discretion when considering its suitability for younger audiences.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V is a true masterpiece that excels in every aspect. Its gripping storyline, immersive gameplay, stunning visuals, and expansive open world make it a must-play for any fan of the genre. Rockstar Games has once again raised the bar for open-world gaming, and GTA V stands as a testament to their unparalleled craftsmanship.

GTA V, developed by Rockstar Games, is an absolute masterpiece that has captivated gamers worldwide with its immersive gameplay, stunning graphics, and vast open-world environment. This game is an extraordinary experience that seamlessly combines thrilling action, compelling storytelling, and a remarkable attention to detail.  One of the most remarkable aspects of GTA V is its meticulously crafted open-world setting. Los Santos is a sprawling metropolis, packed with diverse neighborhoods, towering skyscrapers, and picturesque landscapes. Whether you're cruising along the bustling city streets or exploring the serene countryside, the level of detail and realism is truly astonishing. The world feels alive, with pedestrians going about their daily routines and vehicles zipping by, creating an unparalleled sense of immersion.  The three main protagonists, Michael, Franklin, and Trevor, are brilliantly written characters, each with their own distinct personalities and motivations. The game effortlessly weaves their stories together, providing a compelling narrative that keeps players engaged from start to finish. The voice acting is top-notch, further enhancing the believability and depth of the characters.  The gameplay mechanics in GTA V are a perfect blend of action, exploration, and freedom. The variety of missions and activities available is staggering, ensuring that there is never a dull moment. From heart-pounding heists and intense shootouts to engaging side quests and exhilarating races, the game offers endless hours of entertainment. The controls are intuitive, making it easy to navigate the world and unleash chaos or pursue a more strategic approach.  The multiplayer component, GTA Online, is a whole other realm of excitement. It allows players to dive into a persistent online world, where they can team up with friends or engage in competitive gameplay. The constant updates and additions to GTA Online have kept the experience fresh, with new missions, vehicles, and events regularly introduced to the game. The social aspect of GTA Online adds an extra layer of enjoyment, as you can explore the world with friends and create your own stories.  Visually, GTA V is a stunning achievement. The attention to detail in the environments, character models, and lighting effects is breathtaking. Whether you're admiring the beautiful sunsets over the ocean or marveling at the intricate cityscape, the game's graphics are nothing short of remarkable. Combined with a dynamic soundtrack that perfectly complements the gameplay, GTA V creates an immersive audiovisual experience that pulls you into its world.  In conclusion, GTA V is an outstanding game that deserves all the praise it has received. With its vast open world, captivating characters, engaging gameplay, and stunning visuals, it offers an unparalleled gaming experience. Whether you're a fan of action-packed adventures, compelling narratives, or simply want to explore a richly detailed world, GTA V is an absolute must-play. Strap in, prepare for an unforgettable journey, and let the chaos unfold in this masterpiece of modern gaming.

Imagine, if you will. A game about cars.  The game has hundreds of cars, with new cars every update.  Some base game cars/early DLC cars get left in the dust, and ultimately they clutter up in-game websites.  Now, what would you do if you had to clean up the in-game websites?  Would you:  A. Create a new website for the base game/early DLC cars?  B. Add all of the early cars to the spawn pool so they can spawn in the world, and remove them from the websites? Allowing players to pluck them off the streets if they want them?  C. Remove almost 200 base game/early DLC vehicles from the websites, and basically make some cares IMPOSSIBLE to get on PC?  Guess what options Rockstar went with. (It was C.)  This is a blatant cash-grab move from Rockstar to add these cars behind a paywall later on.   This, along with YEARS of not updating the in-game economy makes GTA Online as grindy as modern MMORPG games.   Plus, if this is how GTA Online turns out, that means GTA Online 2 (or whatever it will be with GTA 6) will be just as bad.  I can't see myself playing GTA 6, not even the story mode. I don't want to support scummy business practices.

Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) is a game that exists in a league of its own. Having logged in an impressive 369 hours on the game, I can confidently say that Rockstar Games has once again outdone themselves in creating a world that is not just vast and beautiful, but also vibrant, chaotic, and full of life. It's a testament to the meticulous attention to detail and the phenomenal execution of design concepts that permeates every aspect of this game. I unequivocally recommend this game to anyone seeking an immersive, thrilling, and grandeur-filled gaming experience.  From the outset, the narrative of Grand Theft Auto V is compelling, weaving together the storylines of three distinct protagonists: Michael, Trevor, and Franklin. Each character is uniquely flawed and equipped with a depth and complexity that keeps you invested in their journeys. The narrative jumps between these characters, serving up a rich tapestry of criminal undertakings that's both humorous and harrowing, reflecting the diverse realities of the fictional city of Los Santos and the surrounding Blaine County.  The mission design in GTA V deserves a heap of praise. Each task is meticulously detailed and varied, never letting the player settle into complacency. From high-stakes heists to casual errands that inevitably spiral out of control, every mission contributes to the broader narrative and character development in a meaningful way. The heist missions, in particular, are an innovative element that allow you to take part in planning, preparing, and executing elaborate criminal ventures.  The open-world aspect of the game is arguably one of the most detailed and immersive ever created. Los Santos and its surrounding areas are strikingly vast and offer a multitude of activities. You can indulge in street races, go hunting in the wilderness, play golf, trade in the stock market, or just explore the bustling city and its outskirts. Every corner of the game is meticulously crafted with a level of realism that's breath-taking. The game's dynamic weather system and day-night cycle add to the immersive experience, making the game world feel alive and constantly changing.  GTA V's gameplay mechanics are superb, providing a satisfying mix of driving and combat. The driving mechanics feel responsive and varied across the wide range of vehicles available, each with their unique handling characteristics. The combat system, too, is robust with a cover system that is intuitive, and a wide range of weapons each with distinctive pros and cons. Moreover, the introduction of the special abilities for each protagonist adds an extra layer of depth to the gameplay mechanics.  Online multiplayer, introduced via Grand Theft Auto Online, provides a wholly different experience that further expands the game's shelf-life. Here, you can team up or compete with players around the globe in a variety of missions, races, and deathmatches, or simply roam the world freely causing mayhem. The continuous content updates from Rockstar keep this mode fresh and engaging, ensuring there's always something new to explore or achieve.  Graphically, the game remains impressive even years after its initial release, with stunning visual effects and detailed character models. The in-game sound, too, is excellent with a high-quality voice acting that breathes life into the characters and an extensive, genre-spanning soundtrack that complements the game's atmosphere brilliantly.  The game isn't without its flaws, though. The police AI can sometimes feel frustratingly relentless, and the load times, especially for GTA Online, can be lengthy. However, these issues are minor when compared to the wealth of content and meticulously crafted gaming experience that GTA V offers.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto V is an absolute masterpiece of interactive storytelling, combining a compelling narrative, stunning graphics, a wide array of gameplay mechanics, and a detailed, dynamic world that feels genuine and vast. Moreover, the game's willingness to tackle themes of crime, morality, and the American Dream through its narrative and characters shows a depth of storytelling that goes beyond what one might expect from an open-world action-adventure game.  Rockstar’s trademark satirical social commentary is peppered throughout the game, adding a layer of intelligence and wit to the narrative. From the in-game TV shows and websites to the various NPCs you encounter, GTA V's keen critique of contemporary society makes the game feel grounded and real, despite its more outrageous elements.  Another noteworthy aspect of Grand Theft Auto V is its wide array of side activities. The game is filled with additional missions, hobbies, and pastimes that are optional but add further depth and immersion to the game. These can range from investing in real estate or the stock market, to participating in triathlons, stunt jumps, or even hunting for collectibles. These side activities not only help flesh out the world but also serve as a diversion from the main storyline, offering opportunities to delve deeper into the game's mechanics and universe.  Furthermore, Rockstar's dedication to updating and refining Grand Theft Auto Online has also added significant value to the game, long after its initial release. New heists, missions, and vehicles keep the multiplayer mode fresh and exciting, encouraging players to keep returning to the world of Los Santos and Blaine County. Plus, the addition of user-created content in the form of jobs and races contributes to an ever-expanding universe for players to explore and enjoy.  However, no game is perfect, and Grand Theft Auto V is no exception. While the AI has significantly improved from previous iterations, it can still behave erratically at times, occasionally pulling you out of the immersion. In addition, some players might find the game's depiction of violence and use of explicit language offensive, although these elements are indeed consistent with the game's mature and gritty narrative.  In summary, Grand Theft Auto V is an unparalleled achievement in the realm of video games. Its compelling narrative, coupled with a vast, vibrant world, intuitive gameplay, and an ever-evolving online component, make it a game that stands the test of time. Despite minor shortcomings, GTA V offers a gaming experience that is both thrilling and deeply engaging, making it a must-play for any serious gamer. It's a captivating journey into the dark underbelly of the American dream, offering a compelling exploration of its characters' complex personalities and motivations. I cannot recommend it enough.

A publisher that REMOVES nearly two hundred vehicles "to streamline the shopping experience" ten years after release to put them behind a paywall that PC users can't access is the epitome of thumbing their nose at their users. I came back to the game after a long hiatus and find (found) collecting the cars to customize to be the most enjoyable thing about returning. Maybe I like driving the cars that no one else does. Maybe I'll never "buy" them. Maybe I would have "bought" them all. Either way, if they were available to us once, then they should continue to be so. Would you accept a car company entering your garage to remove the turbocharger that you bought with your car? Or worse, that company telling you that if you want to have the turbocharger that you'll now have to pay a premium? It's slimy.

In the flour attic, crackling cookie jars danced in the laundry napkin, while crocodile soup jazzily hops on the cloud carpet. Space pirates cleaved dark sourdoughs while stardust laughed in symphonic discord. The snake god clipped feather-light with the screwdriver, while the grapevines fenced in sniffling elephant herds. Dewdrops discussed quantum physics with intertwined kittens and discovered that the harmony of time lay in a lost sock at a cosmic party. Summer rain waltzed with the indecisive thoughts of the hourglass, while the rusty trumpet sang love songs to anxious rainbow flies. The windmill spun dreamily among the lost breaths of a blue whale, and the misplaced key to the essence of everything was found under a talking mushroom.
